Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: AppleKris
Reviews.Content: I ended up at this hotel by winning my bid on priceline.com. Let me start off by saying, thank God I didn't pay hotel value for this room! Very expensive hotel for next to nothing amenities... The room was tiny! There were two of us and let me tell you, we had no room to move around. The toilet is literally next to the bed, at least there is a door that you can shut in the bathroom, but that was not pleasant!!! One little window in the room that opens up only a few inches. There is not a pool or hot tub. The restaurant and bar were tiny as well. I just didn't find anything enjoyable about this hotel. The only staff that were friendly were the door men. The upside to this stay was the location. This hotel is right in prime location for shopping, restaurants, bars, the lake, and so much more... But I wouldn't stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Thehungrytraveller99
Reviews.Content: The standard king room was more roomy than I would have expected. My wife and I chose the cheapest room available because we knew we were going to spend very little time in it. It was beautifully appointed and I was really impressed with the washroom. I was also pleasantly surprised with the workout equipment which had the latest cardio equipment, a workout station and a decent rack of dumbells. More than enough to address the guilt you feel after your over-indulgence the night before. The Hotel is nicely situated in the Gold Coast section of the city close to Michigan ave (about a 1 min walk) and great restaurants. The hotel offers wifi for $10 a day. There is an abundance of Starbuck's in this area in particular, a large Starbucks located on Rush St that is a short 3 min walk from the hotel . With so many Starbucks all over the city offering free wifi , I really never needed to pay for it. The staff was friendly enough however not as enthusiastic as the staff at the Talbot Hotel. For example, the doorman at the Talbot would see you coming and open the door for you The doorman at the knickerbocker was always too involved in conversation with the valet. (Just an observation not a criticism) That being said, I would choose the Knickerbocker over the Talbot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but has its Issues”
Reviews.Author: TPoppleton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 5 days. Pros: The hotel is situated in a good location. Close to the Navy Pier, shopping and restaurants. The rooms are lovely but on the smaller side. Everyone was helpful however their help only went so far. Cons: Free internet service is only available in the lobby and getting connected was a challenge, when you could get connected. Paid Internet service is available in guest rooms for a 24hrs period however after 12hrs it asks for your room and name to bill again. The hotel service book advertises that the concierge desk will arrange for packages to be mailed out however I ended up having to go find a fedex location as the hotel could not handle my request.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 10Bear
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful weekend in the city staying here - perfect location to restaurants and shopping - and if it were warmer - the beach! The room and bath were classy - enjoyed the rain shower! Everything was very clean and new. Breakfast at "The Nix" restaurant was excellent - vegetable omelet and orange granola pancakes that our server shared some secret recipe tricks about with us! I can't wait to do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four start 2.5 at best”
Reviews.Author: Janette G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker in Chicago.IL. for 3 nights. The hotel rates itself as a four star, But I beg to deffer! Yes the staff is very friendly and professional but that's where it ends. The rooms are tiny, the toilet flusher fell inside the toilet. the blow dryer broke, I had to change room because when I got back from hours of being away, the toilet was still broker and the maids left no new shampoo, conditioner or soap. that happened two times.They up graded me to a larger room and the heater did not work. They claim that is is an old hotel and that when the temp. outside is 50 degrees or over it only blows cold air. they gave me a portable heater. In the morning I put on a cup of coffee and tried to blow dry my hair. The power went out in my room! I just started laughing MAO. I have stayed at 2 star hotels that were much, much better. The Knickerbocker Hotel in Chicago was given a face lift and they forgot the bones. This hotel is falling apart . And I'm being nice! For all of my trouble and my non-relaxing stay all I was offered was a free breakfast. You have been warned,stay at your own RISK!!! Stay at the Embassy Suites much better Hotel by far! Best of luck if U stay here, Janette hotel expert!

Reviews.Title: “staying in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: C J A
Reviews.Content: Come to Chicago on occasion and try to use Priceline, name your own price feature, always hoping that the Millenium Knickerbocker will be the hotel selected. Close to all the main downtown areas, great rooms, even if a bit small. Very comfortable place, friendly staff and outstanding valet parking personnel. Going to be there next month and looking forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago experience”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker for 5 nights in conjunction with our son's wedding in Chicago. The reception was held at the Knickerbocker. The customer service attitude of the Knickerbocker was second to none. From the valet parking guys, the front desk staff, the banquet staff and service - everything was wonderful. The food and service at the reception were first class - our guests were very impressed. Our room was very nice and the staff was very cooperative with additional room reservations, upgrades, changes, etc. Each request was met with a positive response. I would highly recommend the Knickerbocker not only for it's excellent location near the Magnificent Mile but more importantly for its wonderful customer service attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: echodumby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after special event at the Four Seasons. The location was very convient, very close to the L and right off the Mag. Mile. We had reserved our room thought the Knickerbocker website and got an excellent deal that was made even better when we were upgraded to a suite upon arrival. The room was very omfortable and had a very nice shower and bath. The staff was very courteous and they kept our luggage for us while we were shopping after we had checked out. The two problems we encountered were that the in-room Internet cost an additional $10 a day which seemed a bit ridiculous for such an expensive hotel already, and the hallways were pretty loud due to very thin entry doors. Overall, we had an excellent stay and would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated rooms, however a bit small”
Reviews.Author: ncisthebest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Millenium Knickerbocker for a sunday night. The room seemed to be recently updated with modern amenities. Very very clean. King size bed, very comfortable. We requested a partial lake view in higher floors, there is really not a view but nearly all downtown chicago hotels are like that. We had room service, the staff members were professional and very nice. My only complain is the room size is a bit small. But for how much we paid for that location, can't really complain that much. There was no tub, just a shower (very nice one!) in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated rooms, but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Lauren S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker for two nights. The room was nicely updated with modern amenities. We especially liked the rain shower. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was right next to Michigan Avenue and about two blocks from Sprinkles Cupcakes! The negatives - our room looked like it had never been dusted. We could see dust everywhere. Another problem - we left our room at 10am and made sure the sign said we wanted our room cleaned. We came back at 3pm and our room STILL had not been cleaned! The lady finally showed up to clean at 5pm, but by then we were too frustrated and didn't want to wait in the hallway for her to clean, so we only took new towels. Third, we wanted to use the in room safe, but it did not work. Lastly, a worker came to our room around 6pm when we were trying to relax who said he had to come in and check the mini bar to see if anything had been eaten. Wouldn't they check to see if we purchased anything from the mini bar after we checked out to add to our bill?? Very strange! We most likely will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: mamarosa1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Knickerbocker last Saturday night. It was great. The bed and pillows wrapped themselves around you - so comfortable. The staff was great. We had breakfast in the morning at the resturant - a little pricey, but good. There was a wedding going on in the lobby, but no problem with noise in our room from it. There was a coffee maker in the room. The room had a flat screen T.V. The bathroom was great, with a daisy shower head and a hand held shower head. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice during their winter specials”
Reviews.Author: csgc
Reviews.Content: Whether this hotel has a convenient location depends on whether you prefer access to the metro or to shopping. It is one block east of Michigan Avenue on the far end of Magnificent Mile shopping. For people who plan to shop and intend to ride buses or take a cab, this is a nice location. If you plan to use the subway trains, however, there is a hike to get to the nearest station at Chicago. I chose the hotel because it has good winter specials. During the tourist-filled summer months, I find their rates too high.The room is nice, the bed quite comfortable and the shower perfect. Check-in and -out service was just ok. There is free internet access in the lobby and $9.99 service in the room. My favorite feature of this hotel is the bar. As a single woman I felt comfortable stopping by for a drink or hanging out on the sofas nearby to use the free internet. There is an Original Pancake House about 5-6 blocks away for a traditional breakfast. The cheapest parking is at Millennium underground; unload your car for the duration of your visit and use public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: PhatChick
Reviews.Content: Our 4-some spent the weekend in the magnificent city to catch ShowBoat at the Civic Opera House and do restaurant week. We enjoyed the location of the hotel very much. The Friday nite we checked in there was an Northwest U medical school party in the ball room that spilled out to the martini bar. Those participants were juvenile, loud, obnoxoius and very drunk. The bartender handled them well. He was very attentive to us, but we just could not handle the young loud crowd so the staff recommended the Drake bar across the street for some quiet jazz. We had a great time and closed that place down. We were grateful for the recommendation. The rooms are very small everywhere is Chicago, this was no different. But the room was clean and the beds comfy. The pillows were not feather, but we survived. Would definitely stay again. The deals on Hotel.com are great. Do not pay full-price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: haparev
Reviews.Content: Service is really good here. It did take a little longer to check in than at other hotels, but it was fine. The rooms are nice. The bathroom is to die for. Glass shower doors, with option of handheld shower or overhead rain shower. Really big closet. Not my favorite coffee maker, but it was fine (the kind where you put the little plastic drawer holding coffee into the slot in the front). Wireless internet for $9.95 wasn't too slow. The bed was really comfortable. The room is a bit smaller, but I don't think you should stay in this neighborhood in this city if you're looking for a sprawling room like you could get out in the burbs. The point of a hotel in Chicago is to be in Chicago! Also, I got a fantastic deal on hotels.com. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: hussain13
Reviews.Content: It is quite a nice hotel with a great location. Just one block away from the Hancock tower and the water place. Provides great access to shopping on the magnificent mile. The rooms are clean and good. Staff is helpful. The beds were a bit squeaky tough, maybe because of the frame. The mattresses are very soft, so if you like firm or semi soft; this might not be for you. No free internet in the room, free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: MHJW
Reviews.Content: My family and I absolutely loved our stay at this beautiful hotel. The service was exceptional...the concierge and doormen were very friendly and the restaurant manager even greeted us by name. This is an excellent location for the best shopping and dining. The hotel was lovely mixing elegant historical decor with modern luxury. We would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character and nicely upgraded along the way”
Reviews.Author: Steve538
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker for two nights on business. The hotel has lots of charm and character, reflective of its age, but has also been nicely upgraded somewhat recently. The guestrooms are very comfortable, with quality furnishings, a nice flat screen, and a stylish bathroom. Overall the hotel was very quiet and the location was extremely convenient to the Magnificent Mile, quality restaurants, Lake Michigan, and other attractions downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and very convenient to the Magnificient Mile”
Reviews.Author: efy2178
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton right next store. These hotels are similar. Parking is expensive, however. It costs 55.00 a day for valet parking and 35 if you park your own car--10.00 more if you have an SUV. Hotel service is friendly- room is very clean. Modern bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Pinkhouseliz
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous and friendly. Given that we were spending two nights at the Knickerbocker so I could undergo medical treatment we prized the quiet but convenient location. The recent renovations were nice but still kept the charm of an old hotel. I usually dig deep for a bargain when I travel, however I would be more than happy to pay "regular" price to stay at the Knickerbocker and that is saying something. The beds provided above average comfort and the bathrobe was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, great concierge but needs a little updating”
Reviews.Author: cjg2901
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was extremely helpful. The concierge made some excellent recommendations for dinner. Rosebuds and RL. Both were great. RL was fantatic. We had a larger room, but it needed some updates. It looks a little worn, but it was clean and convenient. Don't go to the contemporary art museum, waste of time. But the See It All city tour was very good and it was recommended by the hotel. The breakfast French Toast was excellent and again wonderful wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bzibzia
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Millennium Knickerbocker over the holidays. The room was quite nice and well appointed, with separate entrance area, walk-in closet with a vanity (more light needed there), and a good size bathroom with double size shower (no bathtub). The rooms were renovated recently so everything is fresh with a modern look and feel. The common areas, such as lobby, restaurant and the hallways look like they havenâ€™t been redone in long, long time but the receptionist mentioned that renovations were planned. Great location near Miracle Mile. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ruth E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at this hotel. From check-in to check-out, the staff was great. They all were friendly and accommodating and truly wanted to help in anyway. We loved our suite...it was clean and well appointed. The hotel still has so much character even with a recent re-do. We were surprised by an unadvertised New Year's Eve party at midnight consisting of a jazz trio, balloon drop and champagne toast...free. It really was a fun time. Breakfast in the restaurant was outstanding...our waiter was terrific and anticipated our every need plus, the food was wonderful. The only downside was the pricey parking.

Reviews.Title: “Small room for a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritzcrackers
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through priceline name your own price. The room was very small just enough room for one person. It was clean and adequate I definitely would not pay full price for this hotel. The lobby and staff were great. Location was great and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: BartFargo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days and was very impressed. While the building is older, the rooms have been recently renovated in the modern style. Staff was very nice at check in and throughout my stay. My only complaint is that the room could have been cleaner, especially in the bathroom, where there were a few handprints and smudges. However, overall I was very satisfied and I look forward to staying here again.Â

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steven O
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the hotel on Dec 22, 2011 for one night. I can back because I had previous great stay for four nights in October on business. The value is tremendous having spent less than $ 150 per night. On Dec 22nd, the deal was even better costing only $ 110 per night plus tax. The beds are very comfortable, room has modern LCD TV, the bathroom has been renovated, and the hotel is just 200 yards off of Michigan Ave and close to Macy's and Bloomingdale's. The staff are friendly and attentative and the cafe for breakfast and lunch is outstanding. Given the price and high quality, this is the first place I will consider again when visiting Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect location, without frills despite its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Lafemmegiselle
Reviews.Content: I bid on this room through Priceline and got an incredible mid-week deal. Since this was a surprise birthday present to my husband, I phoned ahead requesting a room with a view of the lakefront. Upon arrival, I was told that due to its location there was no such thing. The first room we were given had a view -- of a courtyard-like area showcasing outside emergency exits. When I asked to be moved, the front desk moved us into another area where we actually were able to see a tiny bit of the lake. The lake is the object my late night gazing and meditation tradition, so this small view made a great difference. The room decor was austere but classy, with the exception of an ulgy headboard that took up half of the wall. The bathroom had beautiful marble tiling, and the shower was immaculate. There was no exhaust fan in the bathroom, which made no sense given the scant privacy afforded by the wood and glass pocket door. Just down the street from the Mag Mile, we did some shopping and celebrity peeping. A famous actor who calls Chicago home was enjoying the abnormally warm weather with his wife and baby. No one bothered him because the area is accustomed to spotting beautiful people. I would stay there again, as it is a short walk to the jazz clubs and foodie options just to the north and west across Michigan Avenue. We stumbled upon the Original Pancake House and learned how justified the long lines are: the wait was only 20 minutes and the pancakes are TO-DIE for.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine7478
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. We checked in early, but the early check in fee was waived because we signed up for their loyalty program. Front desk was always helpful. Only two draw backs was our shower door was not sealed properly, so everytime we showered, it leaked all over the floor and we'd have to keep requesting towels. The second drawback was upon leaving, we had to hail our own cab because obviously, it was too cold for the bell cap because he was inside keeping warm. It was a smaller hotel, so not a whole lot of extra's. I requsted a room with a view, we were in 504, which had a view of the Drake hotel and other condo's. This hotel is at the start of the Magnificient Mile and around the corner from the John Hancock observatory (and Cheesecake Factory).

Reviews.Title: “Prison Release Program?”
Reviews.Author: Holida_Golightly
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker used to be an excellent hotel, full of old-world charm. Now, thanks largely to the staff, it is probably one of the least hospitable places to stay in Chicago. The bellmen were surly, the concierge seemed wholly unfamiliar with the city, but the worst was the staff in the bar, who seem all to have come from some sort of prison work release program. They were agressively hostile and rude, behaving like bouncers in a cheap nightclub. The only seating in the lobby is in the bar and when we (as guests of the hotel) sat there while waiting to meet other guests, we were informed we had to order drinks. On another ocassion, the bartender became so aggressively nasty to my sister I later complained to the manager. He promised to look into it and get back to me; we checked out three days later having heard nothing from him. Next time, we'll cross the street and stay at the Drake!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, no bathtub”
Reviews.Author: Caligan
Reviews.Content: Go the room through Priceline. Staff was pleasant. The room was small. Space for only one person to walk between bed and tv.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, comfy bed, good location”
Reviews.Author: knockingon40
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Millennium Knickerbocker for girls trip to Chicago. Location was right around the corner from Michigan Avenue. It was within walking distance to many attractions. Now, we did walk to Navy Pier from the hotel, that was quite a trek, probably 3 miles to and from. The hotel decor had been updated. Lobby, room and thoroughfares were nicely decorated. The only problem that I noticed was an unpleasant odor when entering the lobby. It was always present. We did eat once at the hotel restaurant, that was not a good experience at all. 45 mins for OJ, bacon and toast. Then when time to cash out, the credit/debit machine was broken. Overall, good experience. Never felt unsafe in or around the hotel, but we did take proper precautions.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location, Comfy Rooms and Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: joegold80
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location - especially if you're the moron who realises while going security at La Guardia that you have 3 suits and no dress shoes in your garment bag. Being just off Michigan Avenue with easy access to the North Side was a major thumbs up, as were the refurbished rooms. Being off Michigan meant there was easy access to shops and restaurants, but little traffic noise. Only complaint about the room was the "rainfall shower" - very spacious but more a drizzle than a monsoon. Restaurant food was great for lunch and the bar was well stocked and civilized with decent service. Just be aware of the pianist who plays from 7pm with no idea of what "ambient music" is and proceeded to beat the ivories rather than tinkle them - it made conversation a little difficult. My only issue was the service - receptionists were slow and poorly informed, while the bell station was rarely manned (I waited 15 minutes to drop off my suitcases on my check-out day), while valet parking requires 15 minutes to retrieve your car - something they fail to tell you when you're dropping it off. Overall - better than the Palmer House and Hilton Chicago, not as good as the Hyatt or Marriot on Wacker.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Sheritha C
Reviews.Content: Birsen at front desk was very friendly and professional. Hotel was clean and welcoming. We were upgraded to double beds to accomadate our small child who is a bad sleeper thanks to her. Hotel is in great location adjacent to magnificant mile and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: sara d
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker is a beautiful hotel. We visited for a short 3 days, for leisure before the holidays.We arrived in Chicago at 8am, were planning on dropping our bags with the bellman until check in at 3, but they suggested we check in first; so happy we did, our room was ready and we were able to go up and settle in way before the check in time. The staff is so friendly and helpful, the office clerks, bell men, bartender, and maids. The room was clean, well-kept, nice flat screen tv, and beautiful renovated bathrooms. A little small, but fine for how long we actually spent in the room. We'd stay here again if we make it back to the windy city. Location is great as well, a short walk to bus stops and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: xyztravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a quick trip to Chicago. Picked the Knickerbocker because it was in a great locationâ€”close to the lake and Michigan Aveâ€”and reasonably priced. The lobby may be a bit outdated, but it's an old hotel. The rooms, as others have noted, are tiny. With the bed and a small table and chairs there wasn't much room to maneuver. But despite it's size, the rooms were niceâ€”they seemed recently renovated and the furnishings looked new. The bathroom was clean and bright and a decent size. If you're looking for a 4- or 5-star experience I probably would advise staying elsewhere. But if you don't plan to spend tons of time in the room and you want to be centrally located, I highly recommend the Knickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed rooms, tired lobby”
Reviews.Author: Anita H
Reviews.Content: I recently booked the Knickerbocker for a one night stay in Chicago. We were in our room very little, and the room served our needs just fine for the price. The room was small - even by Chicago standards, and I stay overnight in Chicago frequently. The rooms have been recently renovated and they were nicely appointed. The bathroom was very nicely done. The common spaces of this hotel however are tired. Carpets looked stained and dirty, paint in the elevators was in need of updating, etc. It served our needs just fine, however I do not consider this a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lmcintyre
Reviews.Content: My 2 sisters and adult son stayed at the Knickerbocker on a Saturday night in early December. While I liked the hotel very much there were a few negatives. Positives first: -The king bed suite was nice. There was plenty of room for all four of us. -The furnishings look new. All were in good condition and modern. -The bathroom was great. Though the shower (2 options) kind of confused me and ended up getting the floor pretty wet. - Location was awesome. It's at one end of the Miracle Mile but it's populated and busy. Within walking distance to all the sites. Negatives: - I like a nice entrance/lobby. The front lobby was unimpressive to me. We always walked in to the left where the elevators and checkin area are located. Didn't get to see the lounge and fancier areas of the lobby. But walking in does not give you the wow factor. - I know the building is old but the elevators are so tiny. We could barely fit with our luggage. The wait for an elevator can be time consuming as well. - We ended up in a room with absolutely no view. Someone has to get these rooms but there was nothing to see except the neighboring building and mechanical equipment. - Seating around the checkin area is minimal. - Had to pay for Wifi. - Parking was confusing. We ended up down the street at a city parking garage ($35). Don't know if I would stay here again since there are so many other hotels nearby which I would like to try..

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Wows!”
Reviews.Author: tshook80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Knickerbocker in early October. It was very clean, well decorated, and the staff was great. We were there on a weekend, during a big wedding reception, but did not feel crowded. The hotel restaurant and concierge service were big pluses. I would definitely go back there. The rooms were a little musty smelling but once the A/C was on, the smell went away. Great view of Lake Michigan from our window (but not all).

Reviews.Title: “In a class of years gone by”
Reviews.Author: Pgholson
Reviews.Content: A lovely historical hotel that has been renovated and given some spiff without harming the historical feel. Located right off Michigan Avenue, it couldn't have a better location.It is right across the street from the Drake, another grand dame, which makes it easy to get cabs which are always in line. Staff is outstanding and always looking to make the guests comfortable. Was there for a business meeting and the Crystal Ballroom takes you back to years gone by. Our food for the meeting was excellent and again, staff were superb. Rooms are a little small, as befits an older hotel, but amenities are well chosen and the room is comfortable. Ask for a room to the back for quiet, or the front for a view of the busy street and activities below.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service/Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GermanyGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across from the Drake Hotel, just past Water Tower Place. The location is great if you want to be near the Gold Coast and shopping. We had an early arrival in Chicago and were very pleased by the friendly staff and the news that we could check into our room at 9:30 a.m.!! That rarely happens, if at all. The hotel is an older hotel, but the rooms have been totally updated. The beds are extremely comfortable and have down blankets and very soft down pillows as well. There was a flat screen tv, a fridge and nice art work (photos of Chicago area) on the wall. The bathrooms were updated as well. We didn't get to check out the hotel bar area because a huge wedding party was occupying that area. I was afraid we wouldn't get much sleep because of the noise, but I didn't hear a thing all night. Maybe the staff has placed all the "wedding party" in some other area. The price we paid was around $240.00 (that included all the taxes) for a room with two queen beds. I find Chicago pricey overall, but I was splitting the room, so it came within budget. Staff is very helpful and nice!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Anfrale
Reviews.Content: Great Location & great stay. Mattress & bedding was very comfortable and I slept great. No noise from the rooms next door like other hotels. Modern upscale room design. Hotel staff was very friendly & helpful. When we called room service with a request they responded quickly. Just one short block from the Cheese Cake Factory!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in Appealing Shopping District”
Reviews.Author: bmpark2
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Knickerbocker is a hotel in the style of old hotels. As you pull up you are greeted by a staff of doormen, who assist you with your luggage and whisk your car away to parking. Initially, the lobby is confusing, as an upscale restaraunt, is to the left, and the hotel bar is to your right, but the check in counter appears to be hidden from sight. After a few seconds of looking, you will see, tucked in the corner a small desk where two clerks will check you in. We had no delays with the check in process, and were quickly provided our room keys for the 11th floor. We stepped into a small elevator, and embarked to our room. Once upstairs, we followed the signs to our charming little (keep in mind this is a restored classic hotel) room with updated amenities. The room appeared modern and was very clean. The novelty of the sliding restroom door, as well as the European type fixtures provided a welcome relief to the standard fare that can make even the nicest four star feel like the Howard Johnson. Overall, if you are looking for a great location to take in the Magnificent Mile, and enjoy the Loop this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Fred707
Reviews.Content: Great stay in comfortable room, warm and friendly bar with piano music and a convenient location where we could walk to the theater, dinner and an eclectic brunch. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Great value for a Chicago loop area hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAABmom
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a conference in Chicago and use one of the recommended hotels of which I didn't want to use. My colleague and I found a great deal in price at the Millenium on Expedia. The staff was very professional, personable, and helpful! The rooms and bathrooms were up to date, well decorated and above all, wifi worked without any issues. Location right off of Miracle Mile, walking distance to great shopping!!!! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The hidden gem of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mprestigiacomo
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews on trip advisor, I was a little cautious in coming here. From the second I stepped up to the hotel, I was greeted with amazing service from the doormen to the front desk. This uniquely charming hotel really wowed me in every aspect. The service was impeccable and the rooms were completely renovated with a modern flair. The location couldn't be better with it just being steps away from Michigan ave. my daughter and I had the best time looking at all of the recently installed Christmas lights, and being only a few blocks from American girl store. I highly recommend this hotel for their location, charming interior, and the best staff I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Great Location - Not Very Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Patrick C
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for business but also brought the family. Staff, especially Birsen and Suzanne, were very helpful in getting us an early check-in and even getting us a bigger room. This was extremely helpful considering we were traveling with a 1 year old. We were lucky to get the larger room because there is no way we could have fit in a standard room. Everything was very clean and the bed was super comfortable. Great location for walking around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Old Hotel in a Great Location off of Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: GirlieWeekender
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker is a fabulous old hotel right off of Michigan Avenue. Our room was impeccable. It is small like most big-city hotels, but it was perfectly fine for the two of us. The bell staff was attentive and professional, as were the hotel staff. There is a lot of history with this hotel and the hotel across the street (The Drake). If you are a super early bird (before 6AM) and need coffee, walk to the Hilton next door and get Starbucks. Our only complaint was the lighting in the bathroom. It was a little strange, making it difficult to know if your makeup looked good, or if you looked like a circus clown. Overall, I would totally go back.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel ... BUT!”
Reviews.Author: dnovoryta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Knickerbocker for the first time as we had a dinner to attend in Chicago. The location was great, however, we found the room to be very cramped. I was concerned when the bell staff saw us unpacking our luggage from the car and stood and talked to another person -- same thing happened when we were leaving. There are many fine hotels in Chicago but this one won't be on our RETURN list. :(

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel as part of a vacation package and could not have been happier during our first visit to Chicago. Great location at the northern end of the Magnificient Mile and just south of the Gold Coast neighborhood and Lincoln Park. If you like to walk to various venues--as we do--this is the place to stay. Recent renovations are excellent, though not much room to move around in a single room that has a very comfortable king bed in it. But who goes to Chicago to sit in the room! Price was right, there was zero noise, staff was courteous and, judging from the ballroom usage during our stay, a great place to have a wedding and reception. Small lobby and no TV at the small bar, but the piano player in the evening was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 101Kit101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. Location is excellent, right off Michigan Ave, and Lake Shore Dr. is close. Staff was very courteous. This hotel, compared to others I have stayed at in the area for the same price ranks much higher in comparison. I will stay here again as well as recommend The Knickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel very close to John Hancock Building”
Reviews.Author: JCSLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, staff helpful and courteous with exception to the Front Desk... they weren't great. But that aside I would recommend this hotel and also it is in a very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DebK022
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business at the end of October, 2011. The service was excellent. The staff was courteous and very helpful. I got a room with two double beds (my daughter flew in from NYC the weekend I was there) and I was surprised how large the room was. The bathroom was large too! The location is great; one block away from the Magnificant mile. I would definitely stay at the Knickerbocker again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jason L
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for my cousin's wedding. From the moment that my wife and I checked in to the Millenium Knickerbocker Hotel, I could tell that the service at the hotel was exceptional. From the doorman greeting us courteously to the people at the front desk making us feel welcome and at home. My cousin's wedding and reception were also at the Knickerbocker and they both appeared to go off flawlessly. Their staff during the reception was attentive and prompt. I felt like we were dining at a 5-star restaurant. A prime example of their excellent staff is Birsen Duman. My wife and I forgot a few items in our room's safe and Birsen really went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure that those items were returned to me. Throughout the whole process, Birsen was patient and incredibly understanding. After a few phone calls and a couple of emails, Birsen made sure that the items were overnighted to me so that they would get back in my possession as soon as possible. This was especially important because one of those items was my car/house keys. We left Chicago on Sunday night and I had my keys back by Tuesday morning. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at your hotel and when we come back to Chicago, the Millenium Knickerbocker will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Chicago Hotel Really Shines”
Reviews.Author: SheilaEWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker during a girls' weekend in October. The staff was extremely pleasant, the rooms are clean and updated with very European style, and the bed was "over-the-top" comfortable (one of the best hotel beds I have EVER slept in). We ordered room service breakfast the night before and it was delivered on time and hot! The food was incredible! I have never stayed in downtown Chicago before, but would definitely stay at the Millennium Knickerbocker the next time I have an opportunity. This is a classic facility that really knows how to treat its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: lewiefam
Reviews.Content: What a nice find, close the shopping, restaurants, and the lakefront! Although small, the room was comfortable. My only complaint was a musty smell. The bathroom was updated, with cool a rainshower head and a wand shower. Bed was comfy, plenty of pillows, not a super view but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: S6blr
Reviews.Content: Went there for a 1 day business review. Wasn't the worst or the best but not bad. Meeting rooms A/C a bit unpredictable however!

Reviews.Title: “Tired & rundown... but... service is BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarriedTravel
Reviews.Content: Chicago is a really great city to visit... so much to do, clean & easy to get around. The Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel is tired & run-down & the rooms are really small. But, the service we experienced was really great! I would NEVER choose to stay here again... there are many other choices. But... do choose to eat at the restaurant... the staff there really understand service! I will say though... the location is also really good!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Longhini
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker Hotel is really fun because it's got the old historical charm in the common areas & elevators but the rooms are all renovated nicely. The bathroom was clean with beautiful tile & fluffy towels/robe. The bed was comfortable and they use feather pillows & duvet (which I prefer). The room also had a good work area with fast wireless. The location is outstanding and the staff was friendly. I would recommend giving them a try!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and roomy, nicely decorated and well located”
Reviews.Author: Girardina
Reviews.Content: The room had plenty of space, was very clean with a good sized bathroom. The location was great just off of Michigan Avenue (Magnificent Mile) so great for shops and restaurants. The staff were very professional, knowledgeable and friendly. We especially appreciated all of the help given to us by the concierge. We ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel and found it to be very good. There were several functions on at the hotel during our stay including a wedding party but we were not bothered by any noise - a very quiet room. Comparing prices for hotels we found the cost for this hotel to be very competitive and well worth the money. Being Brits our one small gripe would be there were no tea making facilities in the room just a coffee machine!

Reviews.Title: “The Knickerbocker Hotel Chicago "Rocks".”
Reviews.Author: JKBOPB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our anniversary at the Knickerbocker Chicago over Labor Day Weekend. We were greeted at the front desk by the attentive staff and we soon arrived at our spacious upgraded Junior Suite. This room was fantastic in gold tones and marble. The sitting room was spacious and the bathroom was the best. The shower/tub was one I have never seen before. The tub was large and whirlpool and the shower was in an area in front of the tub but inside of the glass enclosure. This was really a wonderful design and with the multiple shower heads a fantastic way to unwind. Our every need was handled so effortlessly. My wife talked with the turn down housekeeping staff who brought us additional towels and an additional robe without delay or question. We were in the type of room you never want to leave. On the Flat Screen TV cabinet when we arrived was a bottle of champagne...not a mini bottle but a full size bottle...with two glasses with strawberries and chocolates. It was a very nice touch and totally unexpected. There was a note from the Sales Manager (Richard Mazur) extending his welcome and to enjoy our anniversary. The hotel was spotless, well staffed, stylish and elegant. The lobby bar was a happening area and a very nice place to have a drink, meet new people or stop in for a night cap before turning in. Everyone associated with the hotel is first rate and very helpful. We would stay at this facility....which is conveniently located in the John Hancock Building area of the Magnificent Mile....again and again and again. We LOVE the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great room, euro-style elevator.”
Reviews.Author: jinx101
Reviews.Content: the room was large and clean (two things we look for). the lobby is a bit small, but who needs a lobby in chicago? the one drawback was the european sized elevator. if you have many bags or many people you'll have to make a few trips. my husband booked this room on sale so it was well worth it. but had it not been on sale i dotn think we'd have booked the room.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Little Lady”
Reviews.Author: JanetLynne0714
Reviews.Content: As always I search endlessly through hotels to find the one with all our requirements. Location, moderate price, room size, no hidden fees. This hotel was sweet. Nice modern room. Mix of old and new. Great little breakfast restaurant and Martini Bar. Very friendly staff. A great reflection of a great city! We love Chicago even more now..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beds but what a terrible elevator!”
Reviews.Author: lifelongtravelr
Reviews.Content: Some of the previous reviews are correct. 1-great location-its next to everything 2-big comfy beds but perhaps too big for the room size 3-worth it? Hmmmm well maybe for a groupon or priceline deal 4-cost of food. Probably not worth it but I thought breakfast was good. It's in the heart of the city by the lake so the price reflects what other better places charge. Other stuff- FYI my partial lake view rooms translated into a view between two brick buildings which nearly abut the window, so do not pay up for that feature. Lastly and most importantly their elevator is terrible. I doubt that can be fixed. Overall I recommend this place but not the elevator or the "partial lake" (mostly brick building) view

Reviews.Title: “Bed like floating on a cloud...”
Reviews.Author: Read_Golf
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a weekend for a meeting without a high expectation and was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Shopping is close and service was very friendly. The best part for me was room service was quick and food was HOT when it arrived. Soup was hot, rolls were steamy and butter was cold. I was amazed. Room service is never reasonably priced but it was worth every bit of its price this time. I completely agree about the energy saving shower... not easy to rinse your hair in "rainwater."

Reviews.Title: “Really just Ok”
Reviews.Author: oscar0734
Reviews.Content: Very good location close to the shops and restaurants and a short walk to the lake.Room was comfortable and clean but the shower awkward.Most other Hotels have free wifi but they wanted $9.99 per day for inroom wifi although if you were lucky you could get it free in the noisy bar.Breakfast not included in the very high room rate and expensive down in the cafe/restaurant so we had to go out for that.A phone call to a free number cost $1.25 to use the llne.The Staff did their job but no more....The Hotel was ok. just rather characterless and with everything "extra" it grated a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: john01
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out { thanks Helen} The Hotel's staff makes you feel like your their only guest from service to attention this Hotel cannot be beat. With all of the Mag Mile at your doorstep and the surrounding night life and resturants nearby makes the Knickerbocker your best pick in Chicago. The rooms are comfortable and clean .The old world setting takes you back in time when hotels had class and charm with all of todays modern amenities. For Buisness or Pleasure its our pick for a fun getaway. J and J

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Teachaimo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 3 nights at the Millennium in October. We rode the orange line from the airport into the city, then caught a $6 cab ride to the hotel.Sean was working the front desk, and check in was a breeze. After dropping our luggage in the room, Henry, the concierge, was very helpful, finding us last minute dinner reservations at a nearby steak house.He continued to give us suggestions each day for our adventures, guiding us around closed streets due to the marathon, making several reservations for us, and giving his opinion when asked to help us decide between ideas. The location of the hotel is a 5 minute walk from Michigan Ave, so very convenient to anything we wanted. As noted in other reviews, the room was a bit small, but plenty large enough for the 2 of us, especially when we were only in there to sleep each night. The bed/bedding was a dream. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly to us. I highly recommend the hotel if you want to stay a short distance away from the lights and sounds of Michigan Avenue, but still in quick and easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust the valet parking”
Reviews.Author: Carrie H
Reviews.Content: To valet park your car they charge you $53 per night.......my car was damaged while I left it in their care and then they claimed that it was already damaged when I arrived and refused to take responsibility for having it repaired. This company is dishonest!!!! I will never, ever stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TonyO_StPaul
Reviews.Content: In looking at other positive reviews of this property, I'm not sure there's too much more I can offer other than to maybe lend a bit more credence to those reviews by seconding most of the positives. The location, while on the northern edge of downtown, was pretty convenient, while still seeming slightly secluded and quiet even though it was just half a block off Michigan Avenue. The service ranged from efficient to friendly. Our room wasn't big, but it was laid out just fine and never felt cramped. The bathroom was user friendly, and the shower large. Our room was peaceful, and outside noise was never an issue. Finally, the bed was possibly one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept on. I booked this room through Priceline bidding, and for what I paid, I was extremely pleased with what I got. I'd have been happy, in hindsight, having paid more. Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: DallasSOC
Reviews.Content: Despite mixed reviews on this site, my stay here has been wonderful. The staff is courteous and helpful. Rooms are small but lovely. Meeting rooms were great and Internet was complimentary for our group. Arrived mid- morning, asked for early check in and a room with a view and was graciously given both!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance & Comfort in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: EBJ11
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Chicago ! The Millennium Knickerbocker is a great place to stay if you want to be close to the shopping on Michigan Avenue, the restaurants on Rush and the tourists spots like The Hancock Building. This hotel is one of the originals and they have managed to keep the elegant, old fashioned feel and yet give you a very contemporary look and amenities. Our room was on the 9th floor and although the space was small, I really felt that the way the space was used made things really comfortable. I loved the fact that this place was quiet...I never heard any noise or activity in the rooms near us and it was completely peaceful at night. The bed was really comfortable with nice linens and pillows. There is a desk for working and they do charge a small fee for internet access. The bathroom was small but luxurious with a European-style hand held shower attachment as well as an overhead rain shower...different but easy to use .A state of the art toilet that you flush by pushing a chrome button on the wall is fun and the sliding pocket doors are a cool touch. On the other side, you have a decent sized closet with an in-room safe. There are 2 TVs- one mounted on the wall in front of the bed and the other in the sitting area. The space doesn't really require 2 but it's a nice touch. The room has a refrigerator that comes as a stocked mini bar and a Keurig coffee maker is included. If you need ice, you need to go up to the 10th floor...I know that's annoying but in older buildings, it's usually the case. You can order room service 24 hours and the first morning I did have breakfast sent up....it was EXPENSIVE for what it was but it was a nice treat and the food was good. This hotel features a really nice bar that seems to stay open pretty late, a coffee shop, fitness room and a spa- unfortunately, I didn't get to check that out but maybe next time ! I really enjoyed staying here, it was comfortable and in the perfect location. Give it a try next time you come to Chicago for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: SinOttawa
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in a room with a king bed and were both pleased. I was under the weather our first night so we stayed in; room service was a touch slow in bringing up $8 herbal tea but I've never had a better sleep in a hotel! The concierge gave us a great breakfast spot recommendation (I can't recall the name) and had umbrellas on hand for the rain. Front desk was a touch slow and rude. Free WiFi in the rooms was great. Location a bit far from subway but walked almost everywhere anyway.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: Trina81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in a superior room with 2 double beds, the hotel building is old but the rooms are nice and modern, comfortable beds, flat screen tv, large shower with an overhead rain attachment, which was nice but would have liked a bit more water pressure. Hotel has buisness centre but you have to pay, and it was $5.00 per half hour, and also in room wifi was $9.95 per night. I feel that is a let down as other chain hotels offer it for free. Hotel has a martini bar which was very lively at night, also dined in hotel restaurant on 2 occasions for breakfast and the food was very tasty and large portions, wait staff were very nice and attentive. Found all the staff at this hotel to be very nice and helpful, a few standouts were Paul the concierge, who provided us with directions, recommendations for dining and also booked tours for us, and Paul the porter who was always very welcoming and gave us helpful advice. This hotel is in an excellent location with a short 5 - 10 minute walk to division and rush st which has some great dining options. also walk half a block to Michigan ave were there is plenty of shops. Navy pier is about 20 minute walk from hotel. A few recommendations for dining would be Rosebud steakhouse which is across from hotel, and also lou malnati's and carmines on rush st, and the cheescake factory on michigan ave. Overall this was an excellent choice and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Group Event”
Reviews.Author: Deb G
Reviews.Content: We booked the Burham Suite as the headquarters for my daughter's wedding (being held elsewhere), as well as a block of rooms for out-of-town guest accommodations. The hotel is older but recently renovated and updated. The furnishings were elegant and upscale.; everything was fresh and clean, clean,clean - nothing was worn. The Burnham Suite was fabulous!! Spacious, modern, marble everywhere, bathrooms were fantastic with great water pressure, good lighting, counter space for everyone. The staff was extremely attentive and promptly responded to all our requests for extra bedding (the suite had 4 pull-out sofa beds for those who couldn't drive home!), make-up chair, refrigerator, buckets of ice, toiletries etc. My only complaint would be the refrigerator-they implied that a regular but smaller size fridge would be brought in at no charge. Upon check-in found out that it was in fact a mini-fridge, but they remedied that by providing 2 at no charge. Restaurant was good and not too outrageuous for a quick bite. Late night bar area and ajoining fireplace room was perfect for group gathering. We brought in truckloads of our own snacks, water, liquor, food etc and they were ok with it all. Would suggest your own cups and plates for a large group as they will consider it catering if you ask for 30 glasses! One other drawback was the single serve coffee-maker, so we brought our own maker and coffee! Yes the lobby is a throwback to a bygone era but that is what adds charm to the hotel. And the location cannot be beat-walking distance to all the excitement of the Gold Coast. Doormen were very helpful and no one hovered with their hand out when you asked for help or advice. Finally, the rates were far better than any other hotel in the area and 30% lower than the tattered,over-rated competitor across the street. I would stay there again in a regular room anytime I need a base from which to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location Trumps All”
Reviews.Author: edyrp
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is like a woman who aged and didn't try to keep herself nice. You can still see her good bones, but little has been done to update it or make it beautiful. The room we had was quite small, and despite the fact that we had cool fall weather it was somehow humid in the room. The bed was comfortable, and the lamps had extra sockets on them so we could plug in all of our many chargables. Surprisingly, the bathroom is great: euro-modern, with good lighting, a marble double shower with room enough for two. It had a hand-held shower as well as a rain shower from above. Very nice. There is a full-length mirror in the room, and a good sized closet. Most of all, the location of the hotel stands out. It is half a block from Michigan Avenue, with it's many restaurants and magnificent shops. The hotel is convenient and had some nice ameneties.

Reviews.Title: “It's in the Details......”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Room was small but nice enough, with comfortable bed and modern bathroom. Housekeeping is poor, and failed on tasks such as responding to requests to replace burnt light bulbs and replacing coffee in room. I also spent 10-15 minutes trapped in a crowded elevator stuck between floors and ended up using stairs to/from my 10th floor room the rest of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sbcbonds
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay here and the location was good. My room was on the smallish side as was the hotel lobby, but the staff was pleasant and I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “North Michigan Ave. Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VistaBob
Reviews.Content: Not often I get to say this; PERFECT hotel. Bed, pillows, TV, desk, desk chair, power outlets, location, staff, everything was just right. Add to that a good value rate and it was perfect. Located close to Hancock building and Water Tower Place.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelnutEncinitasCa
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 night visit in Chicago. I wish the last 2 reviews had been posted before we booked this. It's an older hotel and has been renovated. The rooms are tastefully done and the beds are comfortable, but they are TINY...and the bathroom is about the size of a coat closet. My husband and I could not be in the b/room at the same time. I know the rain showerhead is a big deal to some people, but we didn't like it. The other shower option is hand held, but it's mounted too low on the wall to be usable. The last day we were there we got up to make our coffee and housekeeping had neglected to refill our basket, so we had to call down for coffee...and then they didn't bring us creamer or sugar. We never had our breakfast there...a bowl of oatmeal is $10...ridiculous. We walked less than a block to the Hancock and had a great breakfast and latte every morning for $15 for both of us on the lower level Italian deli. The biggest plus of the hotel is the location. You are a block from the lake and 1/2 block from Michigan Ave. Rush St restaurants are only several blocks away. They also have an amazing pianist in the bar which we really appreciated. Having said that, there are so many other choices in the immediate area that we definitely would not recommend the Knickerbocker or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollywood220
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker 9/10 - 9/12/2011. I don't consider myself a hotel snob, but this hotel is listed as a 4 star and it is 3 star at best. The interior finishes (carpet, baseboards, wall and floor paneling, etc.) are very worn and not well kept. It is obvious that this used to be a smoking hotel because the room had an odor of Cigarettes. The rooms were very small. Also you had to pay for internet. Really? I can get free internet in a Holiday Inn paying 2 star prices, but a 4 star hotel does not provide free internet for its customers? The best thing about this location is its location. Also don't park your car across the street. They do not allow in and out parking for customers of Millennium Knickerbocker and they charge about $50-55 a day. It's cheaper at 200 Delaware, one street over. It is only $35 a day. Also they charge a 40$ upgrade fee if you want double beds instead of a single bed. For what I paid to stay at the Millennium Knickerbocker, I should have used that money to stay at a cleaner, more well kept hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not World Class: never again”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyGolfer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights and felt that the chain's claims concerning the hotel are way overstated. First, the shower takes a long time to get warm and while having a rain head and handheld sprayer sounds good, there is little to no pressure from the rain head. They'd be better off just getting a better overhead shower head. They could not get their IT vendor to connect me to my employer's VPN even using their ethernet connection through the phone. And they have an extremely weak wireless signal in the rooms. They advertise that the rooms have 40" hi def TVs--but they do not give you a hi-def signal so the standard def picture is pretty lousy--fuzzy and somewhat distorted. Also, limited chanel selection. No free internet--even in the tiny "business services" room that requires you to insert cash into a slot for a prepaid time to access the internet. At this hotel's rates, that is cheap and quite petty. Breakfast: 18.32 plus tip for coffee, orange juice, bagel and three strips of bacon. Rip off!

Reviews.Title: “SMALL ROOMS! GREAT LOCATION! NOT BAD!”
Reviews.Author: aleahmarie
Reviews.Content: My other half and I stayed for the week at this hotel. The lobby is nice, clean, with a spacious lounge. There were people at the bar almost every night and at times there was live piano music. The elevators are small and old but they were not super slow...it was not bad. We didn't head to the bar since we ventured out of the hotel for most of the time. We actually didn't even explore the hotel that much since we were gone for most of the time. That being said...we really didn't interact with the bellman/workers etc. because the few times we asked questions one person said that he just moved here and he had no idea of anything & barely spoke English & the concierge "Henry" gave us wrong information in regards to the museums. So we were a bit turned off by the staff. Not a big deal because there is always GOOGLE and we did a ton of research before we go to Chicago. We noticed that the staff was always changing, there was hardly any consistency in the faces we saw during our stay...but again that was not important beacuse we did our own thing. This hotel is located at the top of the Magnificent Mile. It is a great location to walk to the beach and to the shopping areas and practically to all of the basic sights like: The Bean, Navy Pier, Lincoln Park, Zoo etc. It is a bit of a treck to the Field Museum but you don't even notice the walk if you are in comfortable shoes because the parks are so beautiful and well manicured. Of course taking a cab is always an option. We took the "L" train (blue line) from O'Hare Airport which was about a 40min ride & then a $10 cab ride from the last stop near the hotel instead of walking. Check in was super easy, like 3 mins and Sean was pleasant and friendly. Louis is right around the corner, Bloomingdales and the 900 shops are across the street and Water Tower Place is two blocks away and so is the John Hancock Building...great location! Our room with one king bed was really small but we made it work. The rooms was humid and so the air was on all the time which was a bit noisy. The thermostat was set to 68 but it felt more like 75 in the room. Anyways, the beds were comfy..nothing amazing but our pillows were on the dead side. For the most part the room was clean and I feel like they should provide 2 robes instead of one per room. Rooms had adequate toiletries (which we didn't use) and the mini bar was fully stocked and surprisingly affordable. The downside was that the bathroom/toilet was RIGHT NEXT TO THE BED so you could hear everything going on in the bathroom! Not a fun situation if you were staying with a friend etc. The bathrooms are remodled and the rain shower is a nice touch to add some "class" to the decor. Our view was not that great since we booked through a third party site. Ice is on the 7th floor which could get annoying if you have to constantly refill. Room service was adequate. I wish they changed the sheets everyday but in light of going green we didn't mind so much. This is a great location for dining as well. Everything is within walking distance or a short cab ride away. The train lines are very easy to navigate and getting around is a breeze. Of course you have to pay for WiFi in the computer lounge since it is not "part of the hotel" but the Apple store is right down the street on Michigan Ave if you need to use a computer. However, you can print your boarding passes for free. Overall we would probably not stay at this hotel again but it is a good location and met our needs for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel any where”
Reviews.Author: BLCLL-50
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Knickerboker for over 25 years. It has undergone many changes over the years but the renovation 2 years ago puts this hotel in a league of its own. The rooms are comfortable with contemporary features (Walk in shower with air jet tub) blended into a historic theme. The staff at this hotel treat you like royalty. The doormen, the concierge, the bellmen, the bartenders, the cleaning staff....outstanding. Start your evening in the finest martini bar anywhere and then...location location location. 5 minute walk to all the best shopping, restaurants, bars, clubs, late night music. Local tips: Pizanos for Pizza, Jillyâ€™s for drinks and dancing, Underground Wunderbar for the best live music you will find. Finish up with a late night drink at The Lodge. For a great Steak head to The Saloon just around the corner from the Knickerboker. The best of everything at your doorstep in a first class setting.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: goingplacesMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very helpful staff, great location, very easy to walk to everything, restaurants, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Westhues
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It is a block from the beach and Michigan Avenue. The Drake is right across the street. You can walk to many attractions including the Hancock building, Chicago River Architecture tour, and Marilyn Monroe statute. You can get a day pass for the CTA bus and train for around $5.25 per day at Walgreens which is a great deal. Otherwise you would spend $2 each time you got on the bus or train. Saves you from having to have exact cash too which is what they need. No change is given. We went to the art museum, Willis Tower (former Sears Tower) and the White Sox game using the pass. The concierge service is awesome to arrange outings. Plenty of restaurants are nearby especially on Rush Street two blocks to the west from the hotel. The rooms had a spa like bathroom and the hotel was updated.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room but excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Venessa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over labor day weekend. Room was very small and compact but the location of the hotel is excellent. Not sure I would stay at this particular hotel again though as the room was small for the two of us. We did not have room to even walk beside each other and always felt we were in each other's way. One person had to sit on the bed if the other was doing something else. The a/c was also loud and clicked on every few minutes. Woke my husband up many times during the night. The location of the hotel is great though. It is in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Corner King rooms rock!”
Reviews.Author: DAP444
Reviews.Content: Worth the $60 upgrade at the desk. The rooms are at the end of the halls so very quiet, and have two windows for extra sunlight and showtime. Stayed here with the wife. Nice comfortable bed. Great location for great dining, the mag mile and the red line. Fast elevators, great front desk, lively bar. I never saw a concierge nor any serious 5 star luxuries but still was a very nice hotel. Liquor store right around the corner and many dining options. Check out grand lux cafe for breakfast on michigan ave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cmlucas68
Reviews.Content: This hotel at the tip of the Magnificent Mile had a great location, fantastic decor, and service to match! The rooms were smaller than most, but it was part of its historic charm. The concierge was knowledgeable and friendly to this first time Chicago visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pede231
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but nothing fancy. The room was very muggy so we had to keep the air on at about 67-68 to keep the humidity out even though it wasn't humid outside. They have a rain shower in the bathroom which was a little difficult if you aren't used to it, also had no ledge so hard to shave your legs. The bed was horrible I had the worst backache after night 1 and it continued the entire stay, I highly recommend they get new beds!! The service was awesome, the bell hop/valet guys were super nice and very helpful also the concierge. The location is on the north end of Michigan ave right around the corner from the John Hancock building. It's a nice location but it gets to be a little bit of a walk down Michaigan Ave. Overall I would say if you can find a good deal at the hotel it's a nice spot but I would probably choose a differnt hotel next time more in the middle of the mile.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely wonderful. My college age daughter kept saying that the bed and pillows were so comfortable...she loved it. We attended a family wedding reception at the hotel also. The food was wonderful...the service excellent and the banquet room was stunning. The dance floor was gorgeous. We had a quick meal in the restaurant and it was also wonderful. I can't wait to get back to Chicago and I only want to stay at the Millennium.

Reviews.Title: “If you love mold, mildew and damp sheets stay here...”
Reviews.Author: CND2011
Reviews.Content: The location is good but you get what you pay for in this case. Horrible service, damp and mildew smelling rooms and linen and a staff that could give a care in the world if you stay there or not. They wanted to charge us $100 to leave the place which was a joke since one of our travel buddies is severely allergic to mold and she was getting sick within the first 20 minutes of our stay. We were offered another room and sure enough the same thing so we had to leave the place just for health reasons alone. Highly doubt this place would pass any amount of health inspections, just horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MorrisonGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the Millenium Knickerbocker several times now and it really is a wonderful hotel. The staff are truly exceptional and make you feel instantly at home. The location can't be beaten - just off Michigan Ave so you're moments from great shops, bars, restaurants & minutes from the beach but its on a quiet street so you can escape to your room or the hotel lobby after a long day of sight seeing. The rooms are gorgeous with fab bathrooms. I would recommend this hotel to anyone spending time in Chicago and will definintely be back. Top tip - try a martini at the hotel bar!

Reviews.Title: “Gave my reserved rooms away!”
Reviews.Author: Diane S
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 rooms at this hotel 2 months in advance for the air and water show taking place in chicago. Upon arriving i was told the people staying in my reserved room the prior night decided to extend their visit so my room were no longer available. They offered to pay for our rooms at another hotel they arranged. Good deal right?? No! They sent us to the Essix Inn on south Michigan, an old, dated stinky motel that is about $65 a night. When I called to complain they set us up in a nicer motel. Although they did make it right this took 3 hours of our vacation time with our family, who were waiting for us. Not a great way to start a vacation. We purposefully booked at the millenium so we would be in close proximity to the air show and would not have to hassle getting around the city and paying for taxi or parking. Very disappointed- what is the purpose of a reservation??

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Claire A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving with my other half and absolutely loved it. The room was lovely and cosy and a good size, bed was huge and the bathroom modern and spotless. I would definitely stay again. We got an excellent package through Expedia including direct flights from Manchester so it turned out to be excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation...”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one evening. Location is great--very close to the Water Tower. Lobby had an old hotel charm to it, but it is a bit run down, and had a funny odor to it. Our room was booked on Priceline. Good rate. We encountered two issues with our room. A noisy air conditioning system, and the room itself smelled of cigar smoke. Both issues were handled quickly by the hotel staff and to our satisfaction. The room was comfortable, though the wood trim was in need of painting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but rooms are too small”
Reviews.Author: za_rubezhom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire, and stayed there for only 1 night. The rooms are nicely renovated, bathroom is brand new with a nice tile shower. Bed was comfortable, but it almost literally took up the entire room! We did not eat anything at the restaurant, but had a couple of drinks at the bar, and the bartender even recommended a couple jazz bars to us! Staff was nice and attentive, and we were able to keep our suitcases at the hotel after we checked out. Hotel is walking distance to the beach, and all the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: lirpa17
Reviews.Content: I would say this is a 3.5 star hotel. They remodeled the rooms nicely but it had a little bit of a musty smell and the elevators showed age. We got a decent deal via priceline and the location is good, although a bit of a hike to Navy Pier. Super close to the Cheesecake Factory though! Bed and pillows were awesome. We slept really well. Rain shower was neat but not practical. Perfect for a hotel! The hand wand can be on while the rain shower is on. Super stocked minibar. We did the valet parking because traffic was insane and we didn't see the self-park (it is on the other side of Michigan). In hindsight we would have parked the car ourselves to save the $. If you do the valet parking don't feel rushed because if you forget something, getting it out is a hassle because they park them a few blocks away. So overall we were satisfied with this hotel as a home base to explore Chicago. If you really like new places, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lwildcat
Reviews.Content: Great location. Front desk staff were helpful. Other staff appeared bored, uninterested or irritated. The room smelled like it must have been a smoking room in the past. They need to either paint or change the carpet or the hvac system to get rid of the lingering smell. The room temp was ok but it was very humid. All of our clothes and bedding were just damp all the time. Not a fan of the rain shower as it didn't provide much water pressure. We were only in the city for 2 nights and the location was what we needed so we tolerated the hotel. I probably won't recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location! I'd definitely stay here again!"”
Reviews.Author: SherylPhilly
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel in Chicago is a few blocks away from the Hancock building and a short walk from Millennium Park. We loved our room's modern amenities. It was centrally located to all the things we wanted to do in the weekend we were in Chicago and the front desk was very helpful during our stay! I would definitely stay here again. Clean, great room, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Very Contemporary room in historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSpaLover
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with lots of orginal details. But once you enter your room you are in a very contemporary updated room. The bathroom is straight out of a design magazine. I live in Chicago so I knew the area well enough to park in the neighborhood and walk back because hotel parking is very expensive. This is a great location for tourists. Very close to the John Hancock Center, the beach, Museum of Contemporary Art, Water Tower Place and lots of Michigan Ave shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A great historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnSTraveller
Reviews.Content: My family and I just finished staying at the Knickerbocker. We had a great time. This hotel was built in 1927, and has been owned by the likes of Hugh Hefner (70's). It has a tremendous blend of modern amenities and historic archictural touches. We had a Junior Suite and the added space for three of us was great. The Knickerbocker is well situated near the Gold Coast (4 blocks), Oak Street Beach (2 blocks) and the north end of the Magnificent Mile (1/2 a block). Walk a few blocks toward Rush and State streets and the streets turn leafy, the restaurants and architecture fabulous. We enjoyed eating at Sprinkles Cupcakes and Lou Malnati's in the area. Not far away Yolk served a great breakfast, and Harry Caray's was fun. My family and I would return to the Chicago and the Knickerbocker in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth stay and we'll return.”
Reviews.Author: rectorydoor
Reviews.Content: The entire staff once again made us feel at home. The food and drink at both the restaurant and bar area is imaginative and served by a most thoughtful staff. Don't miss the special breakfast dishes and the fun lunch/bar menu. The lobby, guest rooms, and bar area are cozy and a welcome sight after a hard day of walking the Miracle Mile, the long beaches, to Navy Pier or to a nearby dinner/night spot.
