Be sure to read the fascinating history of the hotel and ball room. The ball room a must to see from the balcony, espeically if you're fortunate to be there during a wedding reception. Yes we'll return as soon as possbile!

Reviews.Title: “Average Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: chic84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker for 4 days. I am disappointed to say that it did not live up to my expectations. I decided to take the train from Oâ€™Hare to the hotel. I called the hotel to see whatâ€™s the easiest train route to the hotel and she told me to get off of at State/Lake stop in the Loop and walk 30 minutes or take a $10 cab ride. I was looking at the map and didn't understand why she would give me such advice. I ended up being adventurous and took the train to Jackson on the Blue Line and transferred to the Red Line to get to Chicago. The walk was still a bit long but much more manageable with 2 pieces of carry-on luggage each. When I got to the hotel, they gave us a room on the second floor, right next to the elevator. You basically just turn left, take one step, and youâ€™re right in front of the room. The view is literally nothing to speak of. I mean, this is the second floor. The second floor is basically for meeting rooms, fitness center, and such. I asked for a room with double bed for 2 people and I was only given one robe. The next day I got two robes but the day following that I only got one. The second day, they only changed out sheets for one of the beds. I don't quite understand why especially there's not much I can do since there's only one card in the room. Am I supposed to rip the card in half to signal "Change sheets for BOTH beds!" There's also no consistency. When I checked in, the robe was hung in the closet. The next day, two robes were folded and put on the bed. The following day, one robe was folded and put by the tub. They also did not replenish shower caps, soap bar, and shampoo. When I checked in, it still had the old soap bar probably from the an earlier stay. The third night I was there, there was a storm coming so I wanted to have dinner close by the hotel in case it rained. I went down to the concierge and spoke to Sheryl. She had an air about her that made me feel like I was bothering her. What a way to make guests feel welcomed. I was happy to know when I got to the hotel that thereâ€™s complimentary Internet in the lobby for quick email checking. That was probably the only good thing about the hotel I can think of. However, there's actually no connection in the hotel lobby by the door, you can get that same connection in the room or in the inner lobby of the hotel. Another good thing was the shower. I liked that there was an overhead shower head and a hand held one. It was a massage tub which was good after a full day of walking. Location-wise, I wouldâ€™ve chosen a hotel much closer to Streeterville, but I was â€œadvisedâ€� to stay closer to the John Hancock building. Oh well. The Knickerbocker is still a fairly nice area but not as central as I wouldâ€™ve liked, I guess. So in all, I think Knickerbocker couldâ€™ve been a good hotel for me, but with the room location, the ugly view, and the average upkeep of the room (oh, the lady at check-in told me itâ€™s a â€œnewlyâ€� renovated room â€“ what a joke!), Knickerbocker sort of let me down.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were friendly and helpful,hotel was well located and we will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: judykball
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but the rooms have been refurbished. We asked for and were given a complementary upgrade and were given a corner good sized room. If we had any issues they were attended to immediately We would not hesitate to stay here again. It was close to many varied and good restaurants and at the northern edge of The Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: segoviaBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the very best place in the city. It is at half a block from Michigan Ave, where you have all the options for shopping and transportation and it is very close to the lake. It is and old and historical building very well adapted to moder life. Beautiful and confortable bedrooms and bathrooms. The conmon areas are decorated with good taste. The service is good. My only complait is the very high price of the internet service in the bussiness center.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dianay
Reviews.Content: Around the corner from Bloomies, a couple of blocks from the beach, easy access to public transportation (fabulous location-you don't need a car)...and a great martini in the lobby bar. Need I say more? A large, sleek, and elegant room with a recently remodelled huge lovely bathroom. My only complaint: charge for internet!

Reviews.Title: “better then expected”
Reviews.Author: aysenu
Reviews.Content: Knickerbocker was better then I expected!! it was great!! looks old on the outside but the rooms were amazing! flat screen tv, comfy and huge bed, and amazing bathroom! Worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and close to everything on Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: burtbarber
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Small restaurant, but that's o.k considering there are so many great restaurants off Michigan Ave. Service is nice. For the rooms, don't expect to really have a view since the hotel is is located amongst other tall buildings. Beds are very comfortable and the rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: midwest4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Millenium Knickerbocker. Staff was cordial and the place was clean. Very pretty hotel in a great location off of the Magnificent Mile with shops and eateries close by. Room was small but, very nice design. Nice shower in the bathroom. Room was very cold at night but, changed thermostat in the morning with no problem. This hotel does put a $75 hold on credit card which I found strange. Have not had a hotel do that before. We did not get anything from the bar so the amount was never credited to my account but, it was annoying knowing it was a pending charge for 4 days till it was officially taken off. We did take advantage of the Parking Garage across the street which was cheaper. Thanks reviewers! Mentioned it was a birthday and asked for more pillows but, request was not honored.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great stay”
Reviews.Author: abat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was close to excellent. Rooms (had 2 rooms, family with 3 children) were clean and comfortable, bathrooms big and updated, cleaning also very good. The Hotel is just a few steps from the beginning of Michigan Avenue and practically close to everything. Within a five minutes walk you get to the beach and you can walk or jogg all the way in the lake front. The only reason I don't rate it with 5 out of 5, is because you had to pay for the internet in your room (10 dollars per day), though free in the lobby and that the breakfast was only ala carte and when you have children with you it's not so convenient. I would definitely stay again in the Millennium in our next visit to Chicago. Tipp. If you come by car don't bother yourself paying 52 dollars valeur per day. Straight ahead in 100 meters is a garage with a flat rate of 36 dollars. Drive off and do your holidays!

Reviews.Title: “awful, smelly, rude staff, 2 star dressed up....”
Reviews.Author: toshasan1
Reviews.Content: stayd there july 22nd... room was smelly and outdated with a few new add-ons....room was small as hell.....no pool...$53 to park and they took forever to retrieve the car.......we had a bill of 250 left under our door for a weed smell??!!! which was false and obsurd!!! the whole hotel smelled of b.o( body odor) and gym socks...my hubby went the fu** off on them..pack our belongings and we checkd out.....so that foul odor was.ur hotel and.lack of.cleaning....stayd at avenue crown plaza on huron and luvd it...dont stay here the smell is dreadful and the staff are lying, under achiever, minimum wage working a*s pple( rude fu**s)...yes im still pissed

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: enmichels
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a ladies weekend. We live right outside of Milwaukee so it is about a 2 hour drive to Chicago. We wanted to shop, eat and enjoy the nightlife. After a lot of research, I found Millennium Knickerbocker. The location was perfect, just across the street from The Drake, not far from the Lake, right around the corner from the Magnificent Mile, and a few miles from Rush Street were we went dancing. The rooms are updated, amazing bathrooms, the most comfortable beds with feather pillows and down blankets. The valet parking is pricey, $50.00 per day. Shopping was wonderful, we went in March so it was a little chilly, but we plan to visit again next month. Great hotel, I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AZtravelingkids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two young kids had a great stay at the Knickerbocker. The location is fantastic for a visit to Chicago - close to Michigan Ave and bus routes that go to the museums, zoo, everywhere! Also a short walk to the beach. We had an excellent vacation and will definitely stay here again when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: ALuvsJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel at Christmas time. We had stayed at the Drake a year before so were excited to see how the two hotels compared (the Drake is right across the street). The staff were extremely friendly. The room was pretty small, but more updated than the Drake's guestrooms. The bed was very comfortable and so nice to plop down on after a night of walking the Mag Mile! The hotel's location is perfect. All in all, you can't go wrong with the Millennium Knickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely be back when visiting Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOfFivePeeps
Reviews.Content: The location was absolutely perfect! Our room was very spacious and the service was great. The concierge was extremely helpful. We did eat breakfast off-site everyday because the restaurant in the hotel was pricey and didn't have a great selection but that was no big deal because of the prime location and everything was in walking distance. The only other bad thing was having to pay for internet...$9.95/24 hrs. In the day and age of free WiFi I thought that was a little lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - convenient location for shopping & recreation”
Reviews.Author: Mary6404
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on July 14 and 15. I attended a conference at the hotel. We took an early flight into Chicago and arrived at the hotel hours before check-in time. We were delighted when the front desk offered early check in, especially since my husband needed somewhere to hang out while I was at the conference. The rooms were well-appointed with nice, new bathrooms and high quality linens. We didn't have any problems with noise. The conference center facilities were not the fanciest I've been to, but they were more than suitable. The in-house restaurant, Nix, had a great breakfast menu, and we received excellent service from everyone at the restaurant, especially our server Ali. The food was also very good and reasonably priced. I got a special conference rate which made this hotel a very good bargain for the area. I have stayed at many similar Chicago hotels that were considerably more expensive. The location was excellent. The hotel is very close to a nice beach as well as Michigan Avenue shopping. For example. the shops right next door included Louis Vuitton, Chanel, and Gucci. Macy's Water Tower Place, Saks, and Neiman Marcus are just a couple of blocks away. There is an L station within a few blocks, and, or course, taxis and the bus are available. The business center was great to print out boarding passes or check the internet. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: Michou21
Reviews.Content: We just returned to Toronto from a wonderful 3-day stay in Chicago. We wanted to choose a hotel that would be situated right downtown, but would not be a typical chain hotel, something distinctive and memorable - and also suitable for a 10-year anniversary trip. We were so happy with the Knickerbocker. Our room (a King suite) was extremely clean, with a brand new ultra-modern bathroom complete with rain shower. Our bed was very comfortable, and the big-screen TV was a bonus. We arrived at the hotel in the morning, well ahead of check-in time, and the staff were very friendly and accommodating, offering to let us stow our bags with the concierge. I could tell they were trying hard to get our room ready sooner than the 3pm check-in time, which we really appreciated. We stayed on the seventh floor which was nice and quiet, and our room (#735) was fantastic, we highly recommend it. The bellhop (Tom) and the concierge (Jeff) were extremely helpful and friendly, they made our stay all that much better. The only downfall if we had choose one, is that since it is an older hotel, the elevators are very slow and small and you do need to be patient. But that is a rather insignificant detail, when the overall experience was excellent. Highly recommend the Millennium Knickerbocker and would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: copan28
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in late June. My experience with Millennium hotels is that there is always a line-up to check-in since it seems that only one person works at the reception. The worst is to line up just to ask a question. The concierge doesnâ€™t seem to be on her station often. Since this was an old building, the rooms are smaller than the average rooms in more modern buildings so there is a disconnect between square feet and price charged. The bathroom is updated with modern fixtures and a rain showerhead. The mattress and the sheets were excellent but the pillows has absolutely no firmness. I am not sure what are in the pillows but they provided no support to my head and neck. When I lay my head down on them, my head just sank to the bottom. I woke up with neck strains every morning. The air conditioner was noisy so I turned it off every night before going to sleep but there was also a loud humming noise from the mini-fridge that comes on intervals. Donâ€™t expect to have great views because it is a low rise building. The area is near upscale shops but it is not vibrant. There arenâ€™t many eateries nearby so you might have to make a short walk to Rush\State Street if you want better selections. All in all it was a confortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff, location, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Big88Daddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, but enjoyed an early check-in and the late parking check out the following day. The hotel is located around the corner from the Hancock Tower, and we were able to easily walk to the subway for the Cubs game, and then to the boat dock for the architectural boat tour, that night. My daughter and I felt very safe and the staff treated us like family, giving directions, retrieving our car (for boat tix), and had a genuine interest in our well being. Our room was very nice and clean while the staff could not have been more responsive. We enjoyed dinner in our suite late Saturday after a terrific day in the windy city!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price, friendly staff, good lcoation for the lake”
Reviews.Author: GailRichard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late June 2011 for a 5 day city break. The Hotel is situated close the the Lake, the Oak Street beach and the John Hancock building, which makes it a long way from Soldiers Field and the Adler Planetarium. Choice of restaurants and cafes limited in the immediate area. Room was clean and comfortable, good sized bed and bathroom was well equiped, no bath but a fabulous shower. We had breakfast there once as a Sunday morning treat, it was delicious but quite expensive. Good Hotel if you want to stay in that area, I would chose a more centrally located Hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kern2d
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 13 nights in April. Very nice stay and excellent value. I booked on Priceline for the lowest rate, far lower than I was able to negotiate with the hotel directly (even lower than the corporate rate I normally use). The hotel is nicely updated with comfortable bed and excellent shower. The room was definitely on the small side (as it is an older hotel that was remodeled), but for a single traveler it worked out fine. My room on the 8th floor luckily had a view of the lake between the two buildings across the street. Location is good and within a one block walk to the nearest bus on Michigan Avenue. Staff was fine. I didn't interact with them very much. At least one of the porters was very nice. I would stay here again if the price is right for business. For a vacation with my wife I would choose a place with larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: Rudy906
Reviews.Content: Staying at Millenium Knickerbocker hotel for our business trip was just a treat. Excellent overall experience! We really enjoyed super-soft beds, gorgeous bathroom with marble tile and contemporary shower. But the most memorable was customer service: every time we contacted the staff, they not only met but exceeded our expectations. Drawbacks: there is no pool in the hotel; price is relatively high

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: zamorna621
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nites w/ my 2 kids and enjoyed it. We were on a budget and we got aTravelzoo special for 129/nite for a 2 dbl. bed room. The room did not come w/ a fridge but they brought 1 up for us. This is an old hotel, so don't expect it to be flashy; it was charming. It would be great for a conference/business meeting. I liked the location, as you are just a bit North of Downtown and away from the fray. The shopping was amazing! All designers are across the street. I found a little market 1 block towards the lake on Walton, that had bread, milk, wine, and awesome donuts in the morning for the kids. We also found a little restaurant called Go Roma that had gluten-free pasta, a godsend! We fed a family of 5 for $35 there, with the 2 adults having large salads and a glass of wine. Across the street was Potash market, which had an amazing deli. Our room was quiet, which was great. The staff was lovely. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Harleyclarkey
Reviews.Content: Nice first impressions with a warm welcome at the door and reception. The rooms are fine...really comfortable with all mod cons. Spotlessly clean and the bathroom as well. The location is excellent right beside the Magnificent Mile and walking distance to the bars and restaurants of Rush St.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Zacto
Reviews.Content: The American Concrete Pavement Association held its mid-year meeting at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel in downtown Chicago during the week of June 21, which I attended. I was very impressed with the hotel for a number of reasons. The rate we were given for the stay was very attractive. While the hotel may appear to be an older property, the rooms were quite nice and up to date with comfortable furnishings and what appeared to be newly decorated bathroom facilities that were quite nice. I had the opportunity to eat a couple of my meals on my own in the restaurant on the property and was extremely happy with the quality of the food and the service. The meeting also provided us a number of our meals as well and that too was quite good. What impressed me more than anything was the quality of the service. Everyone I met who worked for the hotel was exceptionally helpful and nice. I would strongly recommend staying here and I look forward to doing so next time my business requires me to stay in downtown Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Sabsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for about 7 nights towards the end of June/early July. We truly enjoyed the restaurants and shopping in the area. Oak Street beach is approximately 7 minutes away by foot. The beds are extremely soft and comfy. However, if you suffer from back issues like myself - slipped disk, you might want to reconsider. The hotel room was super clean and the mini bar was well-stocked. We did take a few items and they replenished it the next/same day which was a nice touch. There was no tub in our room but the "Rain" shower was nice. Room service was great and the bell-hops were so pleasant and helped to give us clear and concise directions. Breakfast was really good. I had the Eggs Benedict with the Spinach and my husband had the Texas cherry chocolate french toast. Our waiter Andre was by far the Most Polite we've met in all our travels. We were saying that if we ran a restaurant, we would offer him a position! The orange granola pancakes we had on another day was so fluffy and sweet. Mmmm. The housekeeping and room service staff were so attentive and were all smiles. They even remembered us and thanked us for the small token/tip we gave them. You almost feel like you've known them for a while. There are a few things to note however. The internet is charged at $9.95 per 24 hrs. What we did not know was that it was PER device. We were charged twice on some days as we were connected to the Internet using our tablet and the occassional phone. So please be careful. We were advised that it is in the hotel terms and conditions so we were obliged. The reception did take 1 internet charge off the first night. Secondly, we ordered room service at around 1025pm one night and we were advised that we could only order from the late-night menu. It clearly states that the late night menu is from 1045pm. There were only 4 things to choose from, one of which was a cheesecake and there were nothing fish/vegetarian. We decided to skip it altogether. The John Hancock centre is located on the next block along with Jamba Juice or a beautiful Italian cafe/bistro L'Appetito for a quick breakfast. There is also the cheesecake factory for the little indulgence late night. The hotel is very close to many fine dining restaurants like Joe's Seafood and Prime Rib, RL restaurant, etc. The great deep dish pizza restaurants like Gino's East, Uno, Ora or Giordanos are also walkable. The hotel is reasonably priced. considering its charm, cleanliness, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Night's Sleep in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rich_coleman
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Knickerbocker over Memorial Day weekend and couldn't fault the hotel. The beds were very comfortable, the room was a decent size with a spotlessly clean and modern bathroom, safe, minibar and large flatscreen TV, and the staff were professional and efficient (we had some storms and one of the nice touches was that the concierge could loan you a complimentary umbrella marked against your room number). I was visiting Chicago with a group of friends and we wanted a location that was convenient for the sights and the lake, but also easy enough to get back to after some nights out, so the Knickerbocker matched that well. At just a block from the Hancock Tower it was easy to walk back along Michigan Avenue or head down to Oak St beach. The hotel was a random choice from Hotwire so I can't comment too much on the value, but for the price we paid at relatively short notice we were very happy, and I wouldn't hestitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Money hungry thiefs”
Reviews.Author: thegame2288
Reviews.Content: Omg so I wanted to impress my lady and take her to a high class hotel somewhere she's never been before. Its Valentine day plus her birthday is the next day. So everything seemed fine of course as I'm giving the clerk the money and something told me not to use a credit card...glad I didn't because we went up to the room and it was super small but she liked it so that's all I cared about... so I sneak downstairs to ask them to bring a bottle of champaign up....now there service would be great if they weren't money hungry the first thing they said was the price and mind u we have a stocked bar in our room filled with liquor about the size of my thumb and wants to charge us for a 5th like amount but because its what she wanted we drank it... I can tell she felt bad me spending way more then I planned on because when we came back from our romantic dinner the champaign was there waiting..she wasnt even excited about it because she knew it costs me.... so I'm trying to make the best of my time so the next day were hungry of course and I am completely out of money except for her gift so she had to pay for our expensive breakfast...and u think this high class high dollar place would just give u breakfast...they don't care about anything but your money...and of course they rush u out of there like a bunch of jerks so I wanted to hurry up and get out of there anyway so we check out and I had to check my finances to make sure I had enough for her gift and I figured I have like 20 or 50 bucks left out of the 200 I had to put down for this room.....NOPE I had zero dollars and I didn't want to blow up because it was her birthday so I chose ti stay calm and leave...now we took her car out there and since we had to 50 bucks a day to park we going to use all the time I paid for..so we get back like 5 min late and they tried to charge us for a extra day....but wait this is where it gets good...the bell boy goes in to tell management and they tell us we won't charge u for a extra day but we noticed that u drank some of the drinks including water which was not free as well and u have to take care of this bill before we release your car..WHAT!!!! Now my lady is fuming hot she couldn't hold it in no more...they tried to hold her car hostage until this little ole 50 dollars was paid off...so we threatened to call our lawyers then she tensed up and said just give us the 50 dollars next week then...so needless to say we didn't.... they took enough from us we will never go back again...as far as I'm concerned that hotel and the management can all burn...yes I said it

Reviews.Title: “High marks”
Reviews.Author: Otoh
Reviews.Content: Hotel with an old world ambiance, but updated and immaculate. Stayed at many hotels in Chicago, but this one gets my top grade. Bed was extremely comfortable; lighting options were excellent--from soft to bright; temperature control was good; safe in room; bathroom was modern and perfect. Restaurant wait staff for breakfast were superior. I had a great stay and loved the feel of the place. Plus, the location can't be beat. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Gem in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marcia2465
Reviews.Content: My sister and I enjoyed the Knick. It is small, I'd call it a boutique hotel but very comfortable. It is close to the Hancock Tower, shopping and many other attractions. We could walk most everywhere. There was only a small restaurant open for breakfast and lunch and a great martini bar. The room was a little small but adequate. Bedding was great.

Reviews.Title: “One hotel not to overlook”
Reviews.Author: GLMS-NC
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd trip to this hotel. The building is an older one, but the hotel is nicely furnished. The staff is very helpful and do whatever they can to service you. My check in was prompt and courteous. My room was well decorated and comfortable. No complaints at all sleeping on the bed. Nice work desk and side chair. Bathroom was well appointed and stocked. Nice shower (no tub) and immediate hot water. Very modern decor in the bath with a wall-mounted new-wave potty. Bar and restaurant very nice with very good service, fair pricing, and good food. The roast beef was to die for at dinner @ Nix (the restaurant). Breakfast buffet was quite tasty as well. Close to Michigan Ave for all the shopping you will ever want to do. Train stations also close. As is the walk to the Lake. If I have two gripes they would be these. First, my HVAC system rocked, but the blower was fairly loud. When on the phone when the blower was running it was a bit tough to hear. It also over powered the TV volume when I had the TV on with a low volume. Second, I continue to be frustrated with the hotel rates of today that I have to pay for internet. I received a very competitive rate, but what does internet really cost? It's a hotel money maker and I wish it was included. I used my Blackberry on my laptop and refused to pay the daily rate. This isn't a big deal to most people, but in today's tech era, make it available to everyone. Just give us a code. Housekeeping was great, never messed with my stuff, did not have to lock anything up, and the room was always very clean. Absolutely no complaints. These are small complaints to an otherwise very enjoyable stay. I would return here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,service and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: helenemeyer
Reviews.Content: Found hotel on internet.Looked up reviews and decided to book it.Excellent choice. Great location,easy to get around.Comfortable room,especially bed. Staff very helpful.Conciege makes great suggestions re whats happening in the city.We took his advice and had a great time ,both at a restaurant and show. Will definately be back too Chicago and will stay again at same Millenium Knickerbocker Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Officially our go-to Chicago hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bcj0nes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a very fun area with lots of shops and restaurants walking distance away. It was a beautiful old building with all the old charm, but lots of updates to make it pleasant and comfortable as well. Great linens and a truly stunning tiled bathroom with a HUGE shower. All the details were perfect, with a beautiful lobby, nice clean hallways with beautiful artwork and a very pleasant, quiet room. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: guada53
Reviews.Content: We were for the Food & Beverage trade Show. We stay for 5 days. The service was great. Its near Michigan Avenue. The most importan things,,, always clean. Definitely we come back Highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel's internet died and elevator out of action”
Reviews.Author: travj1234
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty business-y hotel in a great and safe location where you can walk to just about anywhere. It seems to have lots of conferences/meetings on and subsequently an abundance of people with nametags wandering around and crowding the bar. It's an older/historical building so whilst very nice it's not without some failings in that the internet access for the hotel rooms died while we were there (torturing the poor front desk staff who had to apologise) and an elevator was out of action meaning it could take a while to get from the lobby to your room, especially during peak times or when one of the conferences/meeting groups finished. Staff were fine but not overwhelmingly warm - as I said the place seems more geared toward the business audience rather than tourists asking about the sites, and restaurants and directions etc. Fitness centre was ok also. We booked through Priceline and got a room for $200 incl. taxes so not a bad deal in this pretty expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at great price”
Reviews.Author: BowenLinda
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to Chicago, I stayed at the Knickerbocker for five nights mid May 2011. This was a very last minute trip and I grabbed hotel.com's price of $143 a night for this 4 star in the Near North portion of the Magnificent Mile area. An old building (which I enjoyed) recently renovated, my twin queen bed room was large and modern as was the bathroom. Staff was helpful, ate a breakfast in the hotel's dining room and a snack in the bar, both of which were good. Location was excellent: half a block off of Michigan Ave, 1 or so blocks from Lakeshore Drive and Lake Michigan, an easy walk north to the Old Astor Street Historic District. A few minor room problems were fixed quickly. The only thing I didn't enjoy (which another female sole traveller and I agreed on) was the very raucous bar between about 5 and 7 pm. The vibe didn't feel inclusive and it definitely didn't feel like a bar to relax in with a drink after a day's strenuous visitor activities. However, although I like to try out different hotels, I would definitely stay there again, dependent upon price. A 4.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at friendly rates!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boutip
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a weekend getaway in April 2011. The rate were extremely cheap ($87 plus taxes) for what is a nicely renovated hotel located in the northern section of the magnificent mile. The staffs were very professional and always willing to help. The concierge even help us makes reservation for restaurant and bikes. The view from the room even allowed us to see the lake. At the rate I paid I would recommend this place to evrybody. Free wifi was the only thing missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near beach and shopping”
Reviews.Author: HayOhio
Reviews.Content: This is a great historic hotel in a great location. I took my daughters (26 & 16) and granddaughter (infant) here for a girls' weekend, and it has been so long since I have travelled with a baby that I forgot to book a room with a bathtub, so we had to bathe my granddaughter in the sink! LOL Other than that, it was great! The rooms are very spacious and updated, and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Tops”
Reviews.Author: LPJohnson21201
Reviews.Content: I worked through the sales office on planning a small surprise Birthday weekend with a few friends. From my first interaction with Kelly in Sales to interaction during our stay with Jeff, the concierge, TOP NOTCH service. This hotels is a gem. This was my 2nd time staying at this hotel and I look forward to many more.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs bite here”
Reviews.Author: kaybee6824
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from May 4-May 6, 2011. I was bitten by bedbugs; the marks started showing up several days after I returned. More and more have shown up on my body since then, today is Sunday, May 15. I have seen several other reports on this hotel; unfortunately, it seems the hotel is in denial. This incident is ruining my vacation in Costa Rica. I will be making a report to the hotel on Monday, May 16, when I return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with lots of charm.”
Reviews.Author: cctraveler2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Knickerbocker after a business trip but my stay was cut short as I was robbed (not at the hotel) so it kind of put a damper on the trip. When I decided to leave 2 days earlier I didn't think I could get a refund on those nights since I booked through a third party. After talking to the manager at the hotel they were very kind and agreed to refund my money. The refund was in my acct 2 days after returning home. I don't know how many hotels would do that, really helped ease the pain of the other losses. Besides that I thought the room was very charming, a little smaller than a change hotel but it completely made up for that with its charm. Bathroom was very nice too. Oh yeah - don't forget the lounge/bar area-beautiful and live music too!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaUstinov
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few minutes walk from the center of Magnificent Mile shopping but it is on its own quiet street of hotels, condos and restaurants. The reception desk is a bit humble looking but the lobby is classy and understated with a piano bar and and a nice restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Chicago has a lovely old-fashioned style of service that I thought died off with my parents' generation. Every staff member we encountered in the hotel, bar and restaurant was gracious and friendly. We had a wonderful corner room on the 10th floor. The furnishings were tasteful and comfortable. The bathroom was a pleasant surprise - clad in marble and with very high-end plumbing. All this for a reasonable price on Priceline. The room was not huge but would be considered superior by any standard in Europe or urban North America. I don't know why other reviewers have complained about the room size unless they are used to swinging from the curtains at suburban suites hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: sailmon
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed a Friday night as part of a short trip. We loved the location; just off Michigan Avenue a block north of the Hancock Building. The staff people were helpful and efficient. The room was clean and well-appointed. We especially enjoyed the elegant bathroom with an upscale shower. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Business in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Dragoindahse
Reviews.Content: Nice location downtown and very close to restaurants. Old place but comfortable. As compared to the Drake (right across the street) the price is fair. Only negs: In room charge for Wifi and $55 for valet... really!?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Driver
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. We actually picked this based on reviews on trip advisor and price. It turned out to be a lovely room with a very comfortable bed and most importantly was a few steps from Michigan Avenue. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Value for a Chicago Trip”
Reviews.Author: TLeo47
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed at the Knickerbocker for a wedding the last weekend of March. The staff could not be friendlier. As soon as we walked in the door, we were greeted with smiling faces. We are not world travelers. We had on jeans and sweatshirts after a long car ride, but the girl at the front desk made us feel at ease as soon as she started checking us in. The rooms are a little on the small side (keep in mind that this is an older hotel) but the king bed was huge and very comfortable and the room has everything that you need. (the minibar is totally stocked!) Location is great--we walked everywhere. Started shopping as soon as we got rid of our luggage. Our group (50 strong) took over the bar downstairs on Friday night and no one had any complaints about anything. The drinks, the service--everything was great. I really have nothing at all bad to say about this place. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone considering a nice hotel within walking distance to all the famous Chicago shopping and dining. We had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Shopping location”
Reviews.Author: Abelcast
Reviews.Content: For price you recieve a very good deal. rooms are on the small side but organized very well. The rooms have a very modern feel that still allows you to be very comfortable. The Hotel is clean and beds are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “This is the PLACE”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelingDuo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a business conference. WOW it was really great. The only down sides were the noise of the HVAC system, it was loud, the second was it was great to be able to open the window however the spring were broken and would slam down, could be very dangerous if you had you fingers on the ledge. The room was a good size for an older hotel. They really did not spare any expense when they renovated. Bed was extremely comfortable, bathroom good size, great shower and towels. A MOST important need at any hotel is water pressure; it was great for the shower. Flat screen TV was nice and a good selection of stations. Hotel is close to everything that you could want, shopping, food, and entertainment. Hotel help was also great, very friendly and accommodating. Will come back to visit Chicago and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: cambridgelass60890
Reviews.Content: Beautiful clean rooms, helpful staff, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: Ipyramus
Reviews.Content: My elderly parents needed an ADA compliant room with two double beds. The room was elegant and accommodated them easily. The room was clean, quiet and the beds were "fresh" and luxurious. The door men were always ready to help them in and out of the car. Also, when they did not answer their phone the concierge personally went to their room to make them aware we were waiting for them. The restaurant serves breakfast and lunch only. You don't need dinner because of all the restaurants within walking distance you will want to try from the Cheesecake Factory to The Rosebud Steak House, etc. The breakfast menu is simple and delicious and fairly priced. We had breakfast for $80 with tip for four adults. The omelets were perfectly made and the contents fresh and perfectly sautÃ©ed. The oatmeal, my favorite, was made well and that means it was freshly made with attention to detail. The bacon was well cooked, but not burnt as I asked. One note, basic single rooms have one king sized bed in a smaller room. If you need two double beds or a larger room there will be an up charge of about $30 or more per night. Parking approaches $60 plus tips for the door man so it is not recommended you stay here if you have a car to park. I made the reservation on Priceline and I saw no difference in how we were treated because of the discounted rate. The sales staff also has excellent email communication skills so you can get exactly what you need and confirmation emails to set you mind at ease.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel very uncomfortable in the bar”
Reviews.Author: snoopsstaffs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The hotel its self is great given its low price, its comfortable beds and great bathroom. The location is also fab. I was in Chicago on business with two other colleagues, given our business and the cold weather outside we decided wanted to stay in the hotel bar on the first night for drinks and a meal. On many trips to Chicago we have never been made to feel so uncomfortable by one member of staff who I believe was named David, but as he never introduced himself itâ€™s hard to say. He was rude, refused to come to our table to take our order, instead we had to keep going up to the bar to order food, drinks and to ask for the bill. The other Americans in bar didnâ€™t appear to have a problem as he laughed and joked with them all night. Instead us Brits and my Chinese colleague had to put up with scowls and service ranging from poor to disgraceful . This was most unlike all other hotels visited in Chicago and the rest of the USA. This continued for a couple of nights, in the end, we took our business elsewhere. On our last night we noticed on our way back into the hotel that David was not on duty, so gingerly ventured into the bar again. What a shock, the other bar staff were lovely, couldnâ€™t do enough for us and took the time to come and speak to us for over 15mins. Steven especially was a credit to the hotel and more like the excellent service experience in the past by Millennium hotels. We have used Millennium hotels in the UK and the rest of the world on many occasions and have always found them to offer a very high standard from their staff. I would recommend this hotel and its bar, but only when David is not working.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline on one of the busiest conference weekends in the city. The front desk gal couldn't have been nicer. She set me up with a corner room and was genuinely interested in helping me out. The rooms are very nice, and by far the best bathroom of any hotel I've stayed at in Chicago. A HUGE walk-in shower with hand-held and a ceiling-mounted rain shower head. Just great stuff. Elegant, clean, friendly and high-end says it all about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but nothing flashy”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker Hotel is a classic Chicago hotel in a great location for shopping near the Water Tower Place, the 900 North Michigan shops, and Oak St. However, if you are looking for a hotel nearer to the museums, Grant Park, or State Street shopping, this hotel is a little far North. The rooms are a little small, even the King Superior (which we paid $140/night). We upgraded from the King Standard because the rooms looked small online, but the Superior room was more like a standard room at most other hotels. So, it's a good price compared to other hotels in the area, but don't expect a large room for that price. The rooms are really nice and recently upgraded. Unfortunately, there is no free wi-fi, but I guess that's to be expected since it's less expensive. There's a nice lounge area on the first floor with a great drink selection. The main restaurant in the hotel is only open for breakfast and lunch, but I think the bar/lounge serves food at night. Just an FYI, Valet parking at the hotel was $53/night. Just a block West on Walton, there is a self-park for $36/night. Much better deal unless you really need the in/out privileges offered at the Knickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “Grateful to be stuck in this hotel during the Blizzard of 2011”
Reviews.Author: ginaMcGinnis
Reviews.Content: I was greated by bell staff who despite the cold, were cheerful and accomidating. The front desk staff was welcoming. The next day--the blizzard hit. My room was warm and comfortable while outside my window, I could see the just the opposite. The staff who made it in (or spent the night?) remained professional and in good spirits. As things cleared I was given advice and directions by the bellman to find open restaurants/coffee house. Because the staff did such an excellent job under extraordinary circumstances, I can only believe they do the same on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “The Knickerbocker, where they charge you for everything!!”
Reviews.Author: MetroMastro
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends went specifically to Chicago to see one of the last shows of Oprah and we decided to stay at the Knickerbocker on a referral from my works Travel Services. I definitely won't be doing that again. It would be fine for work cause they reimburse you for everything but not on your own dollar. We arrive on time and go to check in. There were 4 of us in 1 room so we needed a room with 2 double beds. The receptionist was trying to put us on a room with 1 king size bed. She then finds us a room but its directly across from the elevators on the 10th floor with a view of air conditioners and brick walls. Now come the charges, internet is $10- a day for wireless internet. Why not just offer it as a convenience since its already wireless?? Most hotels now offer some kind of coffee in the lobby, nope, not here, you have to actually go into the restaurant and pay for it and anything else. All of a sudden breakfast just cost you $15- a person. Ridiculous! Then we go to use the gym, you would think they would have some water in there to drink just in case you get thirsty. Nope. You call down to the front desk. Oh ya, its on its way. Never came! We go to the bar at the end of the day for a cocktail, ya, $14- martini's and the drinks come in small glasses with measured shots. Onto the room, the beds are not very comfortable. No feather mattresses here. The pillows were tiny and not very comfortable. The bathroom did not have a bath tub and only a shower that was very difficult to operate with very sensitive temperature settings. I forgot, we went to go print our boarding passes, you better make it quick cause they give you 15 minutes to complete the transaction and if you want to use the internet, that costs money per minute. So, if this sounds like the hotel you want to stay at, fee free, just don't say that you were not warned in advance. Good luck and Happy travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh...rooms and service needs some tweeks”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana823
Reviews.Content: First i want to say that we got this room due to a special rate through a third party. Given the price, we were very happy with accommodations and service, but if we had to pay full price - then we would have switched to a different hotel. Our room was fine, the bed was very comfortable - but the temperature guage never really worked right and the shower lacks some water pressure. Walls were paper thin, literally can hear someone taking a shower. Service - concierge service was fine. Our concierge, Sheryl was very friendly and made some nice suggestions. However, the bar in the lobby was a dissapointment! the drinks were terrible and for price, id go across the street to the Drake for someone who knows how to poor a drink. Valet service was prompt and friendly, but again some flaws - when we finally got into the car, it felt as if someone got comfortable and took it for a joy ride. All in all, an alright stay for the price, but tweeks needed with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Alice-thecat
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here for a special weekend in Chicago. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The only negative was the room only had one chair so both of us couldn't sit and read at the same time in the room. There are larger rooms so if you like to spend time in the room you should make sure you get a larger room. The buffet breakfast was excellent and we enjoyed the lunch too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Weekend”
Reviews.Author: xrtek
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an anniversary weekend at the MKH. The staff shines at this hotel, everyone we came into contact with could not have been more helpful or friendly. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable we didn't want to leave it. Fitness room has brand new equipment, and provided a great start to our days there. Location is perfect for shopping on Michigan. We walked to Water Tower to shop and to the Hancock for dinner. We ate breakfast at the hotel and had the buffet, I would recommend ordering off the menu instead, the eggs on the buffet were not good. They do have safes in the room for your valuables. And the bathroom is complete with a fantastic rain shower head. I would definitely return to this gem in Chi-Town.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bring Valuables”
Reviews.Author: JDS003
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a new years eve wedding whose reception was at this hotel. During our stay, someone let themselves into our room and helped themselves to our ipad and other valuables. When we told the hotel staff, they said it couldn't possibly be anyone on their staff and refused to look into it. They were about as unhelpfull as a person could be and basically called my wife and I con artists. If you like having your valuables stolen and being called a liar, then this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JaneDec2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very lovely. I really enjoyed the holiday atmosphere with the beautiful Christmas tree and decorations as well as Christmas music playing in the lobby. Creating a holiday atmosphere was just one example of how they were very intentional in giving the customer a great experience. Not only was the hotel staff extremely helpful (especially the bellmen and concierge), they were cheerful and friendly. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable with very nice amenities. Lastly, the location of the hotel is close to great shopping and eating while at the same time quiet and a nice break from the business of the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great dining experience”
Reviews.Author: magclass
Reviews.Content: I recently hosted a Thanksgiving Dinner/ Family Reunion at the Price Of Wales room. The staff was incredibly attentive and the food was head and shoulders above the other "high-end" venues I have used in the past. The Knickerbocker has earned my return business. I would strongly recommend this venue for a great private dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: iijiiiji
Reviews.Content: I had a good time with my boyfriend there for 4 days in this hotel. The hotel is located right next to John Hangkock bldg. and shopping street, but it is very quiet. Also, It takes only 3 mintutes to get to Lake Michigan on foot. The lady in concierge room was so kind and gave lots of imformation about the city. She looked like she is 40ish years old, she explained well about Frank Lloyd Wright`s architecture arounf the city. It was so helpful. Also, every morning we could have apples in the basket on the concierge desk. haha The only thing that made me dissatisfied was that the room was a little bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Standard, quasi-upscale hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: I lived in Chicago for four years and return frequently (at least twice a year) for business trips as well as long weekend vacations. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in various neighborhoods over the years, and Millennium Knickerbocker didn't meet the standards others have set. There was nothing particularly wrong with the hotel stay (other than the rundown state of the bathroom and the noise in the hallways). The hotel is located across the street from the Drake hotel, so it's in a hot bed for available cabs. There is no easily accessible parking garage nearby, so valet is the only -- very expensive -- option. A few other hotels in the same general area have the advantage of being next door to separate parking garages that will bill the charges to the hotel's front desk. This is a bit larger than I am generally comfortable with, particularly in a large city, because the service feels impersonal and unavailable. If I'm going to stay in Chicago for work or leisure, I'm going to go back to the Peninsula or the the Park Hyatt, which are higher price points. But they're worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: RunnerGirlOH
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a business/leisure trip. Hotel is right off of Michigan Avenue. Rooms were a good size for a city hotel and clean. Service was excellent from check in, to the concierge, to room service. The location is fantastic. You can walk to Lincoln Park, Old Town, shopping on Michigan Avenue, and the John Hancock Building. I like that the hotel is near the John Hancock Building so you could walk anywhere and would not get lost as you can always see the Hancock from anywhere in the city. The only con, and it is small, is that you have to pay for internet access in your room. There is free access in the lobby if you have a laptop with you. Otherwise you have to pay to use the business center computers or have access in your room. I haven't seen that expense for a long time at a hotel especially in a city like Chicago. No big deal though, I just went to the lobby each morning and got the free service, just a little inconvenient. Otherwise, great place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great service”
Reviews.Author: lcshea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The room is well appointed and the bathroom is very nice, especially the shower. All the staff was welcoming and accommodating, from the front desk to the room service man (not sure of his name but he was very friendly) to the concierge. The only negative in my opinion is having to pay $9.95 a day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cutler33
Reviews.Content: came from las vegas to chicago for a family wedding. The hotel was beautiful ,staff was great very helpful. Beds were the best I have ever had in a hotel room. Hotel was in great location walking distance to everything. Staff was top notch very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My-2 cents !”
Reviews.Author: Toi-Singha
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for the Halloween weekend and stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel. The hotel had a Fall promotion going on with really good rates. The purpose was to have some fun and to get out of the heat of South Florida. No problems with reservations or check-in. Front desk was very friendly and with no line ahead of us, it took only 5-minutes to get to our room on the 12th floor. I have not stayed at the Knickerbocker before, so I cannot compare it to the past. The property is older, but has been modernized with very comfortable beds, flat screen TV's and a huge showerhead ! Everything in the room worked fine. The rooms are not too big, but certainly functional enough to suit my needs. The Concerige's were terrific with giving directions, advice and reservations. BTW, for anyone that is very critical of hotel attitude, try loosening up your purse ! When a Conceirge gets you into a name restaurant , club, cruise, or what have you...$how some gratitude. A $10 or $20 can mean the difference of getting to do something on short notice, or sitting it out. Besides, you are there to have fun, don't cheap out. We ate at the hotel cafe for breakfest; "Nix" just off the lobby. They offered a buffet for $18 and it was excellent. Juice, coffee, pasteries, eggs, french toast, bacon & saussage, fruit, all very tasty ! Lastly, after an amazing steak dinner in town, we came back for a nightcap at the hotel bar. Cut up with the bartenders and several patrons around the bar. Nice ensemble playing too. All in all, and fantastic stay. Here's my bottom line. You can stay at newer property with far bigger rooms in Chicago. To me, the whole purpose was to have a nice room with a place to stash my shopping until we left. If you require a larger room decked out to the nines, then stay at the Trump. I love the location of the Knickerbocker, and the staff was just fine. Best to all

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with rather lackluster staff”
Reviews.Author: Clarkthehorse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Knickerbocker for 1 night when I was in town for a conference. It's a nice hotel overall -- fantastic location off of Michigan Avenue, beautiful lobby, clean, nice rooms. What I really noticed though, was the total apathy of the staff. All the staff in the lobby -- doormen, behind the front desk, the folks helping with bags -- had very poor guest interaction skills. No real greetings or smiles, and didn't make much of an effort to help when I had questions. I mentioned this to my husband when I returned home and he said "so what? Do you really need very friendly staff?" The answer is no, I don't need them, but it would have made the stay more memorable. When I return to that area of Chicago, I'll definitely try a different hotel, because the niceties of good customer service do make an impression, and make a difference. The one exception to my experience with the staff were the room service waiters. I had two different ones and they were both very friendly. I would have given the Knickerbocker 5 stars if I had had a different experience with their personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but only if $5 OJ glass & $7 coffee are acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: Vaitraveling
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel, clean and well located. Really great location actually. Rooms are modern and stylish but if that means that you need to be charged $7.00 for coffee and $5.00 for a glass of orange juice, I'm sorry but that is outrageous. So outrageous that I don't think I would stay there again. I found that ancillary fees exist in hotels too, it's ridiculous and the hotel charges you for every little thing.... Lastly, I called room service one evening (around 11PM) and could not get anything as they were going through a shift change so they told me to call back in 30 minutes! Really? I don't think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “really fancy!”
Reviews.Author: ree646
Reviews.Content: so i was in chicago for work for only a couple of nights and i was hardly in the hotel. i was unhappy about that because i had a really nice room in a really nice hotel! the location was quite convenient too. i had to get a fancy room coz they ran out of standard ones. :) so i had a living room and bedroom, comfy bathroom all to myself. the food was good, they had a bar in the lobby. i dont think they had a pool but i didnt have time to go to one anyway. the hotel had this really nice old world feel to it. it was pricy but luckily i wasnt paying! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Knickerbocker went the extra "magnificient" mile for us! True Story!”
Reviews.Author: DianneWindsor_ON
Reviews.Content: The service that we received was magnificent!! We were surprised with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries! How sweet it was! Quirine Van Oldenborgh went out of her way to make our stay extra special. The hotel has modern amenities, yet has exquisite historical charm. The bar has the perfect balance that allows you to mingle with others or find a quiet place to enjoy a drink. The live entertainment made it that much better! Thanks for a wonderful stay! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, perfect location, but...”
Reviews.Author: djmuffins
Reviews.Content: Why did the cleaning service come into our room at 8 in the morning when we were to check out at 11???? Other than that, overall was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, incredibly comfortable and well situated hotel - a find!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal026
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago with my daughter looking at colleges and we spent one night at the Knickerbocker. The hotel is amazing. Beautiful. Comfortable. Friendly. Quiet. Incredible location. Really nice and helpful staff. No complaints - we loved it. We got a great rate on the room - it was the weekend of the Chicago marathon, so it was hard to find a room at a reasonable rate, and the Knickerbocker was the best rate I could find. We weren't sure what to expect, but could not have been more delighted. We will absolutely stay there again when we are next in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: lananh28
Reviews.Content: I had the best experience in Chicago and it was in part due to the staff at the Millenium Knickerbocker. The staff are very knowledgeable and very helpful when it came to giving directions and foos tips. Another added bonus was that everything was walking distancde from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “25 Years Later”
Reviews.Author: Chiguy72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent our 25th Wedding anniversary at the Knickerbocker. We had our wedding reception at the grand ballroom with the lighted dance floor and decided to return to the â€œscene of the crime.â€� The guest services manager Quirine Van Oldenborgh went out of her way to let us have anniversary dance while the concierge Jeff volunteered to take photos. They treated us to champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, too. If we were a bit older, it would have doubled for a scene from the film â€œMake way for tomorrow.â€� The entire staff made certain our visit was something special. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to visit Chicago (or for a wedding!) Perfect location to shopping and transportation, nice size and clean rooms, and outstanding staff. Hope to be back at 50!

Reviews.Title: “I think I was bitten by a bed bug there.”
Reviews.Author: rbecker212
Reviews.Content: I hate to write this review, because I was pleased with the hotel overall. Rooms were clean; beds comfortable; staff pleasant (especially the wait staff at the restaurant.. super attentive!). When I returned home, though, I found a set of bug bites on my stomach and ankle. I researched on the Internet and found that the pattern of bites is characteristic of bed bugs.. I was traveling alone and no one else in my family (husband or kids) have had any bites, so it's unlikely to have come from my house. I called the hotel and spoke with management. The manager I spoke with said that "to the best of her knowledge" they haven't found bed bugs at the hotel and that they are checked regularly. I asked her whether she would have a professional check the specific room I'd stayed in and call me back since I was concerned. She said "Definitely." That was 3 days ago and I haven't received a call back yet. Since then, I've been up nights worrying about whether the bite came from the hotel and whether I carried bugs back to my home. Given the hotel's quality and rating, I'm surprised at how lightly they apparently took this information.

Reviews.Title: “~I almost burst into tears for such as a special attention in the Knickerbocker hotel~”
Reviews.Author: mushikaz
Reviews.Content: ~I decided to book a reservation at Millennium Knickerbocker hotel in Chicago, I'm from Austin texas, I decided to go there 'cause my 20th anniversary, when I booked the reservation I called the Reservations department and spoke with one agent named Johnny (I guess that was his name) I cant describe such as a great customer service this guy provided me, but that wasn't all. Upon arriving, the front desk staff was exceptional, I can say the best staff I've seen comparing to another hotels, but what surprised me the most was, when we arrived to our room, there was a tray with strawberries covered with chocolate and two bottles of water and a greeting card saying "Happy Anniversary". That detail really made my wife and I feel feel very comfortable, more than happy because I have stayed at previous hotels and noone has done such asa great thing, and besides it was a very special celebration for my wife and I. I believe this was a detail from the reservations department, and I obviously sent a letter congratulating the person who set it up for us. The hotel was extremely clean, our room was beautiful, the housekeeping staff was great, we enjoyed the Martini Bar and the piano music, the bellman was great and helpful. Our departure was kinda sad 'cause we wanted to stay a few days more but what my wife and I are sure is that we will def come back soon and will recommend this hotel to any person. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on a prime location”
Reviews.Author: elderc
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel with a great location on Chicago. It's right behind the John Hancock Center and you'll be next to the Oak Street Beach and the shops on Michigan Avenue. In a 20-minute walk you can reach the Loop and the Millenium Park. My room wasn't huge, but it had a good bed and a nice sized bathroom. Maybe it needs a little renovation, but was functional. I would recommend this hotel, but depending on your goals in the city you'll be better staying nearer to the Loop.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location at end of Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: boston76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of the summer and had a great stay. The hotel is less than one block from the Magnificent Mile, so you are close to shopping and restaurants. The Hancock Tower is one block away. As for public transportation there are countless bus lines that have multiple stops along Michigan Ave, but the closest Metro ("L") stop is a good 5 minute walk. Our room (728, a Superior Plus Corner King) was very spacious and from one window we could see Michigan Ave. The bathroom was also very large. Our expectations of the hotel and the room matched the information we found on their website and from other TA reviews. I'm glad that we stayed here and would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “terrible shoebox room with dirty comforter!”
Reviews.Author: mdotson_10
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed in this hotel in 2005 but the date wouldn't let me go back that far. First of all, the hotel pictures are beautiful and gives the idea that the rooms would be like that as well. We booked are hotel through Hotels.com and loved the pictures as well as the location. We spend a lot of money to stay at this hotel and the room with a Queen size bed was the size of a shoebox.. The first thing we noticed when we set out luggage down was the huge dirty stain on the comforter. Also we had requsted a non-smoking room but the room next to us was smoking so it didn't make a difference. The bathroom was the size of a closet and it only had room for one person. Every day we would ask the comforter to not be put back on the bed and everyday we would come back to the nasty stain. We tried many times to switch rooms which the hotels refused to do unless we upgraded to a suite causing our already expensive room to be outrageous. We couldnt afford to upgrade but pleaded with the desk that with the smoke from the next room and the comforter we were miserable. The staff was not helpful on this matter. The one thing we did appreciate from the hotel was the conceriage service. They were wonderful, curtious, and very knowledgeable about the nearby attractions and restuarants. My husband and I will NEVER go back there and we tell all our friends not to go to this hotel. We wished we had made reservations elsewhere for that amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Location/location/location”
Reviews.Author: Katris
Reviews.Content: Good things: 1- Location: half a block from Michigan Av., but far away from the noise. Quiet and close to most of what you will be visiting. Also quiet inside (walls must be thick, I had a lot of trouble with other hotels before, this one seemed like heaven). 2- Rooms: not huge, but you have space to move. Nice ambiance, TV, bathroom, etc. But the best of all is the bed. Great mattress; great sleep. Safe and mini bar included. 3- Very friendly and helpful staff Bad things 1- There are no real supermarkets close to the hotel. All I saw was CVS or another pharmacy where you can buy the basics. (Forget the high scale shops, you are surrounded by them). If there was a place, I missed it. 2- Very few TV channels. Itâ€™s not that I cared much since I was mostly out, but I would have liked more choices 3- Business center in which you have to pay. I was not travelling with my laptop and therefore to use 15 minutes of internet I had to pay 6 dollars. Not sure about using your laptop. 4- They charge you more than a dollar for every 1-800 (therefore free) phone call that you make. To me, thatâ€™s outrageous for any hotel in any place in the world. Overall the price is worth it. I would definitely go again. I also received the hotelâ€™s survey and completed. Thanks for sending!

Reviews.Title: “nice location but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: northernator
Reviews.Content: warning--the employees, though very nice, are extremely hungry for tips. also--53 dollars for parking! 5 dollar tip for mandatory valet parking, 5 for luggage brought up stairs, and back out the next day, it ran me 73 bucks to get in and out of there. about as much as we paid for the room, as we used priceline. rooms are small, but not a surprise as this hotel was built in the thirties or something like that. too small actually. I don't think I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...”
Reviews.Author: bitbytravelbug1
Reviews.Content: Arrived the evening of August 12. The check in process was efficient and the front desk person was polite. We were located on the 12th floor facing Walton St. and did not have much of a view, but that was not really a concern for us. The room itself was clean and the size was what we would expect for a hotel room in the downtown area of any city. There was a fully stocked mini-bar with a compliment of snacks and things that you may need - small first aid kit, cork screw, shaving cream etc. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable which ensured a fantastic night sleep each and every night. The bathroom was appropriately sized for the room and featured a stand up shower. Other reviews have indicated that the over head rain shower head did not have much pressure - we found this to be true as well but not a detriment. The hand held nozzle more than made up for it. The only criticism we had for the bathroom was that the toilet was too high off the floor and did not make for a very comfortable experience! LOL! This may not effect all people but I can say that one of us is 5'4 and the other is 6'0 and both of us were not exactly comfortable - but really, just how much time are you gonna spend there anyway! The air conditioning in the room worked very well to cool the room, but it was a damp cold. The location was close walking distance to Michigan Avenue though it is at the North end of the street. You walk the whole 'Mag Mile' to get places. Those who would wish to lessen the walking distance would perhaps like to stay somewhere in the middle. We enjoyed the location and loved having access to Old Town where there are plenty of interesting restaurants and unique shops. We did the Chicago Food Planet - the Near North tour, which was a guided food tour of Chicago neighbourhoods. The walking tour was about 3 hours in duration and led us to areas that we may not have found otherwise. Favourite stops were to a spice shop and an olive oil shop. If we had to state a criticism about this tour, I guess it would be that the tour does not end where it starts. You are left to find your way back which is a couple of miles from where your hotel is likely located. The day we took the tour it was extremely hot and humid. We took a cab back to the shops we wanted to buy things at and then walked back to the hotel. We also did a segway tour and architectural boat tour which were a fantastic way learn about the city. All in all the Millennium Knickerbocker was a great place to stay. The hotel staff were very friendly. In fact, every staff member (this included non-front-line staff such as mechanical staff) we came in contact with acknowledged us and asked us if we were enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for great price”
Reviews.Author: MiloMiami
Reviews.Content: This is a find. Reasonably priced and a great bar in lobby. Concierge was 3 for 3 on excellent recommendations for restaurants. Andre was the waiter for breakfast buffet. For 3 mornings, this waiter was welcoming, helping and true service with a smile. He actually wants to do a terrific job.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: katstat11
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience as a tourist to Chicago. We booked this hotel online and liked what we saw. Upon arrival, we were given a room near the elevator. We asked to be changed to a quieter room and within minutes were given a room near the end of a hallway. It was a little smaller but it had a better view from our windows. The staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful. Our housekeepers were thorough and so polite. We were able to walk to all the stores along Michigan Ave. and used the trolley/double decker buses to get around elsewhere. Well worth the $35.00 we paid for the three days of service and the guides offer a lot of information about the city. We ate at a place called Rosebud and had the best lasagna ever. It was a recommendation from a staff member at the desk outside. If I ever visit again, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a somewhat small room”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Nice rooms - Good location, close to the city beaches - Courteous staff Cons: - Somewhat cramped room compared to other Chicago hotels I have stayed at - Poor noise isolation between room and hallway Stayed at the Knickerbocker four nights in July and got a good deal through Priceline. The interior of the room and bathroom was very nice and most importantly, very clean. The shower was huge, but the ceiling rain shower had poor pressure. The handheld shower head had good pressure, but could not be mounted above my head. I could hear the beep from the elevator through the door and noise from the hallway did sound through the door. I was not bothered by it, but I would consider it a potential problem. Location was nice as the hotel is situated in the north end of the Magnificent Mile, close to the Hancock Tower. The beach is just a block away, and the closest subway station (red line) is about 4 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: bhighlande
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect at this hotel, but I was very impressed. We got a great rate, $89 I believe, on Hotwire. The room had apparently just been remodeled and it was excellent. Great shower and the decor was very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable. It seems that everyone there had been in training on how to treat their customers nicely. I had the buffet breakfast and it was very good and the wait staff was very attentive and helpful. I especially want to recognize Andre for being so helpful. I've stayed at 8-9 Chicago hotels and this was my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great North Michigan hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bigtedshred
Reviews.Content: Won the Knickerbocker on Priceline. We were on a higher room (10 I believe). Our room was small, but most reviews of this hotel say the rooms are small. It felt small and cramped with just two people! The bathroom was pretty large though. No tub, but large rainfall shower with great water pressure. No view either, but I'm not sure if many rooms have views. Location.. Very good. Slightly north, but right off Michigan, and super easy access to Bus/CTA Lines and cabs. TV was a good sized LCD with all the usual stuff. Room was kept very clean by the staff. Internet was free in the lobby (didn't find that out until the end of the trip; would have saved me some starbucks trips). Overall, no complains except the room size! I'd stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome”
Reviews.Author: busysvacationtime
Reviews.Content: The staff front desk craig,the bartender steve even the door men were amazing.Our room was not giant but it was fresh and clean and up to date.when your on a trip with that special person you dont need a 2000 sq ft room .And breakfeast in bed was also perfect.right on top of all the shopping. You can even walk to navy pier. Good job to the KNICKERBOCKER

Reviews.Title: “Best deal ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker for 3 nights in July. What a great place - comfy beds, large/quiet room in a 4 star hotel one block from Lake Michigan on the Gold Coast. 10-15 minute walk from the loop with great shops and restaurants close by....highly recommend the architectural cruise on the Chicago River and a trip to Wrigley Field. Would definitely return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Aliceesjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed her over the weekend and spend some time in downtown Chicago. The rooms are good and clean. Roomservice is good too. The location is grwat, right around the corner of the Magnificent Mile. Surley would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Sandyj83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium KB for the 4th of July weekend. It was a nice hotel overrall. The room was a decent size with a great bathroom, very modern. Rainshower was great. Bed was super comfortable. My only complaint about the room is that the air conditioner made too much noise throughout the night that I kept waking up from it. Other than that the location is great, just off Michigan Ave, in the heart of all the shopping. If you're a beach-goer, the North Ave beach is just down the street and short walk away which was wonderful!
