If you're driving into Chicago, there is a pkg garage across the streett from the hotel that only costs $35 a night as opposed to the higher hotel rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Miss With the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: patrolman_pete
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up and were welcomed by the doorman, the Knickerbocker felt right. This is a classy old hotel that has been fully renovated, and the service is top-notch. Location is excellent (and very safe), with numerous shops, restaurants and attractions nearby. The room I stayed in had a king size bed and although it was cozy, it was very well designed to feel bigger than it was. The bathrooms are great and well-appointed, although anyone who needs a bathtub should ask for one as my room had a shower only. Elevators are absurdly quick for such an old building (I don't think I ever waited more than 10 seconds), and the rooms were very quiet. The hotel staff were all genuinely warm, pleasant and helpful. This is an ideal location for leisure travellers given the proximity to the Michigan Avenue shops, Navy Pier and other attractions. It is a bit of a hike to reach the El, but taxis are always easy to find. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth it !!”
Reviews.Author: UpperwestsideNewYork
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I have a fairly young appearance, and are not very snobby either. Normally, this doesn't yield use the best possible service in most places, but not in the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel Chicago. We were treated with the best possible attitude and really very kindly by all staff. The hotel's breakfast restaurant serves excellent food, it was a real pleasure to eat there (just bring your sweater for the A/C). Veggie omelet and French toast were seriously delicious, and come out on top even by NYC/Upper West Side standards - a real treat it was!! Even the price was right. I can warmly recommend this hotel for people who enjoy good quality - the room was very comfortable and very quite. Also the hotel's location was great, with easy access to main sites, and just steps from the lake shore/beaches. Pluses on all fronts for this outstanding hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming but slightly outdated”
Reviews.Author: Libs1414
Reviews.Content: Nice meeting space, a little more interesting than your typical conference rooms. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business travelers. Much quieter than some of the larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: DonTimmy
Reviews.Content: First time at this Hotel. Staff & Service is excellent! Loved the breakfast buffet and late night drinks at the lobby bar!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: lmbryant
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Millenium Knickerbocker was extremely enjoyable. The hotel is clean, well-staffed with friendly employees, up-to-date, and in a great location. We found it incredibly easy to take public transportation to and from everywhere we wanted to go (including the airport) without ever having to walk more than a few blocks. The hotel offers great views of the city and is a very safe neighborhood. The bathrooms were clean and updated, and the rooms were modern and well-designed. It was everything we needed for a GREAT price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient off Michigan ave location.”
Reviews.Author: Muzz515
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2010 for 3 nights. Good location just off Michigan Ave and across the street from the Drake. Room we had was small, but updated with VERY comfortable bed! Bathroom was nice with marble tile, granite counter (very small) and dual shower head with rain yet sort of pain to use. Breakfast in the hotel is good, but takes a while so if you are in a hurry, don't eat there. You can walk to all of the good shopping on Michigan ave as well as walk to Navy Pier. Vallet parking a bit pricy at $50 bucks a night and it takes them about 10 min to get your car out. Highly recommend you eat at Joe's Crab for dinner and Gibson's Steak house is a must do, but you will need reservations in advance. Valore was also very good for some authentic Italian cuisine, and try the Wit for some good bar atmosphere. If you want to use internet, they will charge you per computer, not per room. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: austin_res
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker over Memorial Day weekend. I got this hotel through bidding on priceline resulting in more than 50% savings off the regular rate. Like the Intercontinental, the Knickerbocker is an old hotel that combines historical charm with modern luxuries. Pros: * Free wireless internet in lobby, with grand piano performance * Close to Michigan Avenue * Great location for downtown * Recently renovated rooms Cons: * Rooms may be small and would feel cramped for families * Small elevators - can fill up fast if you have luggage

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulineMac2010
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us staying in this hotel 1 of which was my 2 year old son, and the staff were great with him!! We all loved the hotel, great location, great staff (especially David and Steven at the bar) and the rooms where okay. We had 1 double and 1 king room, both lovely inside and very well maintained. The bigger of the 2 rooms was hot, but once we informed the front desk (11.45pm) they sent a fan up and the maintenance man came the next morning. I would stay at this hotel again, as it is near the shops, beach, and Navy Pier!!! The only problem we had was at the end. The hotel couldn't, for some reason, put through my husbands (clear) credit card and we had to put 1 room on our debit card and pay the other with left over cash, just as well we never bought that ipad!!! The hotel needs to get this sorted for international guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaredCul
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here while visiting Chicago for St.Patricks Day. Though the room was small, it was very modern and upscale at a decent price. Upon checkout they gave me a $50 per night voucher towards my next stay. Will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, expect to pay extra for everything”
Reviews.Author: Richard808
Reviews.Content: There are submarines that have more space than the regular rooms in this hotel. We booked though Prcieline and paid a slightly higher fee for free in-room Internet access. The hotel refused to honor that, saying they had to charge extra. When I complained, they said the problem was with Priceline, not them. While the hotel is in a convenient location, we learned that the Sheraton Suites, around the corner are a far better deal. The bathroom is tiny, the shower has an irritating spray from the ceiling and is so small there isn;t even a bathtub. There is no dresser. The air conditioner has two settings, off and hurricane force.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Ely63
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel via Hotwire, when you don't knew the hotel until you have paid, so we were a little worried. We had no need to be, as this hotel is an elegant older hotel with a modern twist. The outside of the hotel is very grand, & our room was traditional for the period but with a fabulous modern bathroom & flat screen TV & comfortable bed. The staff, including the doorstaff, reception, bar staff & maids were delightful & curteous. we were constantly asked if we needed any help. Because we booked last minute, we hadn't done much research, but the consierge was very helpful with recommendations for places to visit & eat. We followed his instructions & had some excellent meals & thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We liked the free internet access in the lobby & this was enhanced by the beautiful playing of the grand piano whilst sipping a cocktail. we were lucky to have nice weather, & found the people of Chicago warm & helpful. The hotel is in an ideal location near all there is to see within walking distance. The Navy pier was dissapointing, not really much to see or do unless you like fast food, tame fairgrounds & boat trips. The museums & galleries are great but can be pricey, so ask at the hotel which days are free. Most museums have a day when enrty is free from 4pm to 7.30pm

Reviews.Title: “Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: travel1910
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker has been nicely renovated! My room was spacious and well appointed. The staff was helpful and courteous. I would stay here again - love the location! After checking in we noticed some construction noise - called the front desk and they explained that the fitness center was being renovated and the workers would be stopping by 4:00pm. We were perfectly fine with the explanation - and saw no need to change rooms. Exactly as promised the noise stopped. We stayed for 5 nights - and we weren't bothered by the renovation at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: Was a bit concerned about the previous reviews of this property but was very pleased with the professional and helpful night shift desk staff as well as the room layout and amenities. The renovation is a success with small but elegant style and the best possible use of bathroom space (no tub-just the shower). I had used a last minute booking service but was treated very well by all staff. A great hotel with a fabulous location. Thanks especially to the late shift staff who were very helpful during check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wannago30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were always greeted by a smile. Our room was very nice and quiet. The beds were very comfortable. We booked this hotel directly through their website and received a great rate. The location was great. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, bad management.”
Reviews.Author: Meurling
Reviews.Content: In February this year I and my wife stayed at Millenium Knickerbocker for four nights. Over all we had a good time in Chicago and the hotel was good value for the money. Since we forgot to bring an adapter for the electric equipment we borrowed one at the concierge desk. At checkout we returned the adapter to the concierge. When we got home to Sweden I discovered that the hotel had charged my Amex with $25. They claimed that we hadnâ€™t returned the adapter. I explained in an email to the hotel that we certainly had returned it but I never got an answer neither did I get the money back. The way I see it the hotel has robbed us of $25. If we had forgot to return the adaptor we would at least have got something for the money. Watch out for bad management at Millenium Knickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “Understated class”
Reviews.Author: Careerguru
Reviews.Content: Our team stayed here for a work related confrence and could not have been happier. The employees seemed genuinely welcoming. What a surprise when I got to my room and saw the upgraded king room. I have stayed at many city hotels and was pleased with the size of the room. The marble bathroom and rainshower were classy, clean and not cluttered. The location was fabulous being close to the shops and resaurants but the part we all enjoyed was relaxing in the bar with the real piano player, to the wee hours. This is one place I look forward to coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: MaMaKitten
Reviews.Content: This hotel let us down from the moment we arrived. My husband and I have both traveled extensively for both business and pleasure. We always thoroughly research hotels and the knickerbocker had some great reviews. Because we were in town with a conference, my secretary booked through the conference travel office. There was some miscommunication about the package and room type we had requested. We got into town after driving all night and the first thing they told us was that we couldn't get into our room until 3pm even though we had already paid to check in the night before. After much argument, they "found" a room for us to get into immediately. She also said that we had reserved two doubles and we said that no, we had actually asked for a king room and they agreed to check us in but not at the rate we had been quoted. We finally agreed to the higher rate because we were exhausted and were running late to a meeting. I then asked about a sleeper sofa because I had my two young children with me and was told no, that the room with the king bed did not have a sleeper sofa. We asked for a rollaway and they agreed to bring it up. When we got to the room, the four of us could barely get in the door and I still do not know where they were planning to put the rollaway bed. It was the tiniest room I have ever seen.The bellman apologized and offered to go talk to the desk for us. This began a game of good cop bad cop between the bellman and the front desk "manager" She was the worst. She also insisted to me that she had no boss, she was the end all be all and that I was not permitted to speak to anyone else. She told us that we could fit better in a room with two double beds so we said fine that we would take the two doubles. At that point, we went back to the not getting in until 3pm argument. The story changed at this point and the woman told us that since we reserved a king room, we'd have to wait. When I pointed out that she was just plain lying, and asked to pay extra for a suite, just trying to get into a room, she suddenly "found" a room for us and let us check in. So we get to the room and the rooms are the most overpriced, underquality that I have EVER seen. There are no tubs, they get only about ten channels (most of them sports) and they charge extra for a fridge. They don't even have Nickelodeon. Do not ever stay here with kids! The recent redo was done by an architect with absolutely no commen sense apparently because the details are wrong. For example, you cannot reach the knob to turn on the shower without getting drenched by the cold water. We had to get our own ice, which is not something you expect in a hotel like this. Then the stuff that didn't work list was just a mile long...The hair dryer, the alarm clock, the air conditioner, tv remote...it went on and on. The view was of part of the roof. One of the lights in the room would not turn off. And there are no dresser drawers in the room at all. No room service and the concierge was not even remotely helpful. I asked about the shuttle to our conference and he had no idea but as he walked away I saw the poster with the times sitting on the floor behind his desk. Add to all of this that they did construction all day and the music from the wedding receptions downstairs blared long into the night (even though we were on the fourth floor). We had friends stay down the street and pay half what we paid but have a phenomenal experience. I will NEVER go near this hotel again. It was awful and as we walked in and out of the lobby, I kept seeing other people at the front desk arguing about one thing or another. Obviously, we aren't the only ones who hate this place.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a second class guest.”
Reviews.Author: chisox601
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Knickerbocker and like my previous stay there is nothing wrong with this hotel, however there really isn't anything spectacular either. I travel to Chicago 4 to 5 times a year and generally use priceline for my hotel reservations. This is the only hotel where I have had to pay an upgrade fee ($40) for a room with 2 beds , seemed like a little much considering the hotel didn't seem very full. On about 75% of my reservations in Chicago the Hyatt Regency accepts my hotel bid and always accomodates my room request without an upcharge. At the Millenium however I was basically told that since I did not choose this hotel and in essence was placed there, they were going to ensure other guests who "chose" to stay here were taken care of first. Unfortunately for my trip in May I have been "placed" at this hotel again for 3 nights. I've already contacted the hotel with my request to spend an additional $120 for my stay. Be careful if you travel with more than 2 people and use priceline because if you're "placed" at this hotel any sort of deal you recieved will mostly likely be negated by additional charges. That said the showers here are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: AussieSlumDog
Reviews.Content: I had a red eye flight and turned up at 6.30am. The staff were very accommodating and checked me in straight away. Earliest time I have ever checked in. The room was clean and very comfortable. The location was just off the Magnificant Mile. Great location. Overall it was worth staying at. The only issue I might have was the cost of internet. Not all that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Added room charge”
Reviews.Author: notiller2004
Reviews.Content: If you win a bid through Priceline for this hotel, expect to get hit with an added room charge when you check in. The hotel increased my room charge by $40 (I noticed someone else had that same experience). I did talk with the hotel manager after the experience and he listened patiently, but in the end said only he understood how it would "leave a bad taste in your mouth". If you go to the hotel's website, an upgrade is only $20. This is the only hotel that I have Pricelined and they did not honor the deal!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithoutkids
Reviews.Content: Having been attracted to the Knickerbocker by a 72 hour sale, and never having visited Chicago, we were guarded in our expectations. This hotel is in a great location, has friendly, helpful staff (especially the Concierge desk) , and has done a great job renovating the guest rooms. The bed was extremely comfortable and the modern bathroom,was well-appointed. We appreciated our accommodations the more that we settled in to them. We found the atmosphere to be quiet and relaxing. We booked a junior suite which gave us a bit more room and an extra flat-screen T.V. The window overlooked the back of another building across a courtyard, but I was so happy to have a window that opened to allow in fresh air that it really didn't matter. I have environmental allergies that are often set-off in hotels, but I had absolutely no issues here. Our room felt and looked clean and fresh. We came in by train and cabbed it everywhere (highly recommended for first-timers to Chicago), so I can't comment on parking. The only part of the hotel that still looked a bit shabby were the elevators - which unfortunately contributes to a first impression; however, this was soon forgotten because of the rest of our experience. If you want to pay higher prices for grander accommodations go ahead - but we more than satisfied with our stay at the Knickerbocker...and I am generally pretty picky about where I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old-fashioned hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: miniappleses
Reviews.Content: Our choice of accommodation was made for us by Priceline's Name Your Own Price option, but we were definitely satisfied with the Millennium Knickerbocker. Despite the outrageously expensive parking, which is problematic at every Chicago hotel, the Millennium got everything right. My husband and I both arrived feeling under the weather, and were exceedingly grateful for the unsolicited free upgrade that allowed us to miss out on what we'd heard were very small guest rooms. The decorating style is certainly a throwback to an earlier era, but done tastefully and allowing for a modern standard of comfort. The staff was friendly, the cleanliness was up to par, and we left feeling much better than when we arrived. We're planning another visit to Chicago and will certainly seek out the Knickerbocker again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay there.”
Reviews.Author: GaryandMelody
Reviews.Content: We stayed just 3 nigthts at the Millenium Knickerbocker and found it very enjoyable. Absolutely no complaints with our room, the service and assistance from staff was excellent and the location is perfect. Great restaurants and shopping are all within strolling distance and the John Hancock Center is practically next door for first timers to get a breath taking introduction to beautiful Chicago. We found that this hotel provided excellent value for money and the old world decor and charm that go with this hotel, is an added bonus. Everyone can come up with some subjective gripe about some feature or other during their stay, however we would not hesitate in recommneding this hotel to anyone. A special hello to Helen who was on reception when we arrrived and had a room available for us, having flown in from New York and arrived at about 11.40am. We booked a corner King room and we were very satisfied with all aspects of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locale, nice beds, mod bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: MJBNYC
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay with Millennium Knickerbocker. One block from high end shopping (bloomingdales, louis vuitton), two blocks to the status quo shopping (re: urban outfitters, american apparel), near lake, short cab ride to millennium park. Beds are nice and soft, bathrooms very modern, rooms themselves are more NYC size than midwest size. Stayed for a great rate and would not blink in staying again. As with most big hotel chains, restaurant is so-so - definitely skip 18 buck breaky.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely refer friends and family!”
Reviews.Author: Cross_Country09
Reviews.Content: Great small rooms with Chicago cityscapes on the walls. The service was great and they should be recognized for the behind the sceenes work they do. The location was great! We were able to walk most places in the city as long as the weather held up. Good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: suzieq039
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for shopping and siteseeing. Doorman was extremely helpful is giving directions and making suggestions as to where to eat. Other staff was polite and friendly. Parking available but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, responsive staff, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMan
Reviews.Content: We had a mixed experience at the Millennium Knickerbocker. After reserving and twice confirming 2 adjacent king rooms we arrived to find two rooms down the hall from one another, both with two twin beds and one across from the elevator (with a nice loud "BING!" each time it arrived). I protested vigorously and the response was outstanding: adjacent king suites for the remainder of our stay and free breakfast one morning. The concierge and front desk staff were nice and helpful with ideas and instructions, even calling one employee at home to ask for advice on a particular restaurant. Room service was very good, for meals and for housekeeping issues. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms and bathrooms well-designed. The suites were great, especially a larger one with an outstanding deep bathtub and separate adjacent shower. Negatives? No coffee pot in the room. No bathrobes in any of the four rooms we occupied (but quickly provided upon request). It is surprising to see a premium hotel still charging a daily fee for internet access. A single bar of soap in the bathroom and meager hooks/bars to hang wet towels. I'd much rather get a local paper than USA Today each morning. These are all small quibbles over what was, overall, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: kzappBuffalo_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Let me first say I got a deal on priceline so I did not pay 225 a night however they charged me $40 + taxes and fees extra a nite for a double bed versus a king because it was considered an "upgrade".They decided to put the priceline person right by the elevators so it was VERY noisey!!I got the impression they do not like priceliners. I think I knew I was in even bigger trouble after I won the bid when I found they did not have a pool.Big mistake when you have kids to not get a hotel with a pool.So okay no pool.Then I find out it's $50 a nite to park "holy cow" it would be like another $200 just to park there!!! So not happy with this booking so far but when we get there I did like the room and the beds.Did not like the idiotic showers.They did not have a traditional shower you know when the water comes down and it will rinse you off.No you have to use the hand attachment to rinse off because the shower head isn't positioned correctly to come out the main one.Really the worst I have yet to use.Also hated the toiletries really cheap and the house keeping staff was average not great.Internet service is ridiculous at almost $10.00 a night I mean come on give a customer something!!! I would not come back for all the reasons I stated and also would like to add there is nothing for a family to do here nothing. One Plus was I did like the food at the NIX and the service was excellent there as well

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Travellllllller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days in Feb. My mother had stayed here 2 yrs ago and liked it. However, apparently it has gone downhill since then. Cheap generic toiletries, which I would not expect, as this hotel is not cheap. A bath so small and shallow it served absolutely no purpose - you certainly couldn't have a bath in it. Very weak shower. A charge of USD 1.25 'connection fee' levied on a free 1800 call. There had been Wolfgang Puck coffee in the room 2 yrs ago, but that is gone - now just standard hotel coffee. We were originally put in a room with an adjoining door - we could hear the guest next door very clearly through the non-soundproofed door. We asked to change and were given a quieter room, but am not sure why we were placed in a noisy room to begin with. Housekeep did not replenish our toiletries after our first night, nor did they clean a spillage that had been there when we arrived. Housekeeping were also very noisy outside our bedroom and woke us up both mornings. On the plus side, the beds were comfortable and the location is good. Generally, I feel this hotel is very overpriced for what it offers. I had stayed for 2 nights at the Courtyard Marriott Magnificent Mile the week before, and although it was much cheaper than MK, it offered much more - nice toiletries, big, quiet room, and excellent breakfast included in rate. I believe there are far better hotels available in Chicago for the rate that MK charges, or indeed for less.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel (Chicago) exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: phxbassman
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I had an excellent experience at the Millennium Knickerbockers Hotel in Chicago. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to assist us on every request. Also the hamburger from room service was excellent. I am very comfortable recommending this hotel to anyone who wishes to stay off of Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bigdave466
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Knickerbocker. This really is a no frills hotel, but it is clean and in a great location. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom (although small) was well apintpoed. The "rain" shower was a nice touch. We traveled with an 11 month old, and the hotel provided us with a pack-n-play style crib that worked great. The rooms appear to have been recently renovated. I would call the lobby borderline old and in need of updating. I know it is meant to be nostalgic, but I think it is toeing the line of being worn out and dated. I did end up with a random $4 charge for the mini-bar that we did not use, but I don't think it will be worth the time to fight it. For the right price, I would be happy to make the Knickerbocker home base for the next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I will stay when I am in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: relaxinstyle
Reviews.Content: From the time you get there, you will meet an entire staff that is friendly and professional. Then, if you go to the martini bar, which is a favorite of mine, you will find great bartenders and delicious cocktails. Overall this hotel has a great atomsphere.

Reviews.Title: “As always, the Knickerbocker outdid themselves!”
Reviews.Author: fabdonIndiana
Reviews.Content: Our "Shopping" group has been coming to Chicago for many years. And for the last 6 years we have stayed here. They seem to outdo themselves every year. The staff is absolutely wonderful. You are within steps to the Miracle Mile where there is great food and shopping. We love the Martini Bar in the Lobby. I have stayed many places in Chicago for both business and pleasure. And this is the hotel we always seem to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: We stayed over New Year's Eve. The hotel looks like it was recently refurbished -- the rooms are very modern and updated, with flat screen TV's, blackout curtains, and modern bathrooms (with rainfall showerhead). The location was fabulous -- right off of Michigan Ave., across from all the upscale shopping. My biggest gripe was that the room was tiny -- we had a king room, and the only thing the room fit was the bed and 2 nightstands, with a desk tucked away into the corner. Also, as with all older hotels, there were some noise issues with the room next door. We got a good deal on Hotwire, so were pleased overall. If you stay here, you should try Oak Tree Cafe in the Bloomingdale's mall for breakfast - yum!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: Jodylyn601
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker offers decently sized newly renovated rooms with great showers and very comfortable beds at a reasonable price. The location just off Michigan avenue is within easy walking distance of some of the best shopping the city has to offer. As for the service, their staff is both friendly and competent. My family and I found Charlie, the doorman to be especially helpful and friendly, going above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and stress free. I would definitely recommend the Knickerbocker to my friends and family and we will certainly be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Beautiful as are the employees”
Reviews.Author: KayScottsdale
Reviews.Content: We knew that the Knickerbocker had been in Chicago for many years, and were blown away by the remodel. It was close to places we wanted to go and overall avery pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Where we like to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CPLFindlay_OH
Reviews.Content: If you have not tried the Millennium Knickerbocker for a stay in Chicago, do it now! We have stayed (and enjoyed) at the Drake, Intercontinental and others, but we always now come back to the Knickerbocker. Why? If "Charlie" the doorman is on duty and you pull up, he will welcome you. He'll probably ask your name. Why? Because he wants to call you by your name every time he will see you during your visit. Somehow he even lets the other employees know your name and all of a sudden, doorman, receptionist, bellman, waiter are referring to you by name. The employees are what makes this hotel. Yes, it has everything to offer like all hotels, but the others don't have the fine people (including the cleaning staff) these folks have. Try it, you will like it. We look forward to our next visit already...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: sfmegs
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel! The customer service was out of this world and the location perfect! The bar in the lobby was fun with other guests and entertaining bartenders. I definitely would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and staff”
Reviews.Author: bigbearsfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days in mid september, great location and the staff were extremely helpful. I believe his name was Tom, a bellman, was great with directions and advice on where to go and what to see. The only complaint is that our room had working air conditioning and the as a result the sheets and bedding were damp every night. We were too tired from activities each day to want to move all our stuff to another room, so we only told them as we left. In hidesight we would have changed that, chamber maid was great with offering extra towels. Very friendly staff and again just the one issue. We will be making the trip each year to attend a Bears game, and this hotel is on our list of ones to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “The Knickerbocker is a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: JPK834
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until we left, the Knickerbocker was a great experience. The staff was courteous, and the service was outstanding. The rooms were bright and clean and the food and service in the restaurant was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: akivasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days and have nothing but wonderful things to say about this hotel. The concierge was super helpful and nice. All the staff were super helpful and nice. I liked the location just off of Michigan Ave for shopping. The hotel itself was lovely. Before booking I read the Trip Advisor reviews and really like the fact the hotel responded even to the "bad" ones. Very good hotel with good customer service

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a Beautiful Hotel that Feels Like an Old Friend”
Reviews.Author: MaggieHM
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker is a beautiful old hotel that has completely updated, but retains it's old world charm. It is in the heart of the Magnificent Mile and close to shopping, restaurants and much more. The staff is friendly and makes you feel at home, and as if you are visiting an old friend. The Knickerbocker is truly a treasure, and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont look any further.You will love the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: RandyOregon
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the KNICKERBOCKER was great, from the quick check in to the great rooms, and the shower was just what we were looking for. The staff was great, we truly enjoyed our 4 days in the windy city, the location was perfect for our romantic getaway, being from out of town the staff was so very helpful when looking for the perfect place to dine or have a drink. Quiet, clean and just the right size rooms, we will return to the Knickerbocker in the near future without searching for a better deal. Keep up the great work Knickerbocker Staff!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old-fashioned quaint [refurbished] dite”
Reviews.Author: Carebear79
Reviews.Content: Wary at first as the lobby & elevators were a little, worn, but the room although small was modern & refurbished & had a great sized tv w/good channels, very comfortable bed. Staff were professional & responsive to queries. Hotel was situated near north Michigan Avenue, walkable to Navy Pier within a few minutes. Small bathroom but nice dark marble & timber decor, option of shower head or handheld nozzle. Apparently a fairly historical site w/old 'crystal ballroom' & celebrity guests including sorry can't remember!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Stay on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: tjsPhoenix_Arizona
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the most enjoyable hotels we've stayed at. It's has an intimate feel about it and is so convenient for shopping dining and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FineDineLovr
Reviews.Content: The location of the Knickerbocker on the Magnificent Mile couldn't be better, but I found the hotel to be a bit dated and the service lacking (for a supposedly 4-5 star hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Prime Chicago Location”
Reviews.Author: jackalope76
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Knickerbocker is in a prime location. the hotel is one block from the Magnificent Mile, and all of the great shopping, restaurants, sites that Michigan Avenue has to offer. Lake Michigan is a mere two blocks away, and the lake walking/biking path is easily accessed through a walking tunnel under the street (completely safe). Two blocks south of the hotel is the famous Hancock Building (go to the bar and/or restaurant at the top) and its amazing views of the lake and city. The Water Tower is about 4 blocks south of the hotel as well. Some of my favorite restaurants are steps away from the hotel (NOMI in the Park Hyatt, Le Colonial, Rosebud Steakhouse). During Christmas this area is beautifully decorated. The famous Drake Hotel is directly across from the Knickerbocker as well. The rooms in the Knickerbocker are small, but nice. The lobby can get a bit crowded at times, but the location is hard to beat, and the price is right compare to most Magnificent Mile hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Surprise.....scored A+”
Reviews.Author: biboleta
Reviews.Content: The great location, very comfortable and clean rooms ( what a nice bed!!!!), nice lounge to hang before and after our programs, everyday tips and information flier regarding tours and sight seeing ( incredible lady at the concierge service), the only down was the weather....cold and rainy.... but we all had lots of fun...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: newshine
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location - just off Michigan Ave, across from the Drake. Rooms are newly renovated and lovely. We asked to switch rooms (after initially requesting a king size bed) because the room was so small. The staff was accommodating and the second room - with two double beds - was just fine. No exercise facilities, but great walking/jogging in neighborhood. No free internet in room, but could get wireless in lobby and on mezzanine where there were quiet spots.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding--above and beyond our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Gail625
Reviews.Content: We held our September wedding at the Millennium Knickerbocker. Everything was spectacular. The 250+ guests that attended are still raving about their experience, as are we, the bride and groom. Everyone from the valet to concierge to banquet staff to our catering manager did everything they could to make our stay effortless and pleasureable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kat081
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond. They were so friendly and accommodating. We were very impressed. The location is also good if one is interested in shopping on Millenium Mile. Right across from Bloomingdales.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly, and close to everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Happytrails011
Reviews.Content: Room with 2 beds was large enough for both of us. Rented a car from hotel around the corner, close to public transportation. Good breakfast spots due south (Mary's, West Egg)

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster”
Reviews.Author: Trippar
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern room in a good location, however service providers were very unconcerned and lack of attention to the detail ( never used guest names or asked for feedback upon check out). During the c heck out receptionist did not show me where id breakfast area, opening times etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great price, great room”
Reviews.Author: jbulth39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an alternative spot for a friend's wedding. The price was about 50% to 65% of what it costs to stay at similar hotels in the area. First the minuses. 1.) The standard rooms are small. if you want a little more space you might want to upgrade. 2.) Since the hotel has been recently rehabbed you can see some of the stuff that the covered or painted. 3.) There really are no views from the hotel. Now the plusses. 1.) The shower is AWESOME. Probably one of the best hotel showers I've seen. Rain shower with wand, great pressure and the enclosure didn't leak like a lot of these shower stalls do. Very nice. 2.) The fixtures and finishes in the rooms were top notch. Very modern and clean. 3.) The bed was great. Better than some hotels that promote their beds. Great nights sleep. Overall. This is a great space for a trip where you are not going to be spending much time in the room. If you were in town for a conference or for work where you will need to spread out your stuff it might not work. Anyone else should really like the experience. All I care about when I travel is having a nice bed and a good shower to relax in after a long day. If you are the same this is a good spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Tourist Destination”
Reviews.Author: JLo_Tennnessee
Reviews.Content: Staff is attentive and helpful Rooms are very clean. Great location if you are there to see the city, the Navy Pier, and the Mag Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: MPM_9
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - fabulous old building but with first class modern amenities. Great location, as it's so close to both lakeshore and city. Chicago is such a walkable city, so this was a superb base. The staff were just lovely - so very friendly and efficient. The room was wonderful - very, very comfortable and exceptionally clean. Great chair. Great coffee. Lovely bathroom with a huge, absolutely fantastic shower. It was also extremely quiet. That, and the best bed ever, meant I slept so well and since I was there for a week, that was very important to me. Yummy martinis at the Martini Bar. I will most definitley be back!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable location...wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: revenueguru
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Knickerbocker for 3 nights the second week of September. I could not have been more pleased with the location of the hotel in Chicago's Gold Coast immediately across from the Drake Hotel. It's in the block next to the John Hancock building and a block from some of the most amazing shopping you will ever encounter. The knickerbocker hotel was extremely comfortable! I had two 42 inch flat screen tv's in my room. The bathroom far exceeded what I've come to expect from a typical hotel. It had a waterfall shower head, glass shower and very modern bathroom fixtures. The King bed was truly restful. I wouldn't hesistate to recommend this hotel to my colleagues. When I'm in Chicago I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with thoughtful details and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: rrdahl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel in Chicago. Upon arrival we were treated with great hospitality. The desk staff was friendly and took the time to visit with us about our room and its pros and what she thought might be a con - the size. Our room was small, but was beautiful and very comfortable. We had a great view of the lake. The furnishing seemed expensive and unique. They decor was fabulous and the bed was delightfully comfortable with great linens. The room was very clean upon arrival and was always cleaned with perfection each day we returned from our adventures throughout the city. The hotel as a whole seemed like we stepped back in time. I loved the boutique feel from the mirrored elevators, rotary style phone in the hallway to the old mail slots. We would definitely stay here again! We loved Chicago and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff & Comfortable Beds!!”
Reviews.Author: coopi23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel in Chicago for four nights in early September. We were very pleased throughout our stay. The room was small, yet comfortable and modern. I liked how the room was decorated with warm colors. The bed was AMAZING! The front desk was helpful and happily answered any questions that we had. We never got a chance to have a drink at the Martini Bar, but it was always crowded at night. Our overall stay at this hotel was incredible and we were very impressed. We would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: sharon01011
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago for the Labour Day long weekend, had a great time and loved the Millennium Knickerbocker. As a woman travelling alone, I appreciated the location just off the Magnificent Mile as it always seemed well-populated and safe, even at night. The area can be a big crowded during the day as there are lots of shops & landmarks in the vicinity, but I found some of the side streets much less busy and good for quick shortcuts to the subway, etc. Speaking of which, it's about a 10 minute walk to the Chicago station on the red line, which is great and connects you to most of the major sights in the city. The lobby & elevators have some, shall we say, historic charm, but the rooms have been recently renovated and have all the modern comforts and conveniences like rain shower heads and minibars. The room & bathroom were decorated very tastefully and the housekeeping staff kept them both spotless. I got a great deal on this hotel on Priceline, and would recommend it to anyone in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: micklow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days and could not fault the service we received. Its location was ideal for our visit to Chicago. Staff were very friendly and helpful and room was immaculate. I would recommend the show "Jersey Boys" to any visitor. Brilliant entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Better People”
Reviews.Author: SnakeStabler
Reviews.Content: We were a party of two couples and had a wonderful stay at the Millennium Knickerbocker. Excellent service from all we had contact with. We were able to walk to most of our destinations. Great city to visit we loved it and make sure you chat with the guys at the front entrance for any tips or suggestions on where to go to eat, they were quite helpful. We would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nicely updated rooms”
Reviews.Author: JandKQuadCities_IL
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotwire and got a very good rate for 2 nights. Checked in late morning and they had a room almost ready, so we checked in and put our bags in the room . . . the only thing not complete was re-sheeting and making the bed. When we arrived back after dinner the bed had still not been made, so the desk upgraded us to an executive room and was very apologetic. Nicely updated bathrooms and well-appointed rooms. Parked the car ourselves to save about $15 per night (a number of garages close-by, but some take cash only). Would recommend this hotel - an easy walk to the lakefront and Michigan Avenue. Red Line is about a 1/2 mile walk if you need to get around town and don't want to utilize one of the many cabs in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: DoonieGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a surprise trip for my husband's birthday. I received an email one week prior to my arrival from the Concierge asking if they could assisit in any way. I had several questions and they answered each one and even went further by booking reservations for me and help with transporation. The service once we arrived was top notch and the location is fantastic. I recommend this hotel if you are traveling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, beautiful rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: larabrett
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago with three young kids. We were greeted warmly at the door, and every person we dealt with at the Knickerbocker made us feel special. The doorman recommended the least expensive place to park our car. The concierge had many recommendations that were perfect for a family with kids. The front desk employee who checked us in upgraded our room without a request and for free to a one bedroom suite because of the "three angels" (her words, not mine!) we were traveling with. I can't say enough great things about every aspect of our experience at the Knickerbocker!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay....Awesome beds!”
Reviews.Author: futurefrye
Reviews.Content: There were three of us couple traveling together and with our early flight we arrived at the hotel at 10AM, hoping for an early check-in (yes, way early check-in). The front desk was busy checking out guests while we were trying to get a room. It was a very busy weekend considering the annual air and water show was in town and the hotel was sold out. The front desk made a call to housekeeping to see if they had at least one room ready for our party so we can at least put our bags and rest for a bit. They were able to accomandate! Awesome start... Things continued just fine during our stay. Friendly people all around. The rooms are newly renovated and look great. The beds were amazing! The walls were thin though as you could hear hallway noise easily. Location is great for Chicago....we were close to everything we wanted to see and we could hop on the train easily or catch the 151 bus. (hint: buy a 3-day CTA pass.... we traveled all over for only $14). You might want to bring some waters and pop as the mini-bar charges an arm and leg, but what hotel doesn't these days. I would stay again.... especially for the bed!~

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Historic”
Reviews.Author: Lenawee
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Knickerbocker is a gem of a hotel. Built in 1927 it is gorgeous, luxurious and very comfortable. Our room was beautifully decorated. Very modern looking. Our bed was a pillow top and I slept as well there as my own bed. The bathroom was very exceptional with a great shower. The location is great also. One and a half blocks from The Hancock Bldg. Two blocks from Rush street which has great resturants and bars. The staff is very attentive and customer service driven.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location, can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: AlewifeDC
Reviews.Content: For those who would want to stay at the Drake primarily for the location but want something much more affordable, the Knickebocker can't be beat. The view from our room (and from most of the hotel, I would imagine) is definitely not comparable, but being at the very north end of the Mile and one block from both the lake and Michigan Avenue definitely makes this appealing. The one thing I found slightly concerning was that the staff was not as courteous/professional as one would expect at a hotel of this caliber. We had the concierge look into booking a tour for us, and they never called us to confirm the reservation. Other than that, the general sense I got from the employees is that they wished they worked across the street at the Drake....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with a great location”
Reviews.Author: BWLPack
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Knickerbocker. The room were nice, and the staff was excellent. I was able to stay here for $80 per night thru Priceline. That was an incredible bargain in my opinion .. this hotel is very nice. It has an excellent location ... just off of Michigan Ave. All of the best shopping in Chicago can be found right around the corner. It's a great location ... very close to many great attractions. If there is any negative it would be that there is no swimming pool, but I think that is common with a lot of the older hotels in Chicago, I would definately recommend this place ... hopefully I will be able to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: badboy0716
Reviews.Content: absolutely amazing hotel, never stayed at one quite like this!!! clean, small updated rooms. very friendly staff wanted to help at any given moment!! We stayed for our 10th anniversary and would stay again for sure!!! Within walking distance to most restaurants and just a 1/2 block from the Magnificent Mile and just 1 block from the John Hancock tower. Also just a short cab ride from the shedd aquarium and the planetarium and the navy pier also millennium and grant parks. ALL IN ALL VERY NICE COZY PLACE TO SPEND WITH YOUR WIFE OR HUSBAND!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered at the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: queenweasley
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were welcomed by everyone, they seemed genuinely glad we were there. Our room was amazing, every detail was perfect, comfort and luxury. We were given excellent tips to get around town and welcomed home we returned.. We will definitely return again. Thanks Knickerbocker Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and junior suite is perfect for family with teenager”
Reviews.Author: SLT94
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite with teenage son. The room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel staff was super helpful and responsive to any request. The hotel is located in such a convenient spot. We could get anywhere we wanted in just a few blocks walk ... either to our destination or to public transportation. The staff was great about helping us navigate which trains to get where. It is a short 4-5 blocks to the red line at Chicago and State, which has stops within two blocks of Wrigley Field (Cubs) and US Cellular Field (White Sox). You can catch a bus about a block and a half away that delivers you right to museum campus and Solider Field (Bears). Great dining and walking tours of neighborhoods and restaurants. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mfost
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker hotel is fantastic! It's an old hotel with updated rooms - so you get the old-timey charm and fresh comfort all at once. The hotel has a fabulous location. It's a one minute walk to the Cheesecake Factory and Bloomingdales, and about a 5 minute walk to Einstein Bagel Company (the best bagels and cream cheese EVER), Macys and Saks. This location can't be beat. You're at one end of the magnificent mile, so it makes for easy strolling, as you don't start in the middle and then backtrack. The hotel staff are super helpful and friendly. Checking in and out was very smooth, and the concierge (Cheryl) was amazing. She booked all our dinner reservations and activities for us, and recommended an incredible restaurant called Carmines which was a 5 minute walk. It was the greatest italian restaurant I have ever been to, and I can't recommend it more. The rooms are small but not too small. We had a beautiful big samsung flat screen, cordless phones, a rain shower, ample clean towels, and beautiful marble countertops. The hotel rooms have european charm to them and made me feel like I was at a 5 star hotel in Europe. The beds are very comfortable and the duvet is soft like butter. The only complaint I had was that housekeeping woke us up at 8:30 one morning when the knocked on our door despite the fact that we had the do not disturb sign on. When we answered and asked her to come back later she seemed a bit miffed. The issue was corrected, though, and it didn't happen again during our 4 night stay. The hotel has some unique items on their room service menu - ie - grilled cheese with mini tomato soup for dipping. Very cute. Their late night menu, however, is lacking. It would have been nice to see some soup on there. That being said, I RARELY order from room service when on vacation, so I really don't see that being a big deal. Overall I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. I think we paid about 130 a night and I would say it was worth far more than that. We had a wonderful experience and I truly look forward to staying there again....wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elaineapted
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker from Friday June 26 until Monday June 29. We arrived early in the morning and our room was ready for an early check-in, for which we were very grateful! The room was beautiful, comfortable and had all of the amenities one could wish for. The front desk, the bellhops, the house maids and the concierge were all friendly and polite, coming to our assistance when needed. The location of the hotel could not have been more convenient, a few steps from the finest shopping, dining, and bus services. I will definitely recommend The Millenium Knickerbocker to my friends and family and will reserve it for my next visit to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Knickerbocker made our first trip to Chicago a memorable experience!”
Reviews.Author: jolies75
Reviews.Content: Prior to our visit in Chicago, I did not know anything about the city. I frequently use TripAdvisor.com to research and plan my trips, and this is how I found out about the Millenium Knickerbocker. We stayed for 4 nights, which reduced the price per night due to an online hotel promotion. We are normally budget hotel frequenters (i.e. Hampton Inn). I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. 1. Accomodations: we booked a superior king (which is a corner room). When asked to upgrade to a room with a view, they gave us a street view of East Walton Street (where the hotel front faces). Although disappointed at first, we loved the room. There's enough space for two people and we experienced no outdoor noise from the street. It is a small one-way street so there's not a lot of thru-traffic. The bed is very comfy, the modern decor is funky and the bathroom is cool with the big shower stall and rainfall shower-head. It felt like I was in a spa bathroom. 2. Service: everybody was extremely helpful. I read a Frommer's Chicago city guide book cover to cover before arriving, but we also relied heavily on the concierge staff for many suggestions. Les and his staff were fabulous! They are so knowledgeable about the city - all the restaurants suggested were excellent and their sight-seeing tips were so helpful. Tjhey secured us reservations for places that weren't in my little guide book and we loved them! If you don't know Chicago, use their hotel concierge service for suggestions. 3. Location: the hotel is located on the northern end of Michigan Avenue, but it seemed so close to everything. On a nice day, you can walk the Miracle Mile down to Grant Park or the Chicago River in 20 minutes. You are near so many restaurants and shopping, all within walking distance. The Hancock Observatory is 1 block away (all the locals said to go there instead of the Sears Tower). We did not rent a car (the price is high for parking at the hotel or basically any hotel) and just cabbed or walked everywhere - so worth it. 4. Drawbacks: their restaurant menu (and room service) are a bit pricey for me. The food was good but I would prefer going someplace nearby for breakfast instead of dining in. You will always read good and bad reviews based on personal experience, but ours was nothing but excellent. I recommend staying here and will stay here again on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good loaction, Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peoriaguy1000
Reviews.Content: We Stayed for a weekend and was ho-hum about hotel. The location was great right off of North Michigan Ave. The room was small & the bathroom even smaller. More of a european type hotel. The hotel was clean but maybe a bit rundown. Service was average. If you can hotwire the hotel for a low price like I did, it's OK, but probably we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay here! Would come back!”
Reviews.Author: pamylah
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here at the Knickerbocker hotel. Stayed (6/21-6/24) in the corner King suite room 327 (or 328 can't remember now but it's the corner suite on 3rd floor). Very comfortable room and nice quite stay. The bed was heaven. Loved the bed. Enjoyed the turn down service and would certainly come back. The martini bar down stairs is a must. The location is fantastic for shopping very close to John Hancock tower and the water tower shopping center also bloomingdales shopping, louis vuitton and channel and Oak Street shopping. The bath tub was wonderful. Deep tub, loved it. The over head rain shower and wand was wonderful as well. The only negative thing is the wi-fi of $9.95 per day is steep. I don't think that when you are staying here you should have to pay for the wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value and Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NoSpillBlood
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Knickerbocker Hotel in Chicago. We wanted to stay in a hotel near or in the downtown area so we could visit Michigan Avenue and the Business Loop. The Knickerbocker met both of those needs. We were within walking distance to most shopping areas and fine restaurants and public transportation was just around the corner, too. We also wanted a place we could relax and be comfortable after spending 10+ hours walking about Chicago. The room was spacious, very comfotable, always clean and the hotel staff made it very easy on us anytime we needed anything. The hotel staff always met us with a pleasant good morning or good evening and a big smile. It makes a difference in comfort level when you are surrounded by a staff that wants you to feel comfortable away from home. The bed was awesome! Very soft yet firm, very comfortable, nice to have a good bed to sleep in after a long day of fun. The hotel bar was nice and friendly, good place to meet other travelers from all parts of the globe. This hotel was very nice and we will stay here again should we venture to Chicago again...hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “This was a fantastic experience.”
Reviews.Author: gmasandiegoca
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time and my teenagers really enjoyed the experience of an "older" hotel. The boys found a food pantry around the corner, thanks to the help of the bellman, and we were able to have reasonable "snacks". The hotel's location is great - close to the John Hancock and Michigan Ave. Take the Chicago Trolley Tour - a great way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: bluestraveler789
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay if you're in downtown Chicago. It's just off of north Michigan Ave. where there is PLENTY of shopping to be had, within 5-7 minute EL stop at State St. and Chicago Ave., a couple of blocks from Lake Michigan and Lake Shore Drive.... it is just a great location. The hotel staff could not be nicer, more friendly or helpful. From the doorman, to the front desk attendants, to the Concierge, to the bellman, just the best. The room we had was on the 9th floor and one could see the beach of Lake Michigan between the buildings with the Drake hotel across the street. The bed was extremely comfortable, loved the shower that felt like a waterfall with the fixture in the middle of the ceiling. The only thing I would not recommend is to pay $50 for overnight parking. There are other less expensive options and directly across the street at the Drake hotel is parking for $35 overnight. Other than that, you will be well pleased by staying at the Knickerbocker hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could take this bed back home!”
Reviews.Author: AthensSoloist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker hotel for 7 nights, in a 2 queen beds room. Room: the room was spacious and spotless. Our beds were super comfortable; I could have taken mine back home, along with the soft bed sheets! Only downside: walls are a bit thin. Bathroom was beautiful and with plenty of amenities. However, there was only 1 bathrobe, even though we were 2 (we did not ask for a second one). Funny detail: take a look at the mini-bar... you can find everything in it. Beverages, cheese crackers, toothpaste, toothbrush and even an "intimacy kit" (containing condoms, towelettes and lubricant gel). Very thoughtful of the management :))) Staff: One evening we had a problem with the internet connection; it was promptly taken care of. Staff was very polite everywhere, from front desk to breakfast room. Breakfast: you can either order from the menu, or take the buffet (approx. 20 USD). The buffet is OK, however we would have liked a wider selection; e.g. there was no cheese (except from Philadelphia) or ham. But, everything was tasty and of good quality. Dinner: we dined in our room one night, food was good (tomato soup was delicious) Location: OK, indeed it is not exactly downtown but like a 15 mins walk to the Millenium Park. The nearby (5 mins walk) Rush street is full of restaurants and bars, so it is not like you have nothing to do in the evening. And it is a very upscale and SAFE area (for me this is more important than being exactly downtown). Excellent for shopping too, just around the corner from Michigan avenue, where the Magnificent Mile begins. Plus, only a 3 mins walk from the John Hancock Center. The panoramic city / bay views from the JHC 94th floor observatory are the best, and the lines are much shorter than those for the Sear's tower Skydeck. Night view is also a must, and if you are there on Wednesday or Saturday evening, you will also enjoy the Navy Pier fireworks show; it looks even more spectacular from the 94th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Neetie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of April and overall found it a very nice hotel. It was certainly good value at $420 (prepaid). Yes the room was very small (I'm sorry now reading other reviews that we didn't go for an upgrade) but it was comfortable and had everything. I did find boots under the bed (that weren't ours) so housekeeping might not be as thorough as one would hope! It was the first scorching weekend and I noticed the A/C wasn't fantastic but it worked. Liked the bar for a cocktail before going out, it had a lovely old fashioned feel to it and the bar staff were very friendly. The concierge was excellent, couldn't do enough for us and the doormen/porters were good fun with spot on recommendations. We thought the Knickerbocker breakfast buffet was very good and the doormen sent us to a FAB place nearby called TEMPO when we wanted a nice Sunday brunch. It's an old hotel (I don't know what the rooms were like before) with a bit of welcome character - the only 'surprising' section was the check in desk, it really let the lobby down but perhaps it hadn't been renovated yet? Great location - near the beach if you get sweltering weather like us and a perfect base for sightseeing. We never used room service or looked to eat there aside from breakfast so didn't even notice what time services stopped. We just wanted a comfortable, clean & convienient base from which to see the city and the Knickerbocker ticked those boxes. If you like your meat Fogo de Chao (a few blocks away) was EXCELLENT, well worth a visit. Also a Boat Trip through the city is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED CHICAGO, The Millennium Knickerbocker Made It Easy!”
Reviews.Author: 1chicagofan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend and had a blast. Booked online directly with the hotel and prepaid well in advance, only to find the room rates reduced later. When I brought this to the hotel's attention, they compensated us by offering my party (3 adults) complimentary breakfast each morning. This turned out to be very convenient because we started off each day with a good meal and it saved us the time of trying to decide where to go to eat each morning. The food selection was very good. On the weekend, a buffet with cold cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, hot foods (eggs, bacon, sausage, potatos, pancakes, french toast), an assortment of breads, muffins, pastries, bagels; Juices, coffee, tea. If you forego the buffet, their breakfast menu offers a wide selection: fresh fruits, breads, eggs (any style) including omelettes and benedicts, waffles, pancakes, a la carte items. The hotel is conveniently located just off of Michigan Avenue, the Mag Mile! In the other direction, just two blocks away is Lake Shore Drive with a great view of the Lake, Navy Pier, beautiful homes. My traveling companions found the room to be small (Superior with double beds), but I found it to be fine. We were so beat by the end of the day that we watched some TV and crashed. Bathroom was modern and well stocked with lots of towels, soap, shampoo, lotion. Had drinks in the lobby bar (pricey, but that's true in any nice hotel in a big city) and the bartender, David, was good company. One member of our party ate in the bar the first night of our arrival (it was already late) and she said the food was very good (grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup). As for our trip: We rented a car upon arrival at MDW to see some of the outlying sites (my family's roots in Humboldt Park and Logan Square) and Hot Doug's, 3324 N. California Ave (famous Chicago hot dogs). We arrived well after the lunch crowd (it was like 3pm on Friday) and we still had to wait over one hour. It was worth it! The line snaked around the building and down the block, but people were friendly, passed a menu around, made recommendations. They only have their fries (in duck grease) on Fri & Sat -- GOOD EATS! We returned the rental car to MDW that first night (didn't want to pay for parking in the City) and took the EL back to the hotel (orange, transfer to red) -- very easy. We purchased a 2-day GO card which allowed us into the Hancock Bldg, Sears Tower, River Cruise, Skyline Lake Cruise, Navy Pier, on-off trolley. The card gets you into many other places, including museums, but we ran out of time. We had Chicago Pizza at Gino's East (on Superior, I think). One night we cabbed it to a place called Sola (a great neighborhood joint in Lincoln Park, very popular as the place was packed by the time we left). En route, we drove by Wrigley Field! When our trip ended, we reserved with the GO Shuttle service. They picked us up at the hotel and had us back to MDW in no time! I hope to visit again and will definitely book with Millennium Knickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs up!!!”
Reviews.Author: 02darl
Reviews.Content: My best friend recommended this hotel & I love her for it! We stayed here to celebrate my daughters birthday & it was the best celebration ever! She was so right about the brand new rooms & location. The rooms are beautiful. We loved the bathroom rain showers & the beds are to die for! Extremely comfortable, we didn't want to get out of bed :) You cannot beat the location! Michigan Ave was seconds away for shopping & so was Rush Street for dining & fun! The service was great from making our reservations to the housekeepers. So friendly. Coming back soon & definitely sharing our experience with everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoebedo
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for four nights in mid may and here are my pros and cons pros huge and pretty lobby, very polite and helpful staff, very clses to mag mile, close to hancock centre, comfy bed, nice tv, rain shower, tom in the lobby was very helpful and took our luggage in storage while we renewed our vows and took our pics cons the hotel bar is WAY overpriced, the iron my husband used left marks on his shirt and had my renewal wedding dress pressed by laundry and wasnt that impressed with the result - also $5 for internet in lobby overall i would stay here again - very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Renovation”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in mid-May, having booked through Priceline for $100. For the money, this is a good hotel. The recent renovation has done wonders here, giving the Knickerbocker a more modern and upscale look than it had before. The hotel was suffering from poor reviews, but now everyone (including us) seems to come away impressed. Here are our pros and cons: Pros: Good location, right near the north end of the Mag Mile. Close to many upscale shops, Oak Street Beach, the Hancock Tower, and Rush Street. Comfortable bed. Nice TV. Cozy lobby. Friendly service. Cons: $48 for valet parking. Room is small (older hotel, so no surprise). No view from room. You pay for internet and for sue of business center. Small elevators. We would gladly stay here again, given the charm and quality we experienced here. There are better options if you are looking for more space and a more lively location, but the "new" MK is a fine place for anyone to spend the night in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ryanbruce
Reviews.Content: Room was luxuriuos! Location fantastic for shopping (walking distance). Underground 10 mins walk away. Loved the room.....recently refurbished. Corridors a bit dingy. Main criticism - every morning woken up by the housekeeping staff who were very noisy constantly banging on doors!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: zacandynadia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was magnificent! Not only was it a mini palace, but the staff was polite, helpful, and professional. In an e-mail I received before we left for Chicago, the concierge, Les, offered to get us tickets, directions, reservations to anything we'd like to see/do. He also got us an upgrade on our room, and when someone rudely butted in line as we were registering, the registry person said they would upgrade our room just for that. And so we were granted a beautiful suite complete with king size bed and jacuzzi. The bed and the linens were so comfortably both of us slept late every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms (no views), Most of the staff were very nice”
Reviews.Author: Tahoskibum
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a really, really great location. They remodeled the rooms very nicely. Frette sheets and the bathrooms are very nice. The rooms are small but this usually is the case in most big cities. I stay in Chicago a lot. I got a good deal for four nights last week on Hotel.com. I paid $200 per/night and considering that there was a Restaurant Convention in town (100,000+ people) I paid a very fair rate. Most of the staff were great. We did encounter one night manager that sported a bit of attitude the couple of nights that we went to ask a question or for a late check out. She is really not too friendly. I would say that this hotel is worth the money if you are paying in the $150-$225 range. If you were to pay anything above this amount for a room (I think that their rack rate is $450), then I don't think that you'd be very happy. This is a nice hotel but this is no Westin, Four Seasons etc. The rooms have no views except for the front of the Drake or the back of the Westin. I was a little suspicious of the previous reviews regarding the A/C system. We had no problems on the first 3 nights. On our last night we walked into a really, really, hot, muggy and humid room. We called down to complain and the front desk said that the A/C system automatically turns off when the outside temp is lower than 50 degrees. They said that there was nothing that they could do but suggested that we "open our window" to let in the cold air. They also offered a "fan" for the room which they would send up to us upon request. Personally, I think that the hotel needs to rethink their A/C system policy. Its crazy to think that in a modern hotel that the A/C system wouldn't work if its cold outside. I've stayed at motels that offer the guest to operate heat and/or air independantely if and when its desired. That is my one big complaint. This hotel is not worth more than $225 per/night. You will be disappointed if you pay more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KarenMc3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a wedding at the hotel. There was confusion at check-in due to the wedding and all the family members with the same last name. We had booked our rooms on the internet and prepaid them. However, one of our rooms was given to a different family member. The hotel said they couldn't switch the billing since it was prepaid and made us pay for a different room and collect for the first room from the other family members who were given the room. It was way too confusing. The rooms were small, but the beds were comfortable. The rooms were all hot and at 75 degrees they were very uncomfortable. The controls in the room didn't run the A/C, we could only get more heat. It was 75 outside when we arrived. We all called the front desk to complain about the hot rooms and were told that the A/C was not on yet. They hadn't made the switch. What's up with that?!?! There was also no restaurant for lunch or dinner. You could order food at the lobby bar during the day, but no room service was available until after 6PM. Families with small children were out of luck for lunch, unless they went off premise. But most of the people went to the church wedding at 1:00 and expected to come back for lunch. Those with children planned on ordering room service and having the kids take naps. The lobby bar was very crowded and had only 1 bartender to serve drinks and take food orders. The bartender was not in a very good mood. Someone from our group complained about the service and some managers did come out to help with food orders. But the service was a little slow. This was not good planning on the part of the hotel. If they're trying to bring in big weddings with out-of-town guests, they're going to have to do better with overall service. The wedding was very nice and the food was good. The hotel was recently renovated, but they must not have worked on the ventilation. If not for the wedding, we'd have gone back to the Conrad on Michigan Avenue. That's our new favorite hotel on the Magnigicent Mile!

Reviews.Title: “The pleasure was all mine!”
Reviews.Author: mmoreland
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel in Chicago and I was literally blown away by the service, the modern style rooms, the great location downtown for dinning and shopping, and did I mention service? This was a great expericen and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the suite!!”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a beautiful suite with two large flat screen TVs and a deluxe massage tub/shower that was truly unique. The room was newly remodeled, beautiful and incredible clean. The service at the hotel was superior. We had stayed here before but never in one of the remodeled suites. They are worth the upgrade. The location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated - Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromDaBronx
Reviews.Content: Stayed there three nights from 4/17/09 through 4/20/09. Chechecked in about 9:15 AM. Had to wait about 15 minutes because of specials requests I had made. Room was quiet, and comfortable. Marked improvement over last time I stayed there (about 5 years ago). The renovations were great, and maintained the old time charm of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect”
Reviews.Author: LondonDodo3
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Millenium Knickerbocker. I broadly speaking got what I paid for. The location was great in the Magnificent mile at the corner of a great shopping street. The hotel has a pleasant entrance hall with a pianist and a bar area and friendly staff in the restaurant. The rooms were relatively standard for that category of hotel and very clean and modern. The plasma screen TV was reall big for the size of the room. On the downside, I did not manage to open the window, maybe because it's quite a high building. Good value for money overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored & updated historic hotel - Excellent service from all staff”
Reviews.Author: ellenfaye
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by staff with excellent customer service skills. Our room was such a pleasant surprise, from the flat screen TV, the full size shower with rain showerhead & hand held shower wand, the wall attached toilet with flushing options (on the wall), the comfortable bed, the lovely lighting options, etc..
