The size of the room was snug, and very comfortable, as would be, in a historic hotel. It was also quiet, and I know that the hotel was sold out. My sister was in the room next door. We did not hear her TV. We also loved walking less than a block, to the shopping and restaurants on North Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mcfad1669
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel this one. Situated in a quiet (for chicago) avenue off the Magnificent Mile, it was well located for the city. Friendly, (but not amazingly so) staff, and the room was great. Looked like it had been newly renovated, big flat screen tv, lovely comfy beds and a stylish bathroom. Now for the minor quibbles. Whoever designed the toilet must've been an NBA player, sat down on it I could only get my toes onto the floor, and I'm 5 11". God knows how any short ladies would get on. The shower needs a degree from MIT to work out how to use, and anyone used to a good ol' power shower will be disappointed. Also we checked in, tired from the flight at 1pm to be told our rooms wouldn't be ready till 4, which was annoying to say the least. However these were only minor quibbles really, overall I'd give it 8/10. PS Don't use hotel bar, $20 for 2 glasses of beer, which was warm and flat. AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Knickerbocker for two nights while looking at Loyola. The location is great for shopping and dining, with ample opportunities for both within easy walking distance. It is, however, about 30 minutes from Loyola's north campus. Valet parking was easily accessible, and the front desk staff was helpful and pleasant. Our room on the fifth floor was spacious and equipped with a nice flat panel television, mini bar, clock radio with iPod docking station, a desk area and extra chair in addition to the two full size beds. The bathroom was a nice size, with a canister of q-tips and cotton balls being a nice accessory. Unfortunately, the rooms were not as sound proof as needed considering our next door neighbors had children jumping off of beds and yelling until 12:30 in the morning. The hotel is not responsible for poor parenting however. We didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on the food. My only negative comments would be that I'm surprised you have to pay $9.95 per day for internet service, and that it took nearly 30 minutes to retrieve my car following check-out. That could be due to the fact that it was nearly a blizzard this morning however.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels”
Reviews.Author: Kevin64
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Knickerbocker hotel on March 6-8,09. We really enjoyed our time there. We had a conference at the Westin Riverfront and didn't want to pay the high $212 a night there so we went on Priceline and got the Knickerbocker for $75 a night. I was worried at first because we didn't know the hotel, but when we went on trip advisor and saw all the good reviews we knew we had picked a winner. They had remodled the hotel last year 2008. It really shows in the rooms. They are very classy. Maybe not huge rooms but who stays in the room 24/7 in Chicago? The confrence was on the opposite end of the Mag mile but even with cab fair the price was still great for Chicago. I know we will stay there again. The staff was so friendly and nice. Willing to do anything for us. We never ate in the restaurant there but i heard it was good too. The hotel is about 2 blocks off the mag mile and only about 3 blocks from Rush street with tons of entertainment and restaurants. I think the vallet parking is a bit steep at $49 a night, but i was told later that the self parking garage was only $30 or so across the street. The room we had was located at the front of the building and you could see the lake from our window. The bathrooms were so stylish with granite type counters and an under the counter mounted sink. The shower had a rain shower head from the center of the ceiling. It also had a handheld shower to get a more direct and harder pressure wash. It was a huge shower but no bath tub if that is to your liking. The room had a refrigerator and a coffee maker. The frig was stocked I am sure for a pricey cost. The bed was very comfy too. The martini bar down in the lobby was very quaint and comfy. Many over stuffed chairs and couches to sit on and a piano bar as well. If you know where the Drake hotel is located this is directly across the street from it. If you like to be a block or so off the beaten path and in a comfy but romantic and classy hotel this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “My most favorite place to stay in downtown Chi town”
Reviews.Author: leftybecca
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I got to stay at the Knickerbocker! I typically stay at large hotel chains when visiting Chicago so this was a sweet surprise to me. First of all parking is always absurd in downtown. We had several travelers with us in a Suburban no less and the parking attendant was very gracious with getting us in and out of traffic and the amount of time we had to load, unload, and gather our group together for the next restaurant or shopping jaunt. Though the parking was pricey at the hotel, we were free to move our vehicle in and out all throughout our stay. Then there was the hotel staff inside. The location of the check in counter is a bit tricky, yet someone was always available to direct the way and help with the luggage. The concierge was quite accommodating in directing us to last minute dinner plans on a Friday night. But wait, there's the hotel itself. Wow, it is an architectural beauty. The lobby was quite inviting and the conference room was just gorgeous. I loved that the hotel rooms were modern in their amenities yet homey and comfy with the lighting and decor. I truly loved the bed and slept great! The bathroom was carefully thought out, as older hotels tend to lack in room space what they make up for in location. Though the shower took a few minutes to figure out, I had no complaints there. I enjoyed lunch in the restaurant downstairs. The wait staff was very attentive, and went out of their way to meet our needs. Good food and good value. Great coffee, too. Be sure to request a table further away from the entrance if there is a lot of traffic coming in and it's cold outside. It can be a bit chilly when the lobby is busy. Lastly I must say that just about everything is within walking distance if you don't have your heels on. Several nice restaurants close by, all the shopping you desire, and Hancock building right next door. While I was in town for a conference, I had plenty of time to do/ see all that I wanted. Now it will be the first place I check for availability when when I'm headed to Chi town.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: jksbiv
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better on the mag mile. Renovated rooms very cool. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoxieLover2
Reviews.Content: We will return to the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel again and again and again!! It is where we stay everytime we are in Chicago. The staff go out of their way to make everything just perfect. This hotel is perfectly located for shopping, dining, siteseeing, etc. You can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal on N. Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: Hoover09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to stay downtown for event that we were attending at the Drake Hotel. I have stayed at the Drake before and while it is nice, it is bit stuffy and a little outdated for the price. We opted to walk across the street and stay at the Millenium instead. I know this property has under gone many renovations in past year and I have to say they have done a great job. This place used to be the hotel you would crash in when you came to Chicago on a college roadtrip (I did). But that is not the case any more. This property is directly across from the Drake Hotel and for 1/2 the price you get their great location with a newer (albeit smaller) room and every ammenity you would expect from a 4* hotel. The rooms are tastefully decorated (Asian influence w/flat screen tv) and the bed is very comfortable. The bath is small (no tub), but very clean and the shower is great. You are not going to be spending a bunch of time in your room when visting Chicago, so the room's size is not a big deal. (It works well with a couple, but a family of four may be a bit cramped.) The service was attentive and friendly and the location can't be beat. I would definitely stay here again, but the next time I would leave the car at home ($49/night parking is a bit steep).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: sainehons
Reviews.Content: we had stayed at the Knickerbocker years ago and hadn't been overly impressed, but after reading the recent reviews we thought we give it another try, since we love that area and you can't beat that location. We found very decent rates online and then called the hotel directly and the agent was really helpful and gave us good tips of what to do. Everything worked out really well, we loved the new rooms, great shower and huge flat-screen TV, everyone was very friendly, especially the concierge and the bartenders. We did read about the parking before, so thankfully we had left the car at home, parking rates downtown really are ridiculous, cab and bus worked fine. Really nice stay, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: develbow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Knickerbocker the Sunday before MLK Jr. Day, having booked through Priceline. The Knickerbocker is an historic hotel (built in 1927) and sits at the gateway to the Magnificent Mile. It is extremely convenient to Oak Street Beach, the John Hancock Building, Water Tower Place, the exclusive boutiques of Oak Street and the flagship stores on the Mag Mile. You can also walk to the Museum of Contemporary Art. I recommend the Cape Cod Room in the Drake Hotel across the street as a dining splurge; cheap but fun options include Foodlife in Water Tower Place (a sort of new age, upscale food court), the Italian deli at the base of the John Hancock building, and Espression Lavazza, an ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS European coffee house with locations in the Drake and at the John Hancock Observatory (the quiche is absolutely to die for--go here and pretend you are vacationing in Italy!). I was a bit worried that the rooms would be run down, but they are very comfortable and have been recently redecorated. The bathroom has a wonderful marble tiled rainfall shower (with the usual drawback that water goes all over the floor and transforms the bathroom into a kiddie pool). Amenities are Gilchrist and Soames toiletries (no body lotion, just shampoo and conditioner) with Starbucks coffee and Twinings tea for the coffee maker. The bed was very comfy and the rooms are equipped with giant flat screen tvs and a basic cable lineup plus HBO. The drawbacks were as follows: 1)while cozy for one night, the king rooms are very small and I would think they would feel cramped for travelers staying for longer periods; 2)while the desk clerk was polite at check in, I did feel we got a bit of second class treatment at Priceline customers--all of the other guests on our floor were given complimentary newspapers but we did not receive one, and this is the first time I've experienced this kind of snub in a long history as a Priceliner; 3)I don't think families with children would really enjoy this hotel, because it has no pool and it is clearly geared towards a more mature clientele. All in all a pleasant stay, though I would rate this hotel a strong 3 1/2 stars rather than four stars because of the room size and fairly basic amenities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic getaway spot in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BigSantaMonicaFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker on Dec 31 & Jan 1 and really enjoyed this hotel. Great location at the North end of MIchigan Avenue, only one block from the Hancock building and two blocks from Water Tower Place. Easy access to walk South down the Magnificant Mile to the Chicago River (roughly one mile). Also...a 5 minute walk to the Lake and a 10 minute walk over to the Rush Street area with tons of great restaurants and bars. I did read several reviews on TripAdvisor about this hotel and many were accurate, so...yes, the rooms are on the small side but are extremely clean and well-appointed (flat-screen tv, fridge, nice view of the lake, and VERY clean and upscale bathrooms with a very cool "rain" shower). I did get an excellent deal on Priceline, but would absolutely consider paying the low-end rack rate if I return. One thing to avoid...valet parking - $48! No car needed in Chicago, take the train or shuttle from the airport and then walk and/or take the eL to see the city. It's tough to beat a visit to Chicago during Christmas! Also the hotel staff was excellent...I left something valuable in the room safe and the staff was kind enough to track it down and return it to me...thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gavitar
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this website, I took a chance - wasn't sure if all the rooms were renovated which is important to me. Everything I wanted was there - clean room, comfortable bed (could have been a little firmer though), clean bathroom with high end English shampoo and soap, good service. It is on the same block as the Drake Hotel, one block from Hancock building/water tower, two blocks from the bus stop that will take you anywhere on Michigan Ave and the Loop. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Knickerbocker!”
Reviews.Author: thriftytracy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend for a weekend of shopping. I bid on a room through Priceline and paid only $117, but, we had to share a king size bed. We were fine with that! The bathroom is modern, and the room itself clean. It was a bit small, but all we did was sleep there. We came to shop! DO NOT valet park. Right across from the hotel is a garage...literally, it's probably 30 whole steps to the door of the hotel. Perfect! And, it's $30 for that parking, while the Knicerbocker charges $48 to valet your car. Ridiculous. Just do it yourself! The bed was SO COMFORTABLE that I'm thinking of buying one for my home. Sheets were quality. Yes, we'll stay again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flay626
Reviews.Content: I go to Chicago often and have stayed at the Knockerbocker for years. They have recently renovated the rooms. I travel 50% of the year on business and I can honeslty say that they have outdone themselves. Attention to detail was spot on. From the beds to the fabulous bathrooms and soaking tubs and even rain showers. The service is always first class from the time you get out of your car to to the front desk staff. If you have never been to Chicago and are looking for a weekend getaway the location is also perfect, just steps from Michigan Ave, in the heart of shopping and dinning. I highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: john01
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Knickerbocker and could not have had a better stay. The hotel has recently renovated there rooms. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful from Dave and Cora at the martini bar to Julie at the front desk who help out with an upgrade for us. The hotel has everything you need for your stay and is close to all the fun that Chicago offers. Our pick for THE CITY is the Knickerbocker. JOHN and JUDY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nbk10
Reviews.Content: A friend recommend I give the Knickerbocker a try. Having not stayed there before I found my experience to be great. Check in was smooth. The room was very tastefully decorated and modern. The bed was very comfortable and I really enjoyed the shower, very spa like. The location was fantastic, just off Michigan Avenue. Walking distance to Rush Street, where I found numerous restaurants. The entertainment in the Martini Bar was very enjoyable, the Martini's were delightful, I had a hard choosing from 45 different varieties. I will be retuning to the Knickerbocker!

Reviews.Title: “The Knickerbocker was great”
Reviews.Author: partygirl57
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and granddaughter wanted to visit Chicago which we had many times. We used to stay at The Doubletree, but I found out it was now a Hilton Suites. I saw that The Knickerbocker rooms had been renovated so we decided to give it a try. The Lobby looked slightly worn, but everyone from the doormen to the Concierge were so gracious to us. While we were checking in my little Holly mentioned that she loved the chocolate chip cookies we used to get at The Doubletree and did they have them here. Our room was very spacious, the beds so comfortable and the bathroom, while a little small was beautifully done. We were surprised later on in the evening that Sarah from the Front Desk had sent up chocolate chip cookies and milk to our room. All in all, it was a great stay, and The Knickerbocker was close to the Lakefront for my husband to jog and right next to Water Tower Place with "American Girl" for my granddaughter and I to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ashoes
Reviews.Content: I held my wedding ceremony and reception at the Knickerbocker during October and I was more than satisfied with the wonderful modern rooms, friendly & knowledgeable staff, and the hysterical doormen. We had approximately 70 guests staying in 35 rooms at the hotel and all I heard was how happy they all were with the hotel. The location is also perfect for Michigan Ave shopping, heading to the lake, and Oak Street boutiques. There are many restaurants nearby so there is no concern as to what you will eat staying in this area. Overall, my wedding was the greatest day of my life and the Knickerbocker play a very large role in making it that way!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights in October. The hotel is in a great location, just off Michigan Avenue. Rooms are small, but that is to be expected in city centre hotels. We had wanted a bath in our room, but unfortunately there were no rooms with baths available. However, the double shower is excellent. The housekeeping staff were excellent as were the reception staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and we would definitely staff there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Wait Staff”
Reviews.Author: kp8vball
Reviews.Content: We held a conference at the Knickerbocker and the wait staff was excellent! The rennovated rooms were also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “location was nice, service was not”
Reviews.Author: jennabella
Reviews.Content: the location was very convenient but the price for the stay could have been beter invested in the Westin down the street instead. My room was very small, right across from the cleaning storage closet and next to the elevators. when i mentioned the noise to the front desk they said "oh, sorry" but made no offer to help me. the cleaning staff was terrible, they basically made the bed but didn't clean up andreplace the water glasses or coffee cups. overall, very unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Planner's Dream Location”
Reviews.Author: Planner999
Reviews.Content: As a meeting planner, this experience is one that you dream of but usually never comes to fruition. The Millennium Knickerbocker in Chicago was the site for two association meetings last week and it was one of the best meetings we've had in recent past. Everything from the initial contact to the billing went as smoothly as you can imagine. I give the Knickerbocker staff my highest rating as they were there at every turn making sure all details were taken care of and even suggesting changes to make things better. I wish I could book this site every year!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: FourSquires
Reviews.Content: Our daugter's wedding reception was held at the Millennium Knickerbocker in Chicago, and we could not have had a better experience. About 25 of the guests stayed at the hotel over the weekend. Some made reservations thorugh the wedding site and others made theirs through a special rate found on the hotel website. It did not matter how the reservations were made; everyone had an excellent experience. All the hotel employees, from the bellman to the catering director, were friendly, service-oriented, and very concerned with our comfort and needs. The hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms have recently been updated with marble baths and new furnishings. Spend some time in the piano bar downstairs - awesome! The ballroom is historic and magnificently appointed. The hotel is steps from the Magnificient Mile and could not be more convenient to sights, restaurants, shopping, and transportation. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Miacle Mile”
Reviews.Author: squiddguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Knickerbocker the last week of August, 2008 while working in downtown Chicago. I picked the Knickerbocker because 1) it was the closest motel to my jobsite and 2) the price was very reasonable. I was not disappointed. The motel is located at the top of the Miracle Mile and is within easy waking distance of great shopping, the Hancock tower, the Newberry museum, and the lake front. I made a reservation, so upon arrival I was quickly checked in and whisked to my room in record time. The room was small (most in the city are) but extremely well appointed and totally comfortable. There was ample, modern work space, a very nice large flat-screen TV and luxurious king sized bed with plenty of pillows. I was also impressed with the luxurious shower. A large â€œrain showerâ€� showerhead and hand held sprayer made for very relaxing and enjoyable bathing. There was no tub, just the shower, so if a long soak is what you like, you will be disappointed. On the other hand, if you enjoy â€œshowering with a friendâ€� itâ€™s perfect. The in house restaurant was quite good, and the room service was impeccable. My order arrived correctly and quickly and tasted quite good. Everyone on the staff was professional, friendly, and helpful. Both the concierge and bellman were spot on with directions to local attractions, shops, and restaurants. Housekeeping was done with my room before 10am every day. Since I took the train to the city, I didnâ€™t need to worry about parking, and canâ€™t comment on that. I have stayed at premier hotels in 13 countries around the world, and this hotel is on a par with all of them. In my opinion, the Millennium Knickerbocker is the best motel value in The Loop and a great place to stay on the Miracle Mile. A five star motel at a three star price, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: JeanneTexas
Reviews.Content: I visit Chicago frequently having a child attending one of the local universities. That said I stay at various hotels to get a flavor of the city and its resources. My last stay was at the Knickerbocker in Chicago. This hotel is going through renovation and from what I saw will be classical when all completed. The hotel is in a wonderful location, near the lake/beach front and at one end of the famous Michigan Avenue, a shopping meca. On this trip I managed to leave my medication in my room and did not realize it until I had arrived at the airport. I immediately contacted the hotel and was routed to the supervisor on the floor where I stayed. The supervisor went to my room, located my medication and called me back to report finding that as well as my car keys!! My medication and car keys were sent to me immediately. I am very grateful and appreciated the professional attention and response I received not only in this situation but throughout my stay. A definite destination for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: kahersh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. All remodeling apepars complete, atleast to the rooms. Our room was very nice and clean. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. A 40 inch LCD TV was a nice addition. The bathroom was very cool, nice glass shower enclosure and overhead showerhead. One and only complaint, woke up twice during the night to cigarette and/or cigar smoke smell coming through the ventiliation system.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms at the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1712
Reviews.Content: My first trip back to Chicago in about 7 years was perfect! I chose the Knickerbocker as I had read that their rooms were recently renovated on top of being a great location to Michigan Avenue, Rush Street and downtown Chicago. I must say I was very impressed with the guestrooms! I had not stayed there prior but it definitely is a refresh from what Iâ€™ve seen in photo's posted on the reviews. The guestrooms are nicely decorated with a modern feel and they are good sized for a historical hotel! The beds are wonderful â€“ I need to get a pillow top mattress at home! I used the Internet access with no issue and I LOVED the larger screen TVâ€™s. The shower is fun with the different types of shower heads you can choose. And the bathrooms are fresh with all new granite and tile. Iâ€™m anxious to get back to Chicago and it wonâ€™t be 7 years from now! I would highly recommend this hotel â€“ fantastic guestrooms, location and staff! Iâ€™ve added some digital pictures of my room as they are completely different from the oneâ€™s I saw on previous reviews with the new renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, great location”
Reviews.Author: OregonToots
Reviews.Content: Had never used Hotwire before - nice experience ending up at the Knickerbocker for good price. Our ONLY negative was we were awakened at 8am by renovation work on room close to ours. Wonderful Consierge though - beautiful but small room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the evening staff”
Reviews.Author: Noseypaws
Reviews.Content: Arrived to check in at 6:00PM. I was traveling with 2 other people and had reserved a room with double beds. Upon arrival we were told no rooms with double beds were available; however, we would be given a suite with 1 king bed and a couch which folds out into a bed. We agreed. The room had one king bed, was not a suite, and had no couch. When I called reception (and spoke with the same employee), she said no suites were available. They brought up a rollaway bed which was small and very uncomforable. I spoke with the doorman about valet parking ($48 per day) and asked if someone would bring up our luggage which was in the back of the car. He agreed they would. After waiting nearly an hour, I returned to the lobby and spoke with the bellhop. He did not have our luggage. It had been left in the car and sent to the garage! Another 20 minutes later, we had receiv ed our luggage and missed part of an event for which we had purchased tickets. To be fair, staff on other shifts were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: MeirToronto
Reviews.Content: Millennium Knickerbocker exceeded my expectations. Yes, I asked for a renovated room. I was told that all rooms were now renovated. I asked if an upgrade was possible since I was staying for 6 nights. They were able to accomodate and we got a mini-suite-new, clean barely used. The first room we saw was also renovated but was a standard room, good but not large. If all rooms are indeed renovated this hotel is above average and located in a great area, just off the truly Maginificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “K-bocker pretty good”
Reviews.Author: mazuone
Reviews.Content: i got 2 nights at Knickerbocker Chicago on hotwire. last week I got a newly renovated room on 10th floor - very nice & quiet & compact. I could see the beach front from my window I thought the staff were excellent and enjoyed my stay. Providing you get a new room, it's one of the best locations in the city. Would definately return here but Why do 4* hotels charge $10 daily for internet ?? Also no tea / coffee or fridge in room

Reviews.Title: “Love Chicago, Knickbocker could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: MelBell0627
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Knickerbocker was a nice hotel, but definitely not the best deal for your dollar in Chicago. It has the feel of one of the nicer chains, but it definitely needs so remodeling. I love the historic features and tales of the hotel that the staff will share with you. And guest rooms were a decent size but could use some new bed linens, etc. However, the worst part was the bathroom. It was by far the smallest bathroom of any hotel I have ever stayed in. I was there on business and it was difficult to get ready for our events in such a small bathroom! I would consider rebooking at the Knickerbocker because of it's ideal location, but maybe after they do some renovating.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, but request a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: VisitorNE
Reviews.Content: I had a rough time getting to Chicago and stayed my first night at the Hilton Suites (Very Nice). Overall my trip wasn't great. The staff at the Knickerbocker however, made me want to return to this hotel and Chicago. I experienced doorman, room service, housekeeping, front desk, catering, and managers. Each one was very nice, attentive, and accomodating. They all went out of their way to make me as comfortable as possible and allow me to enjoy my trip. The hotel itself is under construction. My room was poor at best. It was clean, but in disrepair and very old. My floor was not one that had been renovated. The ice machine was broken and I was afraid to get in the showerf because it was so old and unlit. There were bubbles in the ceiling and peeling wallpaper and paint everywhere. The staff made me want to stay. They brought me a robe, extra blankets, delicious room service and extra coffee. The bellman, Greg, was so helpful with my luggage and made sure I knew where everything was in the room. Once the renovations are complete, if the staff remain, this will be a WONDERFUL hotel to stay while in Chicago. The location is perfect and I hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “much better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Malificence
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a steal on pricineline ($99) and was wary of the reviews but since it's a 4-star, figured it couldn't be that horrible. It was better than expected. Our room was one of the recently remodeled.. although not 100% complete. There were light fixtures in the doorway that were mounted but not fully installed. Rooms and bathroom are small, but comparable to what I've found in the Mag Mile area. The new bathroom design is strange - there's a window right in the shower that looks into the bedroom. Tolerable but odd. Love the new Asian theme decor! We were pleasantly surprised by the service, especially the concierge. It was definitely worth the money to stay on the high end of Mag Mile - right near Louis Vuitton and all the best shopping. I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here”
Reviews.Author: ShawnieD
Reviews.Content: I booked the Knickerbocker at the last minute to attend a conference, noting its 4-diamond rating. Please. The hotel is undergoing renovations, which I was not told at the time of booking, and every corner (be it the room, the elevators or the lobby) has dust and dirt. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever been in, and the furniture was chipped and tired. After one night, I cancelled my second and moved across the street to the Drake for $40 more - and the Drake was pure heaven. Maybe the Knickbocker will be better when the renovations are completed, but right now it the pits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Good Location for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: JanaLH
Reviews.Content: Got this room on priceline for a pretty good deal. The rooms were a little dated, but clean. The bathroom is extremely small! And as another poster has noted the towels are not the softest. Overall though, we enjoyed our stay here, especially considering we got a good deal on priceline. The location is great for shopping and we were there the first week in December, so we spent alot of time on Michigan Ave. Loved Chicago and look forward to returning. I would stay at this hotel again if I got a deal on priceline, don't think I would if I had to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “hair hair hair”
Reviews.Author: wshlew
Reviews.Content: The staff is nice, friendly and accomodating. Kept changing the room for me as I found what looked like pubic hair on the blanket. The last room they gave me, which was the best out of all was filled with hair on the bathroom floor. I took it because it's much better to have it at my blanket. The hotel is old, mildwey, and dated. They were under renovation. They couldn't print out my check out sheet because the system was off. They are supposed to be sending it to me via my emailm but I am yet to get the email a few weeks after. The room service breakfast isn't so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are lovely”
Reviews.Author: KayDenmark
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker several times, and have always had a positive experience. Our room, 426, was one of the newly renovated and was in fine shape, with lovely linens and a beautiful new bathroom. We found the staff, who come from a rainbow of backgrounds, to be extremely professional and helpful. From admissions clerk to concierge to the head bellman, Craig (after some serious shopping on Michigan Avenue, we ended up with 7 suitcases), went out of their way to make our trip an enjoyable one. (Of course, with this many staff, I suggest coming prepared with a lot of singles for tipping.) My only complaint was the terrible wine from room service. I'm no wine snob, but the glass of Cabernet recommended by the room service manager on duty was so bad I had to send it back. I chose a Sauvingnon Blanc as a replacement, and that was pretty lousy as well. We did not order any food from room service. A bellman recommended the excellent Tempo Diner a couple of blocks away, and we particularly enjoyed their breakfast pancakes. I believe this diner is open 24 hours. We were happy with the Millenium Knickerbocker and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: princess32142004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium over New Year's Eve and got a great rate through priceline. It is right down the street from the famous Drake Hotel and right off North Michigan Avenue, truly a lovely area. We had some minor problems with the internet connection and the cleaning service, but overall our stay at the Millennium was fantastic. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline & Millenium Knickerbocker a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ENGLISH EXPAT
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for an adult weekend away on Priceline, paid $85 which thought was good price for a 4* in downtown Chicago. The location is great. The hotel minimally OK> Unsure how it gets a 4* rating. It is old and though clean the decor is definitely jaded and needing a face lift. Staff were pleasant and overall it was a good stay. However I would NOT recommend this hotel. I would rather have paid $100 and got something more updated - trouble with old it tends to look somewhat seedy and this was true in this case. My suggestion DO NOT BOOK PRICELINE FOR CHICAGO IL AND ASK FOR 4 * BECAUSE THIS IS WHAT YOU ARE ALMOST SURE TO GET.....NOT GOOD ENOUGH PRICELINE.!! IN MY OPINION.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a real Dump”
Reviews.Author: KENYASAFARIGIRL
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY!!! Hopefully the renovation will create a 4 star hotel. However, at the moment, this is far from a 4 star hotel. I would have been happier in a holiday inn/best western. I pricelined a 4star, N. Michigan ave hotel for NYE and this is what I got. Last year, I pricelined a 4star hotel on North Michigan ave and I was at the Westin which prompted me to do this again.... Had I known how disgusting the Knickerbocker truly is, I never would have done so. The room had hair ALL OVER. Dangling from the lamps, in the bath tub, in the sink and god only knows what was there that I could not see. The room was small, which was not a big deal. The fact that you had to go sideways into the bathroom because a bed was in the doorway was a little annoying. The whole room was shabby, the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling (and again had hair stuck to it). The toilet was hard to flush.. the bedding was very tattered and the pillows had lost all their fringe (and yes, I threw those things off as fast as possible. they just looked like they harbored bacteria). The bed was so old I sank into it and could barely get out (and I weigh 110 pounds so it wasn't my massive frame that caused the bed to sink. I do not recommend anyone uses priceline.com until this hotel is removed from the 4 star choice.

Reviews.Title: “Historic means OLD!”
Reviews.Author: cshager
Reviews.Content: We were extemely disappointed with this questionable 4 star hotel. It was described as historic and luxurious. It was not! It is just old and needs remodeling. We had a king room on the 6th floor at the end of the hallway with a view of the Westin and roof of the neighboring building. So, no view. The room was tiny with the woodwork painted over and over, and it was cracked and peeling. We agree with what others have written about the temperature. It was either hot or cold. Then there was the bathroom. Cheap, small, and smelly. It had a musty smell. There was nothing luxurious about the bathroom either. Cheap fixtures and tile work. Scratchy towels. The linens on the bed were okay but not of 4 star quality. I would rate this hotel a 2 star. It is not as nice as some Super 8 rooms I have stayed in while on the road traveling. The elevators are old and also in need of remodeling. The help was less than helpful. Basically, the help ingored the guests. I used the fitness room, and it had everything that is needed for a good workout. However, all the machines were crammed into a hotel size room. Then there is no pool or whirlpool. They offer those 6 blocks south of the hotel. Who wants to venture out in cold weather to walk that far in the cold? On the positive side, it has a great location! We did have a great weekend taking in shows, restaurants, and the Bears game. Go Bears! Priceline, Please take this off your 4 start list!!!!! We have used Priceline for most of our stays in Chicago and were terribly disappointed this time. This hotel lacks the amenities and features of a 4 star hotel. It is a place to sleep while staying in the city and no more. Sincerely, A faithful Priceline customer

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous...Best Customer Service In Chicago...”
Reviews.Author: elizabethvo
Reviews.Content: With all the bad and low reviews I was not happy, to say the least, when Priceline picked the Knickerbocker in Chicago as my 4* hotel for my Christmas two day break. WHAT A SURPRISE. Upon arriving late in the evening I was welcomed by two extremely lovely and helpful check in representatives who although being very busy were more than kind and friendly. The elevator is conveniently located right next to the check-in. Upon getting to my room and getting situated I noticed a slight problem. I called the front desk and within two minutes one of the front desk personnel was in my room (I believe it was the manager). There was no question from him other than...... "what can I do to make you happy?" I stated that I wanted to stay at the hotel and try another room. He immediately went to find another room; checking the room first to make sure it was perfect. I cannot express how satisfied I was with the concern that he quickly had shown to me and how fast he worked to find another room. The room was not only beautiful but clean and very comfortable. The great things about the rooms and hotel are: **** Beautiful furnishings **** Comfortable beds **** Beautiful lighting and mirrors **** Quaint bathroom with high end shampoo and soaps **** Fast room service - including all night service **** Great housekeeping **** High end linens and pillows **** Location..location..location.. **** Friendly staff and hard working bellman and valets If there is any down sides at all it would be: **** Expensive valet parking - $44.00 per day **** No Menu for children Overall I will stay at the Knickerbocker every time I am in Chicago for either business or pleasure; with or without the children. Checking hotel websites the prices are very reasonable for this type of hotel. Before this hotel I would normally take my changes on Priceline or Hotwire; but now I would rather spend a few extra dollars and have peace of mind on knowing I will be totally satisfied with my hotel. Take a chance, see for yourself. This is a fabulous older and quaint hotel in the best location in Chicago. Sincerely, Elizabeth Wahl Vo

Reviews.Title: “Girls Night Downtown....”
Reviews.Author: Smadd
Reviews.Content: I took my Mom and my sisters to this property on Dec. 14th. We live about 40 minutes outside of Chicago and love staying in this area around x-mas to shop, eat, Walk etc... This is a great old hotel, classic. It may not be up to modern standards that a lot of travelers are used to, but it's wonderful. I would describe this hotel as a nice boutique hotel with a very European feel. I've stayed here over the years with friends and family and have never had a below excellent experience. You can't beat the location, awesome to go walking on Michigan Ave during the holidays! Right across the street from the Drake, and I've stayed there as well and didn't enjoy it nearly as much, way overpriced. The rooms and bathroom are a little small, but unless you are planning on spending a lot of time in the room it really doesn't matter, it's comfortable and decorated nicely. Stay and enjoy! Don't worry about any bad reviews, let those people spend three times as much so they have a few more feet in the bathroom! ??

Reviews.Title: “we were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: thunderblaster1
Reviews.Content: Have traveled extensively and have stayed at a wide variety of hotel properties, from Super 8 level to Ritz Carlton level. I have also stayed at other Millennium properties. This hotel was noticably not up to par compared to what I would expect from a hotel with this reputation and location. Nice lobby, but that hides the rooms, where the real issues are. My wife and I had a one double bed room. The room was no larger than perhaps 10 feet by 12 feet. There were obvious worn spots on the carpet, especially near the room entrance. The bathroom, not including the shower, was about 3 feet wide by 5 feet long. The temperature fluctuated drastically throughout the night (it was 20 degrees outside). We'd set the thermostat at 75 and it felt way too hot -- at least 80. Then we would reset it to 72 and I was shivering in 15 minutes. The bed was one of the cheapest beds I have ever slept in. It felt like a trampoline. The slightest movements by either of us would be transmitted throughout the bed, resulting in a difficult sleep for us both. Next time we'll choose a Radisson or Sheraton or something like that, where we're more likely to get more for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Good option to travel in Budget”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located 1 block from the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Avenue) just infront of Drake Hotel. I didn't really decided to purchase this hotel, since I blindly purchased in Hotwire. The result was a very convenient rate, in a good located hotel. If you like very luxury hotels this is not your option, since the rooms are old, limited and not stylish. But they are confortable, and you didn't really feel you lack. It's just that if you are used to book in fancy hotels, you will have the sensation, you are in a lower category hotel. By the way the staff in the hotel is really helpfull and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: travelfar
Reviews.Content: What a quaint, warm and friendly place to stay! Very accomodating ..had 2 dble beds and bathroom was fine....a bit small compared to USA hotels....but compared to european travel...the place was palatial! Would def. stay here again. Location is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AJR93
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a stay at the Knickerbocker. It was my fourth trip to Chicago. The location north of Michigan Avenue is excellent. However, the rooms are very small, particularly the bathrooms which make the pricey (even for a Chicago) stay not worth it at all. Further, the front desk staff were inept and condescending. My friend and I had an issue with the bill, which the staff failed to comprehend, and I ended up being billed AFTER checkout for services not incurred.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on priceline for $73. My first time in Chicago & I arrived in the dark & was abit worried about whether the hotel would be in a neighbourhood that felt safe. But the hotel has a great location right near the John Hancock Tower, lots of people around & handy for the shops on N Michigan Avenue. The rooms are not huge & there was only a shower - no bath. But for this price it was great. They charge for internet access but I connected on my laptop & was ready to pay the $10 fee but as I used wireless connection not a plug-in on the desk I wasn't charged - presumably as the system doesn't know which room I'm in! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Knickerbocker - charming but a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: ParmaPerson
Reviews.Content: Location is wonderful! It's right off Michigan Avenue on a quiet street near the gold coast. Staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. The hotel has a certain charming, slightly shabby feel. Room was small, but plenty of room for one person (or two if you spend most of your time elsewhere ). Bathroom was large enough but there was no vanity or counter for personal items. By my second day I was really tired of getting ready using a narrow sink ledge. Everything slid into the sink or onto the floor. Wireless access from the bar area and mezzanine was free but everything else had a seperate charge. I'd stay there again for (only) one night because of location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, our guests were very happy, thanks Ashley!”
Reviews.Author: mm_chicago21
Reviews.Content: We reserved the Knickerbocker for our guests to stay for our wedding a mile away in Lincoln Park and couldnâ€™t be happier. We booked a total of about 20 rooms and the hotel was very flexible in allowing us to not guarantee them until guests booked also. Ashley helped us with every step and we had nothing but positives from our guests. The positives: GREAT location! Not a cookie cutter hotel, and it has some charm. Wonderful service. The negatives: smaller rooms that wonâ€™t be ideal for people who only expect McMansion dimensions. ??? Other than that, a great value!

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 1othertraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Chicago Knickerboder Hotel for 1 night in October. The hotel's central air conditioning system wasn't working at all. I woke up several times during the night to add clothes. I turned the thermostats up and up until 85 degrees. There was no heat at all. The next morning I complained to the hotel front desk who simply said to me, 'we know there is a problem.' I tried to ask for some compensation from the hotel and was rejected. Will never go back again. Yes, the bathroom is extremely small and the lobby, elevator smells cigarette smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Better then the reviews give it credit for”
Reviews.Author: lsallee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline and was terrfified after seeing the reviews, almost to the point of dreading the trip. We just returned today and I couldn't wait to write a review. The staff was extremely helpful. The consierge was wonderful and able to answer all of our questions. The beds were very comfortable and had thick comforters. Our room had two double rooms and had enough room for my family of 4. We would definately stay here again. I was very very pleasantly suprised and glad that we got this hotel. The location was fantastic and as I already mentioned the staff was great. the only things that could have made this any better was free wireless internet connection in the room, a continental breakfast and bigger dressers to put our clothes in. Other than that we enjoyed the hotel a great deal. The decorations are a little strange as you can see by candid pictures and the hallway had a little of a musty smell but it was not over bearing and it did not smell like urine as some of the reviews have stated. Don't be afraid if you get this room on price line. We had a great stay and I am grateful to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm not so much! Would not be my choice”
Reviews.Author: exdancer
Reviews.Content: A conference booked this hotel for me and I did check it out but when I arrived I was a little disappointed. However the location is great just one block from Michigan Street where you will find great shopping and eateries and the hotel martini bar in the lobby looked inviting. Now ...as far as the room, I requested a king got two doubles, the remote control did not work and the view was yucky. The hotel is noted as a historical hotel - so if you are not into history this is not the place for you. What I found to be amusing was the size difference between the closet and the bathroom. The closet was a walk-in with a night stand inside and the bathroom was so small I could wash my face in the sink, shower and flush all at once. The towels rough not fluffy (again historical) and there were no wash cloths. The photos are better than it really is. This property is rated 4 star but I would not stay here again (not terrible but there are better in the same location). There are those who like historical ...but not me.

Reviews.Title: “Knickerbocker better than OK”
Reviews.Author: cinci_guy
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Chicago and a stay at the Millenium Knickerbocker. After reading the reviews on this forum I was worried about what I would find. Yes the hotel is old, but it is well maintained. The bathrooms as mentioned in other posts are small. The rooms are on the smallish side too but if you are like us you are not in Chicago to stay in a hotel room. The beds were comfortable and things were clean. The location is great! Just 1/2 block from N. Michigan avenue. The staff was also nice and very helpful. We would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: janetf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at this property, and it was just fine. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge desk (we dealt with at least 4 differenct concierges, and they were all GREAT.) Perfect location, plenty to do within walking distance, plus we rode the bus up and down Michigan Ave quite a bit. The hotel is old and the decor a little funky, but we knew what to expect and thought it was great. Our room was very nice, we were at the end of a hallway. The bathroom was small but didn't seem to be a problem for us. Loved the windows that opened, had a nice breeze at one point! Again, if you know what to expect, this hotel is fine - we would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to renovate”
Reviews.Author: boomertee
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst rooms we have stayed in during the last 10 years. The first room they gave us was a shock. TINY and the bathroom was a joke,, you had to step inside, move out of the way just to shut the door. The furniture is disgusting and all the wood trim was VERY beat up and painted over about 100 times. so they transfered us to the 'executive suite' That room had a tiny bathroom.. I mean TINY! The furniture was hideous and dirty. It was on the 3rd level so you heard every conversation on the street below and traffic was loud. The only impressive part is the lobby.. but don't be fooled. because after that .. the floors above look like they need a major overhaul.. and the rooms were not worth even $100 per night. we stayed there a year ago because we got stuck through Priceline deal. I don't think we want to do Priceline again only because they have the Knickerbocker as a 4 star Hotel and we don't ever want to go back there again. 2 Stars at best for the dumpy Knickerbocker. They should be ashamed of themselves for even allowing guests to stay in those rooms. Boomer. Naperville, IL

Reviews.Title: “Ok, I gave it a try. Sorry I did.”
Reviews.Author: rfmnj
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews I was a little apprehensive about our stay here. Friendly staff? Not so. We found an AMAZINGLY RUDE STAFF. From the moment we checked in, we were greeted by Hector at the front desk who could not have been more rude. After we checked in, the bellman was in shock when we asked for our luggage to be brought to our room by him. Once, when asking for change from Helen at the Front Desk, we were simply told â€œNOâ€� with out any further explanation. The interior of the room has been described as shabby-chic in previous reviews, but to be honest it is better described as rundown shabby chic. The wallpaper is peeling, the carpets are shredded and torn, woodwork cracked and peeling, furniture is chipped and stained. Air-conditioning unit did smell something awful in one of our rooms. The hall does smell of some odor that is being masked. If you get it for under $100/night it might (I repeat might) be a good deal. But otherwise, I would advise anyone to avoid this hotel. There are no redeeming qualities in this hotel that you could not find in any other hotel in the area, and the little things that make a hotel visit special are non-existent here.

Reviews.Title: “Serves it's purpose - Great staff”
Reviews.Author: mavz44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 nights here for our anniversary. The hotel is in a perfect location about 1/2 block off the north side of Michigan Ave. John Hancock building only 1.5 blocks away. We arrived at the hotel at about 4:30pm on a Sunday. We pulled up to the door and the bellman was there to help us right away. ...very friendly and helpful. He took our luggage and the valet man took my car and off to check in we went. Check in was a breeze...no wait at all. She mention that our room had 2 full size beds and I said "no, it should be a queen" She tapped a few buttons and then gave me a choice of 2 rooms with King size beds, and pointed out that one is at the end of the hallway, which would have little foot traffic, and the other has a view of the beach/lake. Both would be very nice. I said I'll take the one with the view of the lake. Again she tapped a few buttons and said "Looks like I can't give you that one, but I can put you in this one." It ended up being an even better room on the 12th floor over all the other smaller buildings with a view of the beach and lake. We arrived at to our room and my first over all impression was not too bad. It was older, the decorations/theme was a little odd, and it was a little small, but it was clean and acceptable. The bathroom was small too, but I was not going to complain, because I got the room for $75/night + $40/night for valet parking. The hallway did have a distinct smell to it, but I would say it was bad, just one of a kind. The room was fine though. It was very hot during our stay there, but we still opened our window, which always provide a nice strong consistent breeze come off the lake. I was shocked to find that there was very little if any road/traffic noise that could be heard with our window open. The hallway could be noisy if it was a busy floor, but we got lucky and there didn't seem to be many people coming and going at night, so we didn't get the banging from other peoples doors or talking in the hallway. I left my memory stick for my digital camera in the room and didn't find out till I got home, so I don't have any pictures. I called the hotel right away and they transferred me to the maid service. I talked to a Lucy and she was very professional, nice, and courteous, unfortunately they were unable to find the memory stick, which I'm still sick about, but I must say it was nice to know that the resort still treated me like a guest even after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: susymd
Reviews.Content: I was VERY please with this hotel. I think it holds true to a 4-star rating. We booked this hotel on hotwire for $99/nt. Keep in mind that it's an older hotel. It's beautiful and has lots of character. We stayed on the 10th floor. The room looked as though it had been remodeled. We had a king size bed that was VERY comfortable. The bathroom is VERY small, but everything was new and very modern in the bathroom. The room was very clean and even smelled great. We read other reviews and took the advice to request a new bathroom, so maybe that is why we got such a nice room. They have 3 or 4 elevators and they are very small. The doorman & bellman get two thumbs down. They never helped us with our bags or even opened the door, actually they just stood in the way. But, the concierge gets two thumbs up!!! If you need advice on where to go and what to see talk to Paul. He is a wealth of knowledge and such a nice person. He gave us maps and took 20 mins with us. We took his advice on a few things and his suggestions were always great! The hotel is in a great location. Just 1 block from Michigan ave. But, if you want to catch the L it's about a 15 min walk. about 5-6 blocks. The only other complaint I have is that our thermostat in our room didn't work so it was either too hot or too cold. But we never complained since we only stayed 2 nights and were just in the room to sleep. Overall I would recommend this hotel. We loved the restaurant Carmines on rush street. We loved the Chicago Trolley Co. Hop-on-hop-off tour (take the double-decker bus instead of the trolley) A Cubs game is a MUST. (take the L) Breakfast at Tempoâ€™s is GEAT Take a ride around the brown line on the L (great sightseeing) We didn't like the restaurant Hugo Frogs on Rush street. Hope this is helpful and enjoy Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “A great historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BevoAustin
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at The Knickerbocker and it was fantastic. The staff is incredibly attentive and the location is outstanding. I loved the Martini Bar and all of the food was really good too. The concierge helped me plan each day of my stay and I was able to maximize my Chicago visit. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: TexasTHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned after seeing the mixed reviews that the hotel got. We found it an outstanding value for the money. Rooms were small but clean, beds were comfortable. Bathroom was very clean. My husband, myself and our two teen age daughters shared a room and found we had enough space. The staff was very helpful and the location was excellent. We will stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: wampolch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Knickerbocker about 10 years ago and felt it had a decrepit elegance. Now it is plain old decrepit. The bathroom was about the size you would expect in an interior cabin of a Carneval Cruiseship. The grout in the tub had been reworked so many times, an archeologist could have made a study of it. When I arrived a long hair was adhered to the shower curtain. The wallpaper was curling up in spots; the ceiling plaster was patched, etc. On the plus side, the windows in the room actually open, and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Average place if you find a good deal on it!”
Reviews.Author: chamonrac
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and got a 1-night stay for for $110 plus tax. Given the location, I would say this price was just about ok....but any higher and I would be disappointed. The lobby is decent enough but the rooms are old and the bathroom, though clean, wasn't what you'd expect from a 4-star in the heart of Chicago. All in all, if location is your main concern, you are happy with a reasonably nice place to stay, and you can book for under $125 a night....I could live with this choice!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: RealMccoy
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention at the hotel. Requested a king non smoking room. Arrived early and our room was not ready but that isn't their fault. They kept our bags for us and we went out to explore the city. When we came back they told us our room was ready. It was on the sixth floor and faced a courtyard of sorts. No view but we didn't mind because it was quiet at night time. The room had been rehabed recently. Surprisingly the room has two bathrooms. A half bath and a full bath. We set up shop as his and hers so that was nice. The hotel was built in 1927 and is on the historic hotel ledger. The entrance way is not very grand as say the park in boston but it is nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially the concierge. Don't eat at the hotel. it is way over priced. There are good eats all around and RUSH street restaraunts are a short walk away. Navy pier is a 20 min walk. This hotel is at a good location. You can walk and shop the vertical malls and the over priced designer shops. You are walking distance to the zoo and area beaches and the bike and walking trails along the lake. I made it thru my whole trip without needed a cab. The hotel has wireless internet that is free in the hotel lobby and wired access from the rooms for 9.99 for 24 hours. It was worth the trek to the lobby for the free access. Hotel provides USA today each weekday. Room service is over priced. Steak is 40 bucks. Chicago is a nice city. very clean. people are very nice. I would stay here at this hotel again. If you want posh and lux don't stay stay at the drake across the street. If you want a nice place to stay with charm and good attentive staff stay here. The parking I might add is a bit steep at 40 bucks per day but you have in/out privliages (valet). Alert. No Pool so if you have kids you might want to look elsewhere. Elevators are small also but they were quick and always available.

Reviews.Title: “Hrumpf!”
Reviews.Author: Pazrael
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this business trip. I knew it would be a bit difficult to see many sites so I was enthused about a great hotel. I read reviews, but remained positive that it would be good. Heck, a hotel you are paying $300 a night for must be nice. The day before I flew in I called the hotel as the travel agent didn't book a smoking room. I was told that the couldn't arrange it for the first night and that all smoking rooms for the remaining nights were on the convention level and it would be loud during the day. That didn't bode well as I was working a night shift so I opted for a non-smoking room. When I checked in my room was ready early. The lobby is outstanding and the Martini bar quite neat. The Nyx restaraunt is immaculate looking though I was never back early enough to eat there. There was a faint odor in the hallways, but it wasn't in my room. I found a double bed arrangement instead of the requested king. Dropped my bags and headed to work. After work I was excited to sit down and have a drink at the neat little martini bar....it closed at 12:30. The bartender Floyd was wonderful despite not being able to serve me. He gave me directions to a 4am bar so I hung out there the next few days. Upon returning to my room I unpacked my laptop and couldn't find a wireless signal (the internet usage directions were hidden under the phone). Called the desk and was told that I would have to purchase a LAN cable out of the wet bar for $7, and be charged $10 per 24 hours for internat usage. I was stewing now so I inspected the room a bit. Yes, it was tiny and I could understand that. The lighting was dim at night. The TV didn't pull out far enough to have a good angle to the desk for when I was working on my computer. The closet was small and had a small as well as the restroom but the shower was nice though. Limited space all around. The comfotors were VERY worn and had holes in them. Explaining the problems to the front desk, they agreed to comp the cable. I asked them to be sure no one woke me up and to have room service after 3:30pm. I was awoken at 1pm by the room service people that had or should have had contrary orders. The comforters were not changed my entire trip there. On check out they didn't charge me for internet usage for my stay. This place isn't terrible, but is is not worth $300 a night. I see most of you are getting decent rates on discount sites and for $80 a night I might have been way more agreeable to the problems, but even at $80 a night I've had better experiences in Holiday Inn Express....

Reviews.Title: “Great location but really needs updating”
Reviews.Author: MaryWood17
Reviews.Content: This could be a great hotel -- it's a historic building a great location and the neighborhood is wonderful, but the decor is shabby and in serious need of updating. The rooms are small and the bathroom really tiny and rickety (the shower doors and tiny pedestal sink wabble and we had a bathroom door wouldn't shut, and the repair person never showed up to fix it). The front desk staff is rather inefficient and often in a state of confusion. One plus is the rates were reasonable compared to all other hotels in the area, but I'd rather pay more next time and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A place to put your head”
Reviews.Author: Kypdr89
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK. Older hotel with a interesting history. They were great in letting us check in right away 9am so we did not have to carry our bags around all day. We upgraded to a larger room with 2 double beds. I cant imagine how small the original room with 1 queen would of been. Spent the night there after a long day at the taste and a archetectural tour. We didn't want to pay the rates for breakfast $$ so we asked concerige and they were wonderful in recomending a great resturant named Tempo a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Suggestions I have for making your trip better here.”
Reviews.Author: KellyinKentucky
Reviews.Content: Hi ........ we just stayed 7/13-7/16 ......... We booked our hotel on Priceline 4 mons ago, so we didn't select the Knickerbocker, Priceline selected it for us :) .... That said - I have read all the reviews and here is our take (we are in our early 30's no children). Suggestions for room requests - we requested NEW bathroom rooms and end of the hallway when we arrived. These are 2 huge suggestions to ask for. Old bathrooms everybody say are yicky - ours was brand new, very clean - still small, but no biggy. End of the hallway - VERY imporant - walls are very thin, you can easily hear people walking by - so i HIGHLY recommend you request this. GREAT location as everybody says - you are right on Michigan Ave you come out at Louis Vuitton, so you are close to EVERYTHING. Yes, halls do spell like cat urine, however our room did not (we were in 522) - I had brought candle and burned in our room and made everything spell yummy :) ........ we are picky picky - Ritz Carlton travelers, however we knew going in what to look for and what to plan for and we had a GREAT time :).

Reviews.Title: “A Downtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: dstivescpa
Reviews.Content: Other reviews complain about the small rooms. For a major city, we found our room quite comfortable with a king bed and really nice furnishings. One feature we liked is the ability to open the window. The Knikerbocker is a small boutique hotel right off Michigan Avenue in the best area of Chicago. The staff was friendly and helpful. For the $116 we paid on Hotwire, we could not have found a better room in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Staff get an A+; for the rest, oy vey”
Reviews.Author: SFO-World-Traveller
Reviews.Content: The experience at this hotel can be summed up in two words: risky venture. The staff are fantastic for the most part but the hotel is a piece of crap. The lobby is old and and worn, not to mention the elevators, corridors, room doors, rooms, bathrooms, beds, bedding, desks, desk chairs, carpet in the rooms, towels, toilets, bathtubs...need I go on? I get the feeling that the staff are trying real hard to impress guests but one gets the feeling even at check-in that it's going to be a lackluster experience. Reception is tucked away back in a far away corner and seems to have not been renovated in a dozen years, at least. The rooms are exceptionally dirty and the decor an assault on the senses (all of them, including smell!). I made sure to remove the quilt from the bed before sleeping in it - seems they don't change them on a guest-by-guest basis and it was, uh, stained with somethin'. I don't know what and wasn't about to find out. This isn't a four-star hotel in any way more than the staff and it's history. It's present day condition warrants a complete makeover. That said, if you are lucky the price is right on Hotwire, Priceline, etc., and for the location, maybe that's the trade-off. But for me, I'd rather stay elsewhere at higher cost with improved hygiene and room experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the Knickerbocker is a dump”
Reviews.Author: starlight68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Knickerbocker hotel from Jun 28-July 1 07. My first mistake was purchasing this hotel stay through Hotwire, which I will never use their service again. DON'T GET STUCK AT A PLACE YOU CAN'T GET YOUR MONEY BACK. My second mistake was actually staying there. I can't believe they consider this hotel a 4 star hotel. Whoever rated this hotel as such must have been drinking and smoking something. This is a solid 2-star hotel. The rooms are extremely small and not well maintained. It's an old hotel so there is layer upon layer of paint on the walls and molding. At first we had a room with a queen bed, which gave us about 2 feet on each side. The bathroom door could touch the bed. Only one person can fit in the bathroom. There is no place to put your toiletries because it's a single sink. The wallpaper was peeling in various places. Then we moved to a room with a king bed. That was a little better a little more room. The decor was horrible. It looked as if they picked up the items from a flea market. Now, the location is great. It's a 1/2 block from Michigan Ave., which was a plus. But, i do not recommend this hotel or HOTWIRE.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Dump”
Reviews.Author: GerryCAtlanta_Ga_
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker is one hotel that I'd like to forget. The rooms are very small, musty smelling and the decorations are an abomination. You could shop at any flea market and find higher quality furnishings. If you are use to hostel type living--you might find this place agreeable. At best it might be a two star and I'm being gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark2211
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews here. Unless you are looking for a super high standard 5*, I would certainly recommend this hotel. Whilst the rooms are quite small and the bathrooms fairly limited, it IS a very nice hotel - not a dump as one reviewer said. The staff were very attentive and kind and the hotel feel was quite luxurious. The location is great (close to the water).

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: DLTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: Pluses: - Bathrooms were recently renovated, and had new showers installed. They were very clean. - Staff were very polite and attentive Cons: - Boy, this place stank. And by "stank" I mean, it smelled. The hallways had a unique odor of mildew, doggy smell and even a urine-like smell. - The rooms were incredibly small. - The decor was hideously ugly. As in, early seventies mirrored walls above the bed. It was not worth the price at all. P.S., be wary of the small "gift shop" across from the front desk. The employees there shorted me on change on three separate occasions - they have some serious issues with being able to count money.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar service, Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travelbugillinois
Reviews.Content: We hotwired this hotel, and I was concerned after reading the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised with the attentive service we recieved (car brought around promptly, great lobby bar, super concierge). Rooms are a bit dated, but I was informed there is a major renovation underway. Set in a great Gold Coast location, close to world-class shopping and dining, but on a quieter street just east of Michigan. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people say.”
Reviews.Author: tp-mich
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked a room at the Knickerbocker and just returned. We had room 920, which had a king size bed and a partial view of the beach. This hotel is not as bad as people on this website say it is. I was concerned after reading some reviews, but when we arrived I realized that some people are just way too picky. I didn't feel the hotel was "disgusting" as some other reviewers thought. Here are some highlights: Room - The room was decent sized and had a very comfortable king size bed. The decorations are a little weird, but I feel like it adds to the character of this hotel. The bathroom is small, but for one person at a time it is fine. The shower worked really nice and the soaps and shampoos included were good quality. Considering how old the hotel is, I feel the rooms are in very good condition. Lobby - The lobby is large with a really nice bar attached. The drinks were pricey though at about $8 for a rum and coke. We didn't go to the hotel restaurant, but it looked like it is very reasonably priced. Staff - The front desk staff, concierge, and bell hops were all very friendly and accommodating. The concierge even helped us find the address for a bar we were looking for. We had no problems at all. Location - Absolutely perfect. Less than one block from Michigan Avenue and the Hancock building and only about two blocks from Water Tower Place. It is close to the beach too. Also, tons of restaurants were within walking distance, including Ditka's. Parking - We parked directly across the street at the parking garage right next to The Drake. They charged $30 per day, but it's better than the $40 per day that the hotel charges. Overall, we had a great stay at The Knickerbocker and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Millenium Knickerbocker is Awful”
Reviews.Author: 1918Traveler
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. I booked on Priceline, because the last time I booked a Priceline hotel in Chicago, I got the Westin and loved it. Despite having paid for Priceline, I ate the money I had already spent and called for a reservation at the Westin and went there for the weekend, instead. I didn't regret it for a second. You will be disappointed if you stay at the Millenium Knickerbocker because you are paying for a Holiday Inn at the price of a Westin when you could have the real deal for just a little more. The location is not worth the place being old and so unimpressive. There are enough hotels near the loop (and near a train/bus stop if you need to move around the city inexpensively) that you should not spend the money on the Millenium. Do not waste your time and stay here--this is a trap because of its location, but it's not worth it. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but stinky.”
Reviews.Author: dmurraybas2
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous; the lobby is lovely. The room was comfortable but completely lacked charm. Among all the pictures, mirrors, furniture, lamps, and wallpaper in the room, none matched. Total hodge-podge. The bathroom was small, and smelled badly of mildew. Noise from neighboring rooms is very noticeable. I would stay here again, in a pinch. But I would not choose this hotel among most others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: aboxall
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at this hotel on business. The hotel has lots of character and my deluxe room was spacious, well furnished and very clean. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is excellently situated for shopping and all the major sites. Overall, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Shabby Chic”
Reviews.Author: KarmaDog
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Knickerbocker. The room was a bit small, bathroom rather cramped and the elegant decor a little past its prime, but it is still a very nice place to stay. My two teenage daughters thought it was "awesome". They loved the room decorations and the elegant look and feel of the hotel. The staff was very friendly. The bar was a fun place for a drink. The location is great for shopping; Bloomindales is across the street, Water Town Place is 2 blocks away and American Girl Place is 3 blocks away. For breakfast we recommend the Oak Tree Restaurant , it is in the same building as Bloomindales on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “So quaint.”
Reviews.Author: bsarasb
Reviews.Content: We came into town for "girls weekend out" to see a few shows and "hang out." The hotel was close to everything we were doing but quiet enough to not hear traffic, even with the window open. Clubs on Rush Street were a block away too. The lobby is quaint and quite beautiful. There is a martini bar and the bartender, Floyd, is pleasant and informative about area restaurants and general information. Fun guy to talk with. There's also a piano player to entertain you. The rooms are interesting as well. A small bathroom but the water is hot and there's enough room for one person to move around. The head of the beds have curtains and there are shams on the pillows with a long round pillow too! The stay was nice and everything was clean. I'd definitely stay there again. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: kirby-7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for downtown Chicago. I was a little hesitant after reading some of the comments. The hotel was built in 1927 so the hallways are clean and classically deisigned with beauitful light fixtures and door knockers. Our room had two double beds. They were small beds, but no big deal...there were two of us. Our room was rather spacious and very clean. The bedding (sheets) were quality cotton. The bathrom had no tub, but a very nice tiled shower area and was very clean. The decor is a little "funky", but it adds character to the hotel. The entire staff was exceptional. Parking is $40 for 24 hours (valet). You could park your car in the Bloomingdale's parking ramp on North MIchigan (1block away) for 24 hours at the rate of $25. The hotel is just a block from North MIchigan Avenue. Bloomingdales, Macy's, Ditkas, American Girl Store, and many other great shopping areas are just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flavioandmarita
