Reviews.Content: If price is your only consideration then you can't beat this location. But if you expect a 4 star experience you'll need to go somewhere else. We booked through Priceline - got an OK rate: $110/night. I see others have gotten rooms here for less. After booking we called the hotel and requested 2 beds. We confirmed again 2 days before we got there. We got into the room and found a King bed. The person at the other end of the phone when we called down to question the room told us that booking through Priceline only gives you the option to "request" 2 beds - apparently calling twice and confirming 2 beds means nothing. We were told there were no other rooms available. The woman I spoke to wasn't pleasant at all - very surprising for a supposedly 4-star, customer-friendly hotel. It was obvious she had a bias against Priceline customers. The bellman (very friendly and sympathetic) suggested getting a roll-away - but there would be an add'l charge. We declined since there was absolutely no room for it. The rooms here are "old world" small, by the way. Cozy and cute but not a place to hang out (but then you're in Chicago so why would you spend more time in your room than you have to?). There are no dressers - only small drawers in the desk. We kept things in the suitcase. The room comes with a single-serving coffee maker. But check that you actually have more than one serving if there are 2 or more in the room. We called for more coffee and it was promptly delivered. No free phone calls - charges are by the minute. No free internet access. No views to speak of but the street is fairly quiet. Now about the bathrooms... Who designed these?!?!? They're small - VERY small. Just to close the door I had to turn sideways. The toilet was nearly flush against the wall. The bathtub was narrow and I kept bumping into the soapdish placed at shoulder height. No fan. They provide the usual soaps, shampoos, etc. but if you bring your own you won't have much shelf space. The next morning we asked at the front desk about availability of a room with 2 beds. They had one - and apparently had one the night before. We asked them to call us if they had a cancellation but got no call. It would appear they hold these rooms for off-the-street customers and force Priceline customers to take the one bed rooms. We called for a bellman to help move us to the new room. After 20 minutes of waiting we moved ourselves. The room was very similar to the old room except there was no easy chair (the better to fit 2 double beds in the room). The bathroom was nearly identical - by which I mean still small. The saving grace was that the door was on a different wall and there was more room to maneuver going in and out. I still can't get over the narrowness of the toilet and shower. Aside from the woman on the phone the first night (we stayed 4 nights), everyone we came in contact with was pleasant. We ate out so can't rate the restaurant in the hotel. The martini bar is right inside the front door and didn't seem to have too much business any of the nights we were there. If you use the valet parking be sure to call down at least 15 minutes before you want to leave. Cars are parked on another block and it can take that long for someone to run to the car and get back through traffic. Check that housekeeping left you enough coffee every day - they didn't always - we had to call for more twice. Our rooms weren't in bad shape - perhaps the renovations are working their way up as we were on the 5th and 3rd floors. But the room renovations aren't up to the standard I expected for a 4 star hotel. The finish - molding, wallpaper seams, caulking in the bathroom - was noticably un-finished. Bottom sheets on the beds didn't cover the ends of the mattress. My companion missed the trash can one night and was too tired to pick up his small piece of trash. It was still on the floor the next day when we returned to our room. Overall, we were very disappointed with the experience. We knew we were getting smallish rooms but the pictures we saw made them look bigger. If you absolutely have to stay in the north loop and are on a budget and are thin you might find a bargain here. Otherwise, look elsewhere for your 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: FargoLegalBeagle
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel room for 4 nights at this hotel through an online vendor. After booking the hotel room I contacted the hotel to request a room with 2 beds. I was told in 3 different conversations with hotel personnel that I would have a room with 2 double beds. When I arrived I was given a King sized bed and was told that there was nothing the hotel could do for myself and my 3 guests. Apparently the hotel management saw no problem with 4 people sleeping in 1 bed. The staff was completely unaccomodating. To add insult to injury we met other guests that had obtained a room with 2 beds by just walking in off the street the day after we checked in. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The customer service is well below what is acceptable. The location of the hotel is great but there are many other hotels that offer excellent service and high quality rooms to stay in while visiting Chicago. Bottom line is do NOT stay at the Millenium Knickerbocker!!!

Reviews.Title: “YUCK! 2 star motel is more like it!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTaa_Travel
Reviews.Content: It's a good thing my job payed for this stay. Let me just say how disgusted I was by this property. It was old and outdated, it smelled and it just looked plaine nasty...and that was the hallways. My room (1201 by the way) was a hell hole. The bathroom stunk something awful...like old musty attic mixed with Raid I had to keep the door closed because the smell was so nauseating. The sink was so small, the faucet was rusted the wallpaper was peeling the paint in the room and bathroom had been painted over at least 6 times. the only thing new was the shower door and shower head...to bad the shower head has about a 3 inch gap between it and the wall..can u say caulk. The bed was also scary after I Lisol disinfected it I still did not use the comforter I was afraid of what my have been on it. The light fixtures did not work and the furniture was old and chipped. I travel alot and this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I found myself looking out the window into the Hilton hotel rooms wishing I was there. DO NOT STAY HERE IT IS NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY...IT DEFINITELY DOES NOT DESERVE A 4 STAR RATING. *****WONT BE BOOKING WITH HOTWIRE I CANT BELIEVE THEY BOOKED ME AT SUCH A DISGUSTING PLACE AND CHARGED $128.65 PER NIGHT. UGGHH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: kdkorte
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to take our daughters to Chicago. I grew up there. The girls are 5 and 6 and wanted to go to the American Girl Store. It was only 4 blocks away. We walked all around downtown. This hotel had a great location. The price was great for the location. Somehow we got upgraded to the Superior Standard room and got a cot for the girls to share. It was great. The staff was friendly. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A place with charm”
Reviews.Author: peasncarrots
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent the weekend there Feb. 17-19,2007. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor after naming our own price on Priceline($85/night) and said what the heck, we'll make the best of it, sounded like a crap shoot.(besides our money was committed and we don't have alot). I was glad I had read the reviews here first to know what to expect. We were not disappointed at all. Fantastic location. Like almost everyone says, the staff is great! The decor is what you might expect from a 80 year old hotel to look like. People didn't travel with and need as much back then, so yes, the rooms are smaller. I found out you can upgrade to a larger room when you arrive, for a fee of course. We decided to stick to our original room. Like my wife said,"If everyone paid the going rate for room nights, the hotel would have alot more money to put into updates" but we had no issues. Our beds were very firm(more than we're used too) but in all it was a very pleasant stay. Go with a good attitude and you'll find the Knickerbocker a decent place to stay. Hope this helps if you find yourself staying there, and hey, with the money you saved, take your spouse to a wonderful dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Ick”
Reviews.Author: GGK
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a terrible experience. The room was very dirty and gross. Upon check in I found multiple hairs on the bed and IN the bed - yes, you know what kind of hair I'm referring to. The vents were so disgustingly dirty as was the carpeting and scuffed up wallpaper. The best was the most uncomfortable bed I've slept in for quite awhile. The staff was nice but the property needs a mega overhaul asap. I will say breakfast in the hotel (off the menu) was very pleasant and tasty. One can do much better in Chicago. I really hope the hotel reads these reviews and tries to step up soon to save this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Classic!”
Reviews.Author: ktassone
Reviews.Content: Classic Chicago Hotel, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: PeanutPusher
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get a "4 star" hotel off of Priceline for $70 - I was luckier that I got the Knickerbocker! From check in to check out the hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms are small but cozy. After reading the reviews from other guests I was somewhat scared of what I would find - they must have stayed at a different hotel. I am a very frequent traveler and felt that the rooms and the hotel met the "4 star" rating. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms were small, but what historic hotel in a big city isn't? The decor and quality met my expectations. The lobby and bar were very inviting. Overall, I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Short Of A 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Indy
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Knickerbocker via [--]. We've used Priceline several times before (always indicating that we want a "4-star" hotel). In all prior bookings, we've been very satisfied. Not so this time. The Millennium Knickerbocker is listed as a 4-star hotel by AAA, and has been for years. While some of the reviews below indicate a significantly poorer experience than was ours, I am astounded that this hotel would receive AAA's 4-star rating. It is simply inappropriate. The hotel is a historic facility, dating back to the Prohibition Era shennanigans in Chicago - allegedly the Knickerbocker hosted a number of famous gangsters back in the day. And you see the old-style charm of the place in some of it's external and internal details. The lobby is not a massive affair by modern standards, but was likely quite exceptional in its day. There is a nice bar to your right as you walk into the lobby, and a small but nicely appointed restaurant to the left. The registration desk and concierge desk are very small but are staffed by friendly and helpful people. In fact, the one thing that the Millennium Knickerbocker has going for it is the friendliness/helpfullness of its staff. We had many engaging conversations with staff during our 24 hour stay, and found them to be the saving grace during our stay there. However, the facilities and amenities are substandard by any interpretation - at least for a 4, or even 3 star rating. As mentioned by other reviews below, the rooms are small. But they also are in moderate to poor states of repair. Upon closer inspection, our floors and bed linens appeared to be clean - but the condition of the wall coverings, bed coverings, carpet, woodwork, and tile in the hallways and rooms makes you think that they are not clean. In our limited experience, they ARE clean - just in poor condition. The bed cover was snagged in many places and had a cigarette burn hole. The wall paper was not well applied, and seams were raised in many places. The desk chair was a faux velvet covered affair, and the material had many gouges and was very distressed appearing. The wood desk was also gouged in several places. The woodwork was painted, but appeared to be the last of MANY coats of paint - the finish was VERY lumpy/drippy/wavy. Once the bed cover was pulled off the bed, the bed linens seemed to be relatively new and clean. The bathroom was quite small. The tile was in poor condition, with the grout cracked and stained in many places. The joints where the tiled walls met the floor were in bad condition, with gaps in the grout and stains. This was NOT a room in which it was easy to be comfortable. The hallways were in the same state of repair (clean, but very worn looking). Unlike other reviewers, we detected no foul odors. The hotel is situated in a very convenient location for people wishing to explore the River North/Michigan/Rush St. areas in downtown Chicago. It is across the street from the Drake Hotel, and one block north of the Hancock Tower. And you might say that we shouldn't complain having paid only $69 for our room. However, we've paid that and much less for far nicer hotels, ones appropriately designated as 3 or 4 stars by the AAA., via Priceline and Hotwire. I would certainly have been very upset had I paid rack rate for this room. Also, internet access is quite expensive in my opinion ($13 per night); and there are no complimentary ethernet cables - if you don't travel with one, you must purchase one for $6 thru the mini-bar. Not an unheard-of practice in my experience, but not a pleasant one either. I'd steer clear of this hotel unless rooms are full in your preferred hotels in the area. It is adequate, in that it is clean and staffed by very helpful folks. But it will NOT be the sort of hotel experience you expect from a 3 or 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: sparklejoy2
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Knickerbocker for a conference. I have to admit i was worried about some of the reviews on here, but the hotel was fine. I will say that i dont understand why the hotel is 4 star either, and had it been money out of my own pocket, i might have choosen a different hotel. But overall i had an average hotel stay. Here's a breakdown of my experience Check in: due to a change in flight schedule i actually arrived at the hotel around 11AM. I had planned to just store my luggage and do some shopping, but they had a room ready early which was unexpected. Another unexpected was a 50 dollar per day hold placed on your credit card for charges to the mini bar and room service. I was able to get them to waive this for me, because i was traveling on a pre-paid business card and was unaware of this fee. The clerk entered me as a cash paying customer so that i couldnt make room charges, which was fine with me. I wish they would make you aware of this at check in... if you dont know about it ahead of time that can take a big chunk out of your travel budget!!!!!!!! Staff: Excellent, prompt service, very helpful! Location: Right across the street from the Drake, convient to lots of shopping and restaurants on the Mag Mile. However it is towards the end of the mile where a hotel in the middle of the mile might be more convient. Room: On the small side, but very clean and pleasent. Decorations were a bit on the girly side, but being a girl, i enjoyed them! The bed and pillows were extremely comfy. I had to refrain from taking the large pillow home with me! :) My room was close to the elevator, but this was not really a nusiance of any kind. There was one night when the noise outside was bothersome, but i guess that would be the case with any hotel in a larger city. Coffee maker and plenty of glasses provided. The only fridge is the mini bar, no where to keep leftovers. Bathroom: By far the smallest bathroom i have ever seen! The edge of the sink literally hung over the bathtub. And the tiny shelves provided no storage room. But the bathroom was very clean, no mold or mildew. I have seen several people post that they only had a shower, but the bathtub I had a was a deep garden tub and very nice. Water pressure for the shower was great with plenty of hot water. There was a hair dryer in the bathroom, but didnt work very well. The towels were a good size but very scratchy. For female travelers, i wouldnt plan on using the soap or shampoo provided by the hotel... they are very manly smelling. i found it funny that the rooms were all decorated girly and the toilitries provided were clearly for a man!

Reviews.Title: “Eeeewww and Yuck !”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: 4-star ??!? More like a 2-star hotel !!! Most websites list this as a 4-star hotel, and I cannot imagine why ...probably b/c it is so convenient to Magnificent Mile/Michigan Ave and John Hancock tower. The lobby is ok, but the room was horrible. On my way to the room, right off the elevator on the 12th floor (highest guestroom floor possible) walking in the hallway, there was a very distinctive smell of death-like musty-ness, accented by an oddly old, sour-y, onion-y odor that I could not imagine in a 4-star hotel or even a 2-star hotel ! It felt and smelled like a Senior-Citizens Nursing home (no offense to anyone!). The room was old, with outdated furniture...bathroom was tiny with the smallest sink I've ever seen. The bathroom felt like it was "wiped-down" clean vs spotless. The bedspread had all kinds of hairs on it. Gross !! I had to open the window to rid the room of smells I cannot describe, and it was 28 degrees outside !! Service was non-existent, with no friendliness by any of staff. Serious refurbishing needed !!! Book this hotel at your own peril !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Chicago50
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed here on December 26th. We had a corner suite for $159 on the 12th floor. The room itself was wonderful, nice and big, with plenty of room. The only knock on the room would be the bathroom which was tiny but functional. The concierge was extremely helpful getting us a reservation for dinner and the front desk staff was courteous and prompt. All in all, this hotel is really a gem. It is extremely affordable, in a great location about 50 yards off Michigan Ave. The next morning we ate breakfast at The Drake, across the street as a treat. I have recommended this hotel to friends from Ireland. and Switzerland . My friend and his wife stayed there in June, 2006. They loved it. When they returned to Chicago in November, 2006 and stayed at the Fairmont, there were actually disappointed because for the extra money they simply had a longer commute to the shopping areas. I would not hesitate to return to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “have no fear”
Reviews.Author: rmartens711
Reviews.Content: We had planned a trip to Chicago to see Michigan Avenue at Christmas time. We got a good deal on this hotel through priceline. I was very afraid to stay at this hotel after reading all the reviews. I was very glad to see that they were wrong. The staff was wonderful, got our bags out of the cab as soon as we pulled up. They were very helpful answering all of our questions during our stay. The hotel does have an older decor but they are trying to stay in the era of Al Capone, who used to come to the hotel to gamble. That thrilled my 10 year old since she had just learned about Al Capone in school. The location is great, just around the corner from Louis Vuitton. We were able to walk everywhere. If I did have any complaints about the hotel it would be the glass door on the shower, not really practical with a 10 year old. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel: Very Distinctive”
Reviews.Author: gduffy10
Reviews.Content: Well, we got the Knickerbocker at a bargain price but i would have paid the full price it was that nice. It was really distictive with lovely features throughout unlike all those cookie-cutter hotels. Staff were lovely and helpful. The Martini bar has a lovely atmosphere and the Crystal Ballroom is outstanding! Expensive though...$12 for a Martini!! The restaraunt in the hotel looked nice but was shockingly expensive for rather standard food. It's right on the corner of Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile) and only a stones throw away from Bloomingdales, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Max Mara...endless! No Views to mention though, but what can you expect in an innercity hotel. Only problem we had was when we called the front desk to ask if there would be any charges for using a prepaid phone card to call the UK from the hotel room. They said No, but the sad truth was that there was. $1.25 everytime you call out, even when using a card. Little shock as we were checking out but other than that, it's a great hotel in a FAB location, close to everything you could want. I would pay the full price for this hotel but if you can get it cheaper, really makes you feel like you got a Great Bargain! =)

Reviews.Title: “Odd, but Fine and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JudsonFamily
Reviews.Content: The Knickerbocker has received its share of negative reviews. Maybe the management has taken some of the suggestions. I came here with my husband and two children right before Christmas. We booked the hotel through Priceline, as we always do. Chicago has so many 4 star hotels and we like the excitement of getting the best deal and exploring the different types of rooms around the city. We have been to Chicago countless times and stayed at most of the hotels 3 stars and above. So, background info accepted, the Knickerbocker wasn't that bad. I'd describe the room decor as ornate, yet cheap and dated. Would NEVER consider this a 4 star establishment, but it was fine. The staff was warm and attentive. The location is SOOOO GOOD! And, it was a good deal through priceline. Beware of the lift doors, they shut very quickly! Eat at the FoodLife Restaurant(s) in the basement of the Watertower shopping complex (only two blocks away and open at 7:30 am)!! Very cool!

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: dalangdon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights before Christmas. Honestly, I don't understand the bad reviews - other than they may be people who are not used to staying in big city hotels. The Knickerbocker is in a fine location. The rooms are nicely maintained, they tend to be small, but only bores spend all their time in a hotel when in an exciting city like Chicago. Don't let the rubes scare you off. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to be scared of, it was great!”
Reviews.Author: AZDesertFlower
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Millennium Knickerbocker on December 26th. We booked the room in the summer through Hotwire for $73/night. Then we read the reviews on this site and were very regretful of our decision. But there was nothing to be afraid of as it was a great hotel in a fantastic location! The hotel is located right around the corner from the Hancock Building, Bloomingdales and the Magnificent Mile shopping area, a couple of blocks from Rush Street and from Lake Michigan. Having never been to Chicago we found it a bit tricky getting to the hotel as it's on a one way street. There is a parking garage just across the street from the hotel for $25/day. We parked the car and walked everywhere. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and willing to hail us a cab, give us directions, suggest places to eat. Because we wanted to see as many sites as possible, we ordered room service for both dinner and breakfast. The food was good and delivered exactly when they said it would be delivered. On our next trip will hit some of the fabulous eating joints in Chicago. The room we had was nice and clean. It had a huge king bed that was very comfortable, but check your pillow before you go to bed. Some are very hard and some are very soft, and all filled with down/feathers. Yes, the walls are a bit thin as I was woken up in the middle of the night by people in the hall. Our room had TWO bathrooms, and they were also clean with no sign of mildew. My only complaint is that the shower stall only (no, tub) leaked at the bottom and there was a huge puddle when I got out. So if you are lucky enough to get two bathrooms, take a shower in the bathroom that has a tub/shower combo with shower curtain. Overall, when we go back to Chicago this summer we will be staying at the Knickerbocker - if we can get it for $73 a night again. For the price, it was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's just fine”
Reviews.Author: lam44
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year for a conference. The customer service was great and I felt very safe. The thin walls and small bathroom didn't bother me because I knew it was an old hotel, but they really need to renovate the rooms. I couldn't see any detail on the molding because it had been painted over so many times. The bathroom grout looked dingy even though I'm sure housekeeping had scrubbed it as best they can. The location = fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: MPLSDavid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Thanksgiving holiday. The location is "magnificent" on the north end of Michigan Ave, near the lake and gold coast area. The public areas of the hotel give off the impression of a grand, old hotel. The service is spotty. One front desk clerk was fabulous, the other was indifferent and borderline rude. The concierge was wonderful. The waiter in the restaurant was uninformed about the menu, and didn't offer to find out when asked (we had to request he ask what was in several different dishes). The room was small, but cozy. Both the room and bathroom were very clean and the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately, however, the rooms are extremely noisy. The walls are paper thin and you can hear conversations in the next room. In fact, maintenance was next door while my partner was in the bathroom clearing his throat and they had the nerve to ask him, through the walls, if he was alright in there! Pipes make noise and the windows have no insulation so they are drafty and you can clearly hear all street noise. All of this could be bearable if they actually provided some background noise to drown it out - but no such luck as you are unable to control the fan level in the room. I would not choose to stay at this hotel again due to the noise issues (I slept terribly), but would not be disappointed if I ended up here through one of the "bidding" websites.

Reviews.Title: “Never fear”
Reviews.Author: Kapulanikai
Reviews.Content: Yes the room is small and the staff is still in diapers learning the hotelcraft but for the price you simply can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “No great shakes in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: judyvla
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire, where we got a good price--$95 total, plus a crushing 40 for parking. The room was smallish and dingyish but OK. I was impressed (negatively) with the pushbutton-access minibar--a first in my experience. In sum, the location is great, but I wouldn't pay the listed rates.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: Nick_biz_traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in was without issue and prompt. The room was small but clean. This property was VERY noisy, especially during the early morning hours (4am -on) as people woke up to shower. The water pipes were constantly "singing" loud enough to wake me up and keep me up the rest of the morning. Thin walls for sound. The bathroom was very small but nice. Wireless internet was terrible. There is a nice bar in the lobby, and the location is great, but for the money, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: purple17
Reviews.Content: The service was very good. Room small but not unbearable. Actually the maid did a good job. Room was clean. Close to everything. Would not stay there again. There was a horrible odor in the room the last day of our stay. Would stay elsewhere. Not a four star property.

Reviews.Title: “a nightmare trip”
Reviews.Author: Jzaj
Reviews.Content: I realize that an old hotel will have its issues, but this was ridiculous. The rooms were tiny, and the air stale. The air had been turned off for the winter, and the only way to get fresh air was to open the window.....we were on the fourth floor and have a toddler. Not a safe Idea. The tile in the bathroom was dirty and there was black mold everywere. The corners of the room were dusty and the paint was peeling off of the wood work. The staff was rude and the bellman hung around untill we were forced to give a tip for incredibly substandered service. It took 30 minutes for them to get our car pulled around. I would Never stay here again. The hotel is listed as a 4 diamond, but the 2005 and 2006 awards were missing from the wall????? My husband and I travel quite a bit, and this hotel is not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelFreqently
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great area - right off Michigan Ave. The people were very helpful and friendly. Although the room was relatively small, it was a normal size for a hotel room in a large city. Overall, the hotel was nice, room was clean and all the services were great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ostrich
Reviews.Content: We were offered this hotel when booking our flights with Travelbag. The cost for three nights over and above buying flights only was only Â£60 - how could we go wrong. However, then we read the reviews here and elsewhere and started to worry .... We needn't have. Yes, rooms are not large - but not tiny and hey, you are only staying a few nights, not buying the place. Bathroom very tiny but clean and with all facilities. Air con worked well - good as it was cloudy but very warm and humid. Room was clean and no funny smells. We are quite sensitive to tobacco smoke but didn't notice any in the reception hall at any time. All staff pleasant and helpful. Didn't eat at the hotel as it was a bit pricey compared to other places. Our only gripe with the hotel - and it is a teeny one, was the gift shop (I think independently run) where there were no prices displayed. My husband selected three postcards and they wanted $3 - when they were around 35cents each elsewhere this was over the top. Recommendations in Chicago? L'appetito at the bottom of the Hancock Tower for breakfast and also good lunches. The Bean in Millennium Park for an interesting sculpture. Hancock Tower bar has good bar menu and great to watch the sun go down and all the lights come on - must be as good a view as the top floor and you don't pay admission! Use the Ladies loo on this floor (girl's only of course) and see the most amazing view from a loo ever. Potbellies near the Sear's Tower is good for lunch (closed Saturdays). Free trolley bus rides around the city are good - but make sure you get on the free ones as some charge. Navy Pier great and the lake beautiful. Airport shuttle not as good as other cities - pricier than a taxi for more than one. Taxi was around $35 each way.

Reviews.Title: “yuck”
Reviews.Author: jk4837
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute through Priceline... all I can say is YUCK. This hotel is NOT worthy of a four star rating. The rooms are old and cramped. The bathrooms are DATED and dirty - the shower door almost fell in on me as I tried to close it. The vent in the ceiling dripped dirty water all night and we woke up to a soggy carpet. The housekeeping staff told us the hotel was updating again this year (not sure when the last time they updated, but is doesn't look like much has been done lately). The updates will include flat screen TV's in all the rooms - the least of their problems is replacing televisions! Understood that this was a historic hotel, but please, drop the rating to a 2 star until major renovations are complete. Rude staff, smoky rooms, not even a coffee pot... The only thing this hotel had going for it was the location. Parking was advertised as $25 but we were charged $38. The Omni, Intercontinental, Sheraton, Hilton - all much niced for the same amount of $$ and they have a pool, too. Save your $$ and go elsewhere. YUCK.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, but Big-City Glamor Nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: dodgerdog1
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel straight from a 19-hour train ride from new York, so I was eager to check in, put my bags away, and get on with my Chicago vacation. Even though I arrived two hours before checkin, but the front desk was very good about letting us store our bags and then did what they could to allow us in the room early. Happily, it only took a half hour and we defiantly appreciated that. Heading up to the room I was afraid of the size and smell as I had read several reviews commenting that the rooms were tiny & smelled of smoke. Both were essentially true (especially the tiny part), but I really canâ€™t complian. I had booked the hotel hoping to be in a nice part of town and in an old, glamorous hotel, and for the price, I think the Millineum delivered. Quick hint: be sure to check out the ballroom. My wife loved the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AllyKat72
Reviews.Content: I must admit, before arriving to this hotel I was worried about some of the reviews. However, much too my delight, the hotel was perfect for us. My husband and I loved the location. We were within mintues of walking to our favorite restaurants and bars. And of course, shopping! I really can not complain about our room, since we paid ONLY $79 (plus taxes) a night. Thank you Priceline. I will also add, that I did check the bed for beds, and of course, there were none. Ha! The carpet, and cellings were quite in need of repair, but the hotel is old, so it just made the feeling a bit more historic. The staff was friendly and the bartender made an awesome dirty martini for me:) I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location, Not worthy of 4 star rating”
Reviews.Content: I had read many negative reviews and was braced for the worst. Luckily I came away from my stay feeling that if I had the opportunity and at a good price I would definitely stay again. The location is great. Around the corner from Louis Vuitton and is right off Michigan Avenue. The hotel building has a charming Martini bar with a very nice bartender who was eager to help with the area. The check in staff was very professional and cheerful. Hal checked us in immediately without making us wait at all. Rooms are a bit on the shabby side. Bathroom has only a tiny shower no tub and is so tiny. Room itself was very clean but needs some TLC. My bedspread had a couple of cigarette burn holes. Carpet, furniture, and other parts of the room had a very well worn look. Housekeeping friendly and room was very clean. If you can get a good price feel competent that you will be okay. Seems like a 3 star hotel and can't understand the 4 star rating. Liked the historic feel of the hotel. Bell staff was extremely helpful and friendly. No bugs like previously posted. Location, location, location. This place was fine and didn't complain to staff. The Ritz Carlton this place is not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... not sure about the 4-star rating though.”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: This is a "historic" hotel. It is in a great location and is somewhat charming. The room was in pretty good condition and had some neat accents. There were plenty of signs of the hotel's age though (tiny bathroom, slow draining bath tub, faded carpet, lots of repair signs). The staff was friendly and helpful, but the $39/night to valet park (no self parking) seemed pretty high. Would stay again for the right price (e.g. Priceline or Hotwire) based on location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel -- Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: geoheim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MK with my wife and teenage son for 3 nights August 20 -23, 2006 and must say we experienced none of the problems mentioned in earlier negative reviews. We called ahead and requested a room with 2 beds which was ready even though we arrived at 1 pm. That was the start of some extremely courteous and efficient service we received from every member of the hotel staff. The room itself was a decent size -- we never felt crowded in it -- and was very clean and tastefully decorated. The beds were comfortable, climate controls worked well and water pressure in the shower was very good. The only negative was our bathroom was extremely small -- you felt cramped even with one person in it. Otherwise we thought the rest of the hotel was in very good condition considering its age. The lobby area was nice and the Martini Bar and adjoining lounge area were very pleasant places to relax and enjoy a drink. Plus the location is just great -- a short walk to the Oak Street Beach, Water Tower Place, Rush Street and dozens of bars, restaurants and shops. We paid $100 on Priceline and thought that was a great value. We have been to Chicago on several occasions but our stay at the Millenium Knickerbocker made this one an especially pleasant trip. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dawns206
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is one of the best that I have stayed in. The lobby was beautiful and the room was nice and comfortable. The made services was terrific. No matter what time we left the room it was made up when we came back. I asked the maid for a couple of extras and she was very nice and friendly. That is what I liked about the hotel the staff was so nice and friendly. I was there with my daughter for a girl's weekend from Thursday - Sunday. Everyone from the doorman to the concierge to the people at the desk etc. was wonderful. I can't say enough good about this hotel. Yes the bathroom was small, but I wasn't moving into the room. I was just staying there a few days and was hardly in the room anyway. I will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “"Average" hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: smmtst
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the MK on Aug. 11-13. We arrived before 3pm and our room was available immediately. The decor and condition of the rooms is dated with lots and wear and tear but no obvious dirt, odor, and I'm happy to say, no bedbugs!. I had booked this hotel in April and as I rely heavily on Tripadvisor information to make many travel choices was worried because the latest reviews for this hotel have been bad, very bad. I went so far as to book another hotel and cancelled it at the last minute b/c the location of the MK appeared to be great. So, I hoped for the best and did make a good choice in terms of location. I liked the size of the hotel...........it has a cozy feel and nice bar. The staff members were friendly and helpful. Now the big question I always ask myself when trying to evaluate a hotel.....would I stay there again? I wouldn't reply with a resounding, NO. This was my first trip to Chicago and I don't consider the stay a mistake. But I saw other hotels in prime locations that I would like to try.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not worthy of 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: bomborivera
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Knickerbocker. Happened to go on one of the busiest weekends of the summer. Tall Ships, Lolapolluza, Art Festival, Cubs and White Sox all going on. The room we stayed in was clean and nice. The only downfall is the fact that we had to sleep in a Murphy bed. No 4 star hotel should have a murphy bed. Beyond that, the staff was very helpfull and made the stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE Believe what you read!!!! and Don't let the bed bugs bite!!!”
Reviews.Author: sgino
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at this Hotel (Aug 11-13). Positive- Location and Employees Negative- Believe what you've read in other reviews. I spend approx 150 nights in various hotels around the world traveling on business. From large metropolitan cities with numerous hotel choices to very small towns with only a couple of options. This is the first time I've actually reviewed a property. Without hesitation this is the worst hotel room I've ever stayed. Room was dirty and worn out. We could actually feel the springs from the mattress jabbing us in the back-impossible to sleep. The tops of my 11 month old's socks were actually black from crawling around on the carpet. When we arrived we noticed used soap and shampoo in the shower and various sections of a 3 day old newspaper were spread around the room. I expressed my concerns regarding the room however they were "fully committed" so there were no other rooms available. Don't be fooled, this is not a 4 star hotel. My next letter is going to AAA who supposedly rated this hotel 4 stars. One more thing, MAKE SURE YOU WEAR LONG PJ'S- THE BED BUGS ARE HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: kikiana
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. The hotel itself is not a 4 star like they say - in my opinion. The room decor is horrible (probably more European than I am used to) and the room is small and furnished like an old apartment. On the upside, if you want to stay in a great location, feel safe, and can put up with some aesthetic issues and can get a great deal then this will work. I prefer Westin or Marriott...something that you can count on.

Reviews.Title: “Cooler outside the hotel than inside!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyjil
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, I did read the reviews, and I was concerned. I ended up booking it based on my sisters recommendation. BIG MISTAKE!! The temperature in Chicago was a balmy 99 degrees, and the temp in the room that they gave us was about 85 degrees. When we called to complain at 11:00 am, they told us to turn the temp down to 40degrees. We went back at 7:30pm. it was still humid, the beds were moist & the room very stuffy. Called again, they sent somone to fix it, & he recommended getting a new room, because the room will not cool down. They told us they were booked, yet, after the maintenance man called, they suddenly had a room available, go figure? So they move us to another room, guess what, it is 85 degrees. Again, they told us to turn it down to 40, needless to say, it never cooled down & we should have just slept on the street. We travel a lot, and we stayed here one night, and it was awful!!. At check out, I had to re-tell our entire room issue, they actually ended up not charging us for the night, thank god they did not offer us anothers nights stay, because we would never go back. Also, the room decor is very old and stuffy. If your going to Chicago, don't stay at the Millenium Knickerbocker!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and average”
Reviews.Author: PalmettoBug
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at the Milennium Knickerbocker until attending a conference this month. The conference hotel was overbooked, so the Milennium Knickerbocker became an expensive alternative. Was it worth it for the money? Not even on an expense account -- but it was convenient at the north end of Michigan Avenue (directly across from The Drake). Everything about the hotel seemed to fall under the simple category: overpriced and average. I had a corner room, which was slightly nicer than my co-worker's mid-hall room. The two windows in the corner room let in ample light (to better view the garish decorating scheme) but there was no real "view" from the room. The bathroom was small with a shower only (no tub), which was okay for me. The sink was the tiniest I have ever seen, making shaving an adventure. But it was clean enough. Aside from the TV, the perks stopped there. High-speed (in name perhaps) internet access was $10 per 24 hour period and the mini-fridge was stocked with exorbitantly priced snacks. You're better off picking up drinks at the Walgreen's on Michigan Ave. The ice machine on my floor was broken for the length of my stay. I didn't have enough interaction with the staff to offer any commentary, but check in and check out were painless enough. Given the price of Chicago's downtown hotels, the Milennium Knickerbocker will continue to charge what the market will bear. I think it says something, however, that they were one of the few hotels that had rooms when nearly all others were booked. Until it undergoes a much needed renovation, the hotel will remain... overpriced and average

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell198
Reviews.Content: I was at the Knickerbocker in July, 2006 for a Business Meeting. The Knickerbocker staff was very friendly, and helpful. I had a minor problem with my room and the front desk moved me very quickly. The rooms are small compared to other hotels I have stayed in. The bathroom was VERY small, only one person at a time could enter the bathroom. The location was great, in walking distance to shopping and dining. The Knickerbocker is in need of some renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Knickerbocker is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: palmsprings0
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what is the best hotel I have visited recently, but I am clear on the worst. The Knickerbocker is a dump! Whoever gave this 4 diamonds should be shot!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs...Beware”
Reviews.Author: DebleeSydney
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately stayed for 3 nights at the Knickerbocker Hotel ...I should have checked out on day 1. The bathrooms were filthy dirty with tangled hairs on the floor behind the door and after a few nights of scratching and the feeling of skin crawling...I pulled the bed away from the bedhead and watched as little rice sized brown bugs scurried over the white sheets...bed bugs! Which I might add the hotel are saying are flying insects from the windows being left open from when the window cleaners were there (fortunately I took photos to the contrary) Finding the bed bugs...I looked at the mattress protector and pillows and found long hairs on both...I was disgusted at the hygeine and would never stay again at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Slow, outdated, but convenient!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Elevators were slow as molasses. Literally took the stairs from the fourth floor b/c they were so slow. The room was small and furnished in an antique-y way. There were two windows, but one was blocked off. No view. The bathroom could use some updating - some of the tiling was a little crumbly and grimy. Hotel did have an old world Chicago feel and was inexpensive for its location ($149/night). It was right along Michigan Ave and 10 minutes to the lake, fancy boutiques, and a 5 min cab ride to the Historical Society or Art Institute. Bar closed too early and service was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: MHF2781
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel. From the very beginning we had problems with this Hotel. The check in process is the most unorganized process I have ever seen. We tried to check in at 3pm (as this is the check in time) only to be told that our room was not ready and they didn't know when it would be ready. We had to wait another 2 hours before we could get to our room. The front desk clerk just asked for a credit card and began charging the room without ever telling us how much it woud be. The room was an okay size for double beds however the room just felt dirty. The beds have these horrible curtains and mirrors over them that seem like they are going to fall on your head while you are asleep. The bathroom is an ok size but beware if you are looking for a tub or for a clean bathroom for that matter. There is only a shower and a drain in the middle of the floor. The water is suppsed to drain but the floor is not slanted enough so the water just sits there in a nice little puddle. The floors were never mopped our entire stay and had this black tint to them as if mold were growing. I suggest you bring shower shoes. Not only did the floors never get mopped but we had an empty roll of toilet paper for two days ( there was another roll, but you would think that the housekeeper would replace the empty roll). They also only change the sheets in the bed every 3 days or when ever you leave if less than 3 days. The only nice thing about this hotel is the location. You are almost right on Michigan Ave with all the shops, but if you can stay somewhere else I would suggest you do that. This hotel is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: VERY small rooms - ugly decor. The bathrooms are so small that you can barely shut the door! Room service was horrible. Look elsewhere! (I found this hotel via Hotwire[--] and it was rated a 4-star. Yeah, right.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location/very small rooms with minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Kim-and-Chip
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Very small rooms. Sliding bathroom door did not budge, we had to leave it open. Got stuck in smoking room but hey, we did reserve through Priceline. Great fun in the martini bar in the lobby/lounge (lobby is quite small as lobbys go). Tons of martinis and live music - guitar and piano player. Martinis are $12- $15 each but they are big glasses and the fill them up to the rim. The big, heavy windows block out almost all of the street noise. If you want to hear the city noise, you can open up the window, which we did not. The fan in the room did also help with hallway noise, which was minimal. The bed was very comfortable, as were the pillows. No hair dryer in the room, though. They probably had one at the front desk, but I didn't ask. I did wake up and realize that I left my toothbrush and toothpaste at home, so I went downstairs to a tiny, tiny store they have in the lobby and got a toothbrush and a travel size toothpaste and it was $9.77 for the both. Hello Chicago. One tip- if you're going to want to go see a show, don't waste your money on "Blue Man Group". That had to be the dumbest thing we ever dropped $60 per person on. Unreal. Have fun in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Glitches”
Reviews.Author: lawyerbob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a weekend stay in what was advertised as a Superior room. We booked through AAA for $179 a night, and at that price we would not complain much about the hotel quality we encountered. On the plus side, the hotel is in an excellent location at the northern end of the MM, just across from the Drake. The staff is very courteous and helpful, the piano bar in the lobby-bar is a nice touch, the room was quiet, the bed firm, and the shower hot. On the downside, the room was very small, and even with just the two of of and two carry-ons we were stumbling over each other. The bathroom was even tinier--the smallest that I have ever encountered in a hotel. I measured the floor area of the bathroom (minus the tub area) and it was 4x5, barely large enough for one person when you take into account the space occupied by the sink and toilet. The hotel is a bit worn in that one of our outlets did not work, the room had no room-darkening shade on the window, and the hair dryer was barely powerful enough for my wife to dry her hair. The hotel was a good value for the money, but be aware of what you are getting or not getting for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Knickerbocker the middle of May, 2006. We had never been to Chicago before and wasn't sure where to stay. We loved our stay. Everyone at the hotel was great. They gave us directions, maps, etc. Very easy to get around in Chicago. The hotel is very friendly located. We could walk everywhere we wanted to go. Rode the red line to a ball game, easy directions. The hotel was very clean. Bathroom was small, nice size shower only, no tub, however I would prefer shower in a hotel. There were four of us and there was plenty of space in the room, although we were not in the room that much. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome servce/Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a taste of â€œOld Chicagoâ€� this is the place for you. Although, they do not have the â€œnewestâ€� or â€œhippestâ€� renovations, the old-time charm of this hotel was very welcoming. My husband and I planned a nice little weekend trip to go see the King Tut exhibit at The Field Museum, as well as taking advantage of all of the other wonderful events that Chicago has to offer, and the concierge was aware of every possible event that was going on in the cityâ€¦not only that, but he would get reservations right then and there, if so we chose it!! I happened to get a great deal on this room, $72/night, in factâ€¦and I wouldnâ€™t trade my experience for another hotel for anything =) Defiantly a must.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: IcePrincess1972
Reviews.Content: Well, I admit I was a little nervous about staying here after reading some reviews on this site. I have to tell you, honestly, this is not the Hilton. I travel to Chicago 6-8 times a year for work and I've had the luxury of trying out many of Chicago's finest. First off, I checked in around 9pm. The doorman pretty much tripped over himself to open the door for me. As he was opening it, the bellman was right there welcoming me to the Knickerbocker and to take my luggage. He swept me over to the check-in desk and stayed neaby until I was finished. The woman at the check-in desk was so helpful and cheerful. It wouldn't surprise me if she owns the Hotel the way she was so willing to help and make my stay as enjoyable as possible. After a quick check-in and being taken to my room, the bellman went in first and turned on every light, showed me the mini-bar, TV, and made sure nothing was missing or what I didn't want. I stayed in room 316, smoking, king with a tub. I did request a tub at checkin and was told the hotel is looking to do away with all tubs in the next remodel. The front desk said if I find there isn't a tub in my room to call and they will put me in a room that had one. Decor of the room is a little dated, but comfortable. I personally like the canopy over the bed, but not the old mirror - maybe if it was newer or clear. Keep in mind this hotel was not built last year, but it's still charming. No problems with the bed. I have a really bad back, and most of the time I'm waking up in pain when staying in hotels, but not here. I have bad allergies to mold, but I'm not having problems here. I always bring a candle when I travel, I smoke, and the room did have a musty smoke odor. I can see a bit of the lake through the Drake. Didn't hear anyone next door, you will hear doors slamming from other guests, but again, you have that in most hotels. Bottom line, this may not be the most up to date hotel, but the service I got more than makes up for it. The people here really make this hotel what it is. Some of the reviews make it seem like this is a hotel you'd find in a third world country - it's not that bad. Could use some updating to the decor, but other than that, I don't remember ever getting such amazing service from the staff at any other hotel. There's a big difference between the staff doing their job for a paycheck, and those who really enjoy what they do and care about the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Nice Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place when I was taking the bar examination. Clean and comfortable room. It is a great location down by the Watertower and right across from the Drake. It has a pretty good value for being right in the middle of the summer time. The place was quiet at night. The room service was excellent. Overall it is a pretty good value for putting you right in the middle of Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Knickerbocker. Our room was clean and quiet -- though a bit small. The staff we encountered were all very friendly and accommodating. Best thing about this hotel is the location - right next door to the John Hancock building and just steps away from fantastic Magnificent Mile shopping. For breakfast and snacks, try L'Appetito (on the ground floor level of the John Hancock building). Great lattes and baked goods and breakfast panini sandwiches for $2.75!! While in Chicago, be sure to check out the "bean" sculpture in Millennium Park. The city skyline reflects back in the silver surface of the bean and it is really a beautiful sight. I just loved to see the smiles on the faces of the visitor's as they walked closer to the bean.

Reviews.Title: “Aging hotel in great location with nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaDoll
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hard to rate and really merits a 2 1/2 instead of a 2. Excellent staff, excellent location, excellent bed. We paid just over $80 on Priceline and didn't feel ripped off. After all, it's a well-located hotel in a big city. Still, the wallpaper was stained and peeling, and the carpet had that old, slick feel. We had a nice view of the lake. I'd like to say that I wouldn't stay here again, but for the price we paid, I probably would. If this place were renovated, it would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Staff saves the day”
Reviews.Author: spackler43
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Not a 4 star. This hotel is very very old and is in need of a major update. The rooms are very small, but I knew that going in (I didn't think they would be as small as they were). The non-smoking room smelled like smoke and the carpet was old, the snack dispenser was inoperable and there was no view. No high speed internet was available and the parking fee was an overpriced $39.00 per night. The staff made this hotel. Very friendly front desk staff, the concierge recomended a perfect place for a great steak, and the bar staff were energenic and fun to talk with. This hotel is overpriced and needs some work, but the people saved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but a few problems...”
Reviews.Author: Ooblek
Reviews.Content: I just returned today from a stay at the Knickerbocker in Chicago. As everyone else has stated, the location is great. I got this hotel through Priceline at a pretty resonable rate, and was impressed when I first walked into the lobby. It was very nicely decorated, and not at all smokey like some reviewers have stated. However...since I arrived early, my room was not ready. So the bellhop checked my bags, and the girl behind the counter said she had "pre-registered" me. This meant I could go off to the convention I was in town for, and when I got back, there would be no paperwork to do. I could just get my keys and go with no problem. So, later that night I came back and the new girl behind the desk had no record of my pre-registration. Apparently, the first girl had not done what she'd said she had. As a result, there was absolutely no rooms available in the hotel. Someone from the back office came out and explained the situation. He was very nice and apologetic. They gave me cab fare for 2 days, and sent me over to the Whitehall. (which was FABULOUS by the way!) The hotel covered all our bills which was cool since the suite they put us in at the Whitehall was 3 times the price of our Priceline room. Anyway, the next day we came back. The manager was there. He apologized all over the place, did some major groveling, and gave us an upgraded room. After we were all checked in we received a phone call from the concierge making sure everything was ok and acceptable. They even sent up an apology note to us that night. The room itself was nicely decorated, but a bit worn. It wasn't horrible. The only gripe I had was that our toilet wouldn't flush! We asked to have it fixed, and were told it had been while we were out for the day, but it wasn't. Big inconvenience, and kind of gross. In general though it was a decent place, the staff was very accommodating and nice to us except for the front desk girl on the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, but the room doesn't merit the price”
Reviews.Author: ferringer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Knickerbocker in Chicago; we were there to celebrate my birthday. We were there for a Friday & Saturday night stay. First of all, call the hotel for directions, we used Google Maps and were hopelessly stuck on Lake Shore Dr. in rush hour traffic trying to decipher them until we called the hotel. The pros: the staff was excellent. The concierges were all helpful and informative. They made dinner reservations for us on Friday night, and provided good estimates for travel time and directions for walking destinations. The maids respected our "Do Not Disturb" requests, and did a mostly good job of cleaning the room. The cons: our room was over $300, which would have been fine if we had received the room that was advertised. The room we booked advertised a lakefront-view, DVD player, refrigerator, & garden tub. The room we received had no DVD player, a computerized mini-bar refrigerator we had no way to use, a standard size tub, and the view from our window showed us a small sliver of Lake Michigan. The decor was so-so (we had four lamps in the room, none of them matched), and our shower curtain had a lot of mold on it. Overall, I wasn't bothered enough by the bad to complain, but I wasn't at all impressed enough by the good to stay here again the next time we visit Chicago's Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Grea, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierboy2
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel recently, and found it to be quite adequate. No, it isn't the Hyatt or the Westin, and it isn't priced like the Hyatt or Westin either. I paid $149/night for a Queen Executive, which meant I had a queen bed and a sitting area (Room 717 to be exact). The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and it was quiet and dark (which translated into a restful night's sleep). Yes, the bathroom is quite small, but it was clean and dry -- no musty odors like people have described -- and it was stocked with nice amenities (bathrobe, bath gel, shampoo, loofah, etc). That said, it is an old hotel that hasn't received a full rehab recently. The fitness center was also adequate. But the location can't be beat. The hotel is at Walton and Michigan Ave. (roughly), across from the Drake, on the north end of the Magnificent Mile. 900 N. Michigan Ave and all of its shops is right there, the John Hancock bldg is almost right next door (There's a Cheesecake Factory at John Hancock), and Water Tower Place is also nearby -- a 5 min. walk. If you have friends in Wriglyville or Lincoln Park, it's a quick cab ride. For the price, you can't beat the Knickerbocker's location. I have stayed at some of the finest hotels around the world, and definitely would stay at the Knockerbocker again because of its value. If you're like me, and are in the room only to sleep and shower, then the K is awesome. Beware, though, of the valet parking. My case to my sunglasses ended up missing, and my car stereo had been adjusted. Though the car park company promised to reimburse me one night's parking fee ($39), remove everything before you let them park your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: dindelray
Reviews.Content: I stayed here many years ago and had a HUGE room with 1 and 1/2 bathrooms. Thought we would take a chance and stay again, even though the reviews have been mixed. We stayed in a suite...very nice, but small. The bath was so tiny that it was hard for one person to move around! I loved the room decor and the bed was comfy. Housekeeping was lax....one day it was after 3 before our room was cleaned---although room was properly cleaned. I do not like that the lobby only has seating in the bar area...thank goodness it wasn't too smokey. I enjoyed my stay...can't beat the location. Great hotel if you do not plan to spend much time there!

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites”
Reviews.Author: neuf150
Reviews.Content: We come to Chicago almost every year for music, food, shopping and a stay in the big city. The Knickerbocker is one of our favorite places. Excellent location, great staff,nice furnishings. The room was on the small side (as was the elevator) but the accomodations were first rate!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in almost every way!”
Reviews.Author: pkt63
Reviews.Content: I am pretty picky about my hotels and although the cliche about only needing to sleep in them is apt, I have always had high expectations of hotels and wanted the utmost in cleanliness and comfort. The Knickerbocker met my expectations, especially after having read the reviews here. I thought the entire hotel looked very nice. We used a lot of the space because we were attending a wedding there and every room and venue we used was just right. We didn't spend much time in the lobby, but it seemd nice and pretty and did not have an overwhelming smoky odor. And I'm from California, so I'm sensitive to that! The rooms were great. Not large, but bigger than others I've had in Chicago and nicely decorated. Not worn or frayed at all. The mini fridge even had a tiny cubby that I could have put a small snadwich or drink in, had I wanted. The bathroom was smallish, the shower being just a tad too narrow for perfect comfort, but other wedding guests said they had bathrooms as big as the entire room, so I guess ti depends. We may not have gotten lucky, but it still wasn't a problem at all. The staff was friendly and efficient, the concierge was eager to be helpful, and I think the banquet staff was wonderful. As a guest, I am sure the wedding party was very pleased with the event the Knickerbocker pulled together for them. I really would have given 4.5 stars if possible, because I have two small nitpicks. The terrycloth robes were not in our room, although the website, I believe, says each room has some. By the time I realized they weren't there, I was already out of the shower, so I didn't bother following up on it. Also, the bath products they provide aren't the greatest. The hair products, soap and lotion all smell like Drakkar Noir, so I was not happy to end up smelling like a man from the early 90s! So, that's pretty picky! This is a comfortable, friendly, clean hotel central to Chicago action and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the service to be really lacking and ignorant at the Knicerbock. Our room was to be paid by another indiviudal and both staffers at the desk gave us a hard time about this. Waited FOREVER our luggage to be released by the bell staff and another 20 minutes for our valet to come back with the car. Talk about leaving a bad taste in our mouth. I agree that the decor is so old, I also found it to be dark and dreary. It certainly did not feel clean to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suburbanite05
Reviews.Content: The hotel/building has been around since the 1920's. So yes, the rooms are a little on the small side. We stayed for one night, a Friday, Jan. 6. We booked through travelzoo, for a special of $89.00/night - total at checkout with taxes = $102.71. We checked in at 16:00, after shopping on Michigan Avenue. We had a king-size bed. The room was about 14ftx17ft. There is a small canopy hanging over the head of the bed and a mirror hanging on the wall. A small refridgerator filled with sodapop, beer(approx.$4.50), and candy(approx.$2.00) is available in the room for purchase (I think it is added to your hotel bill) - there is no room in it to store any food/drink items. There is a tv housed in the armoire. As stated in other reviews, the rooms are a little on the small side, but we were out most of the time after we checked in. The design/wallpaper on one wall/canopy does seem a little outdated to me. But hey, who cares. I can see where they remodeled/updated because some areas of the floor board do not meet with the carpet, there are some gaps. And the ceiling is finshed with that popcorn spray - popcorn ceiling. We had a king-size bed. There is no tub, only a shower. The room and bathroom/WC was clean at checkin. There is a hairdryer, clothes iron and ironing board. I really didn't notice the noise from our neighbor. We were on the 6th floor at the end on the hallway. There is a bar on the main floor/lobby which does get smoky at night, if there are several smokers having drinks. Otherwise, the lobby is smokefree during the day. I really didn't notice any musty/smoky smell in our room. We are from the area, so we didn't have to ask the concierge/staff where to eat, drink, shop.... The receptionists at the desk were friendly. Originally, he told us we had a room w/two twin beds and changed it to the one king-size bed at checkin (even though I book for a king through travelzoo). Overall impression, it's a nice, older hotel in a great location - on the north end of Michigan Ave/Magnificent Mile - just one block away. We didn't encounter any problems. We had a small room with a comfortable king-size bed. It's minutes from Oak Street - high-end boutique shopping. And a short 10 minute walk to some nightlife - the popular bars at Rush Street and Oak Street. Water Tower and the John Hancock Building are not very far. If you want a larger room and a hotel that's more modern, I suggest to look elsewhere. I will try to post some photos.

Reviews.Title: “The Knickerbocker is not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: jetsetera
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Knickerbocker over New years and checked out on the 2nd of January. We used Hotwire and got this hotel. From the outside the Knickerbocker looked great. I was worried when I read the reviews and well...they were pretty right on. We checked in about noon on the 31st but the room wasn't ready so we went down Michigan to do some shopping. Location is great, I do admit. We came back around 5:30pm and our room was ready. We were situated on the 5th floor at the end of the hall. We settled in and right away I noticed that the walls to the room are paper thin. I couldn't tell if my neighbour was opening his door or our door. When people talked in the room you can hear their exact conversation. The room was quite small and dark. I think we had a queen bed. The room was really musty smelling. I'm sensitive but my boyfriend is not and he suggested lighting my travel candle. I suggest bringing one. The furnishings and decor were really out of date. Their was a canopy over the top part of the bed and a mirror above your head. It was kind of spooky looking in my opinion. One of the pillow covers are covered in an old textile and I didn't trust it to be clean so I only used the one white pillow to sleep on. The bathroom had no bathtub, shower only.The tiles in the bathroom kind of looked old and dirty in my opinion. The bath products were no name so luckily we had our own to use. The clock radio has a CD players so that was a bonus as is the large TV in the room. We celebrated NYE downstairs in the bar. They were very kind enough to let us order pizza and eat it there. The only thing that bothered me was the cigar smoke. I know it's New Year's but it's gross. I used to be a smoker so I can complain. My clothes stank when I went back up to our room. When I went back to the room I smelled cigarette smoke. I don't know if it was from the hall or our neighbours but I know smoke when I smell it. The mini-bar/fridge is like a vending machine so if you are looking to store leftovers from dinner or something, you can't. I don't think that I'll stay here again if I had a choice. I suggest going to a website called ------- to get an idea of what hotel you might get from sites like Hotwire and Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location! Great price!”
Reviews.Author: Holakjs
Reviews.Content: OK, we are back from the Knickerbocker and I would give it the best rating. I can't believe the bad reviews. I got a priceline deal, and I still got a fine room, clean, up-to-date furnishings (OK a little traditional for my taste) and smoke free. Someone said in another thread that some people write prank reviews. I think such people should get a life because people want to read the truth. Here it is from my point of view. Both rooms on 10th floor. Regarding the size of the rooms. We had two rooms. One was a 2 double bed room. It was about 20' x 15'. Each double bed had valences that were kind of mini-canopies. The furniture, bathroom tile, shower (no tub), wall paper and paint had been done in the last few years. A Chinese inspired cabinet held TV, coffeemaker, ice bucket, and mini-bar. Three separate levels (TV, ice/coffee, and minibar) The other room was called "Queen executive". This one had queen bed with more of a canopy than valence, sofabed, two TVs and terry bathrobes. Also about the same size but different configerations. One TV faced the bed, other in the three level cabinet, the sofabed. Smoke in the lobby. There is a bar to the right of the entrance. It is an open arrangement so that I am sure the smoke comes from bar to entrance door. No smoke smell in no-smoking rooms. Cost of rooms $75 on priceline plus taxes. Very good value one block from N. Michigan Ave. Only complaint. Concierge said that the free trolley didn't go down Michigan Ave to Field Museum/Museum complex when in fact it does. Was this ignorance? or trying to throw more business to taxi? Either case, not good. He said at this time of year free trolley only goes to Navy Pier during winter....which is clearly incorrect.

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: Kriegler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Knickerbocker on 11-20-05 and 11-21-05. I read the reviews about the small rooms. They are accurate. The room was tiny, but clean and comforatble. I stayed on 12th floor and noise was not a problem. I got a great price ( $76/ night)- Well worth the price. I parked at self parking directly across the street for $21/day- but if you need your car, you should park valet. Location was fine, staff friendly and helpful. Great place for the price, although with 2 people in a room it may be to small- I had a king room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agorisk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Knickerbocker for work. This is an older hotel so the rooms were a bit small. I found the staff extrememly helpful and friendly. They provided me with maps of the city and suggestions on various places to go for dinner, drinks, etc. Since this is an old hotel built in the 1920's the rooms are small but the hotel is extremely charming. The location is great. If you get some time, have a drink at the bar in the Drake hotel across the street. There is a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rates & Location; Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a former Chicagoan, I know rate ($130) for this awesome location is hard to beat. But, don't expect a trendy boutique hotel, it's an an older "city" hotel with small room and small bathrooms. Decor is tired (lots of character) however, mattresses seemed new. Bathtub didn't drain well and heat/air didn't work. When we called the front desk, they blamed it on the erratic weather -- saying it's hard to regulate inside temperature when weather changes so quickly. And, after waiting about 15 mins for a bellman to retrieve my luggage from storage when leaving for airport, I found him talking to co-workers in the lobby -- he had taken my claim ticket and forgotten about me. Lobby bar a good place for cocktails (and to catch sports on tv) and bar service very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: jlm2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Knickerbocker for 3 nights for a "mom's shopping" trip. Got the classic room (#704) from Priceline for $125/night. After reading all the previous reviews, I was more than worried about this hotel. I was preparing my friend for the worst and we both were pleasantly surprised. Location- Fabulous! North end of the Magnificient Mile and South End of the Gold Coast. 1 block from Michigan Avenue(and Bloomingdale's!!) and away from all the hustle and bustle of Michigan Avenue. Room- small, but very nicely done. AC worked just fine. Beds were very comfortable and the canopies over them were a nice touch. The bathroom is small. If there are more than 2 people in your party, try the next larger room or a newer hotel. This is an older, European designed hotel, which means small rooms and bathrooms. Let's face it--if you want to live in the hotel room all day, you might want to go somewhere else. But for us, it held plenty of shopping bags just fine! Our room had a view of Walton Street. We heard minimal street noises and nothing from our neighbors. Lobby- During the day, the smoke smell was undetectable; but later in the evening, you could smell the smoke. Just walk fast to the elevators!!! Check In/Check Out- A breeze!! Concierge- One was absolutely no help whatsoever!! We asked him his favorite restaurants in the area and his response was "I like what my hotel guests like!" The second one was more helpful. Doormen- In both arriving and departing, they barely acknowledged that we were there. We rolled our own suitcases in and out and opened our own doors. I gave the Knickerbocker 4 stars (I would have truly given it 3 1/2 stars if they would have let me) for the great location, clean rooms, nice beds and the decent price we paid for it. Compared to other European hotels that I stayed in, the Knickerbocker is quite quaint! If your are looking for modern decor and big rooms and bathrooms, I'd advise looking somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Location... nothing else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millennium 10-25-05. Report card is as follows: Lobby: B+ (Historic, small, old charm and there is no offensive, smokey smell as others have noted)Staff: B (Friendly but not super attentive)Check-in: A (room was ready early) Cost: D (too much for what you get)Rooms: C- (SMALL room, uncomfortable beds and pillows, decore just ok, mostly clean) Bathroom: D (so small it's hard to get ready in, toilet not bolted down, tile is not real clean)Privacy: F (can hear everything, don't plan on sleeping in, other guests can be heard as well as street noises, there is no "white" noise to drown out the other noises) Location: A (close to everything on the Mag Mile as well as Rush St. plus we did have a nice view of the lake) Note: Hotel charges $ for internet and printing of airline boarding pass cost was $8 to get 3 boarding passes. Overall: Choose another hotel. This is not a 4 star hotel. The only thing this hotel has to offer is the location but there are plenty of others that offer the same.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, overpriced and rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker for a professional conference. Rates were exorbitant, but I at least expected a clean hotel with friendly staff. I was sorely disappointed. Room was disgusting and musty. The lobby stinks of cigarette smoke. I had to beg for extra towels. They don't change the sheets daily unless you request it. The bathroom was moldy and tiles were broken. The staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. I asked for restuarant recommendations. The first day they directed me to a chain, despite my requests for "authentic chicago food."
