The second day they tried to send me back to the same place, and seemed annoyed when I responded that I'd already eaten there and wanted to go somewhere else. The conference rooms were constantly too hot or too cold. On the last day of my conference, they refused to allow late check out. My conference ended at 12:45, and check out was required by noon. I had to talk to the manager and give him my entire list of complaints before I was allowed late check out. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience in a great, but HUGE American city”
Reviews.Author: debrockman
Reviews.Content: Now HERE's some news. The Knickerbocker is an OLD hotel. It has some mildew, it doesn't smell new. BUT!!! If you like old hotels, the Knickerbocker is a gem. Be sure to check out the ballroom on the first floor. It is BEAUTIFUL!!! Let's face it. If there is no casino attached to a hotel anymore, they just cannot build them like the Knickerbocker. Look at the details....the Lobby ceiling, the beautiful mailbox... Bear in mind as you walk around the hotel that this place was a favorite of Capone and his cronies. It will put a special aura on your visit. Everyone I encountered was wonderful.. The cute guy at the desk from New Zealand who told me all the best places in New Zealand....the great bellman from Chicago who had such an exuberant attitude (and who kept calling me "young lady"... it was contagious, to Andre at Nix who was so enthusiastic about his work that he made me enjoy my lunch twice as much. The concierge genuinely tried to be helpful. I've stayed in a lot of hotels. Sometimes a concierge has "airs". This young gentleman was just plain helpful. Much appreciated. This is a great staff. Not a snob among them. Just enthusiastic and pleasant. I ordered room service three times. Twice it was perfect. I even received hot and crispy french fries with a sandwich. That is good service. Fries just don't stay good unless they are eaten fresh. The lunch I ordered took over 45 minutes and I had to leave before it got there. I was disappointed because I had told the lady who took my order that I had to get to a meeting and wondered what she could suggest that would arrive in 20 minutes. I also ordered a chicken pasta dish that was excellent. There is also a CheeseCake Factory virtually in the next block that had great carry out. The room itself was lovely. The lovely Chinese armoire with the mini bar was really pretty as were the linens and canopy on the bed. I was by myself and felt perfectly comfortable. If you are traveling as a couple, I might suggest a larger room. The bathroom is small as other travelers have noted. But it had plenty of outlets and was just fine. And it was clean. Really clean. Even around the baseboards of the bathroom. If you have allergies (and I do), you might have some trouble here, as I do in ALL old hotels. I just kept my migraine medicine handy and I was fine. If you are going to complain about mold in old buildings stay out of them. They all have it. Get a grip. I was within a block of Bloomingdales and the John Hancock Building. Lord and Taylor and Marshall Fields were within 5 blocks, Filene's was across the street from that. Nordstroms was a little further down Michigan avenue. Younger people may want to cross over Michigan and head to State Street...there is an Urban Outfitters that direction. As always, it was great to return to my hometown of Indianapolis. I prefer a mid-sized city for living, but for a trip to the "big-city", Chicago is amazing. Thanks to the Knickerbocker staff for making me feel safe and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Stay at the Knickerbocker!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, I have traveled extensively in the US and Europe, and I found the Knickerbocker staff to be the friendliest and most professional group of employees I have ever encountered. The concierge was extraordinarily helpful with all our requests. We found the hotel itself to be simply wonderful, our rooms clean and the bathrooms spotless. The North Michigan Avenue location was ideal--close to everything we wanted. All in all, we had a great time in Chicago, made truly splendid by our stay at the Knickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you like smoke”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a "boutique" hotel, the Knickerbocker was a real disappointment. Everything seemed worn -- carpeting, wood moulding, elevators, etc. Staff seems to know that guests are often dissatisfied with the accommodations from their attitude. My biggest problem was with the stale smoke smell in the lobby, which is open to the hotel bar (the bar seems to be part of the lobby itself). This is a smoker's paradise. Even the foul smell of cigar smoke is allowed. If you are a smoker, this is your place (provided you don't mind substandard accommodations for the price). For everyone else, find somewhere else to stay. Location is great. But there are other hotels right near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bebe624
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day stay at the Knickerbocker with another friend. We thought the location of the hotel was fabulous. Walking distance to everything. The only thing that was a little far away was the EL to the Cubs game. But the location could not be beat! The staff was OK, not overly helpful or friendly for a 4 star hotel. But not rude either. Although I did find the ladies that worked at the little convienence store dowstairs a little rude. They were chatting on the phone the entire time I was there, and I could tell it was a personal call. They didn't even get off the phone while I paid. The concierge desk was also mediocre service, willing to answer questions, but not going beyond the call of duty. This is all fine, if I was told upfront this was a 3 star hotel, but they continue to advertise the Knickerbocker as a 4 star. When I see 4 stars, I expect 4 stars ... and that they did not live up to. The rooms were very small, we requested 2 queen sized beds, but they only have 2 full size beds. So we took it! Furniture was outdated. One of the phones in our room did not work. The bathroom was tiny, with no vents (bring matches or air freshner) If someone is in the bathroom the person in the bedroom can hear everything, even with the TV on. That would have been a little embarrassing if this was a romantic retreat. Then when the toilet flushes ... oh my god stand back... it's the loudest flush I have heard in my life! I would not stay here again, just because there are so many choices of hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “A 2-star hotel in a 5-star neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBristol
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4-night stay at the Knickerbocker and have very mixed feelings about the place. I guess I should look at it as a case of getting what you pay for. For starters, the hotel accepted my Priceline bid of $95/night. With taxes and fees the cost came to $112/night, which was a great bargain for that neighborhood. It is undoubtedly among the most upscale downtown districts between New York and Los Angeles. The Ritz-Carlton is 2 blocks away; the Drake is diagonally across the street. Rooms at the Drake start at $359/night. I found the Knickerbocker staff to be astonishingly unhelpful, for an (allegedly) 4-star establishment. The doormen seemed to set the tone. I arrived by cab with several pieces of luggage. No one came forward to assist me even though at least one fellow appeared completely unoccupied. A couple of nights later I again arrived by cab. Two uniformed doormen, whose names were Atiku and Bonus, stood and chatted with a friend while I exited the cab. Neither man paid me the slightest attention. In most other 4-star hotels, the staff goes out of their way to greet you cheerfully. I noticed that in the Knickerbocker they generally avoid eye contact. I also thought it interesting that at checkout the desk clerk did not ask me how I had enjoyed my stay. At checkout I noticed there were several plaques on the wall, attesting AAA had awarded the Knickerbocker Four Diamonds for several years up to 2004. However, there was no 2005 award. A check at the AAA web site confirms they did not make that grade for 2005. My room was small and mostly adequate. I had requested a king bed room on a non-smoking floor, and got what I wanted. However, I thought the mattress was a definite step down from other 4-star hotels, and I was not impressed with the quality of the linens and blankets. The room had a VERY noticeable mildew smell. I suspect the mildew was growing in the air conditioning ducts. I could mitigate the smell by turning up the fan or opening the window. Sadly, both options made the room drafty and noisy. The bathroom was small and everything worked. But it appeared to me the plumbing fixtures were the cheapest available. The bathtub fixtures were identical to the variety I see in Wal-Mart. The toilet was not affixed properly to the floor and wobbled every time I sat on it. There was a vent high up on the bathroom wall. It communicated directly with the bathroom in the adjacent room. This meant I was treated to every bathroom sound my neighbors made. The second day I was there, the Internet service crashed hotel-wide and stayed down for most of the day. I had no way of knowing this as I sat in my room and struggled to connect for more than an hour. I called the service's 800 number twice, trying to figure out what was going on. I ended up going to the hotel's tiny business center and paid $15 for 45 minutes of online time. At checkout, I saw the Knickerbocker had charged me $10 for Internet that day plus $2.50 for the calls to the 800 number. I looked at the menu at Nix, the in-house restaurant, and it did not tempt me at all. I never saw more than a handful of people in there. Fortunately, there were many excellent places nearby. Basically I would rate this place as a 2-star establishment that has somehow conned its way into the 4-star club. Considering its stellar location, the price of $112 per night was a great value. Had I paid more, though, I would have felt really ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain”
Reviews.Author: schwarz6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker for 3 nights this past weekend and were pleasantly surprised. After reading some of the reviews which were posted, we were a bit uncomfortable with our choice. However, we truly had a wonderful experience there. Through Priceline, we paid $110/night and originally asked for a king size room. We were a bit disappointed to find that we were given queen size accomodations in a very small room. We called the desk and were told that the only king size was in a smoking room (which we absolutely did not want). So we spent the first night in the smaller room, which was not too terrible. We were told to call the next day at 10 am to change rooms. At exactly 10 am the next morning, we received a call and were told that our king size room on the same floor was available. This room was extremely comfortable. Nice comfortable bed, great shower, and hard foam pillows which I had requested were brought right up. Staff was extremely pleasant, concierge was very helpful, and the location 1 block from Michigan Ave was the best! By the way, I did NOT see ANY mold anywhere (which was mentioned in other reviews), in fact, the rooms seemed freshly painted. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems with the Knick”
Reviews.Author: Anglofyl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over a long July 4th weekend. We'd been to one other boutique hotel, the Fitzpatrick, and loved it, so were looking forward to our stay at the Knick. The location can't be beat. Many of the service people were helpful but were obviously looking for money, which we gave them. I'm not naive - I know the staff need to be tipped but this was somewhat aggressive. The lobby was very chic, and the room decor wasn't awful, but some lights didn't work and the fridge was mostly an in-room vending machine with about 6 inches of free space. Ours was occupied by an earlier tenant's duck pate. I didn't enjoy having to throw it away myself. The hotel advertises bathrobes and turn down service which you get only if you call and ask for them. The robes were so worn and torn I never could put mine on. The turn down service was obviously difficult for the staff person who arrived to do it. I left a couple of dollars tip and when she saw it she sneered and did the minimum. The room was moderately clean, the bathroom was super small and the towel rack kept falling off the wall. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Bathrooms/Moldy Ceiling”
Reviews.Author: BensMom
Reviews.Content: To begin with, the very first moment you walk into this hotel, you are greeted with a stale, smokey stench. Even a smoker would be turned off! We spent three nights here and will NEVER return to this has been of a so called luxury hotel. The first room we were given (804) was furnished shabbily, but the worst thing about this room was the ceiling black with mold and mildew in the entryway! Room # 2...... (1204) We were given this room after having to wait until after 3pm to change, we were sightseeing and came back just before dinner to change and leave again. Well this room was smaller (if that's possible) AND the bathroom was filthy with scum and mildew (photo's attached to support this). I called to complain, the manager called me back and offered the excuse that the hotel was going to have the carpet changed in the hallways.............blah, blah...... so what? Is that supposed to make our horrible room better?? The lady at the front desk offered us a free breakfast. And I agreed never to stay in this dump again! Do yourself a favor and sleep elsewhere, anywhere but here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyover11
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Great ambience. Just steps off Michigan Avenue. A quick walk to the free trolley stop. The rooms are elegantly appointed and very clean. The Concierge was wonderful in making dinner reservations and suggesting tours. The best part was being a block from the Oak Street Beach in the middle of July. The perfect place to take a dip on a hot July day. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Worst decor I've Ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Citylove09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had planned a vacation in Chicago for a chairty event from the 14-18th and our last night we decided to stay at this hotel. The pictures looked amazing and the price seemed resonable. We were really excited to get to our room and see what it looked like. So we get to our room and we could not believe how old fashioned it was. We'd stayed at 2 other hotels in the 3 days we'd been in the city and this hotel did not even come close. SERIOUSLY, the decor is SO OLD it's not even funny. Yes, we were aware that it was an old hotel, but this was just to much for our comfort. We had asked for a VIEW of something and all we got was the hotel across the street and some emergency exit stairs. The room smelled old and musty, not to mention it was just creapy being in there, the so called "cannopy" beds didn't even come out of their confines, the bathroom is by far the tiniest i've ever seen in my life. I've seen outhouses bigger then these! It's like a shower, toilet and sink all shoved into a closet. Hardly enough room to move. Neither one of us felt "at home" nor comfortable enough to sleep there. I called down to the front desk, explained the room was NOTHING like I had reserved and asked if we could SOMEHOW cancelle our reservations but I was told nothing could be done so we were forced to stay there. The lamp beside the beds didn't work, the room had and internet keyboard but was not 'eqipped" to do so. The so called computer rooms are crazy! They charge you 5 bucks for the 1st hour and 20 bucks for so on. Most hotels INCLUDE that in your hotel stay. I know myself, nor my friend will ever stay here again. It's seriously like staying in a room in the 1950's so if your old enough to enjoy that, go for it but anyone who enjoys tasteful furniture and SOME COLOR, I don't advise this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Join in with the rest of the world!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Who allows smoking in public areas anymore? This was the nastiest thing of the hotel. Such a beautiful lobby, but the experience was ruined by smoking that made the entire place wreak! What a way to ruin an otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We rolled the dice, and this was the hotel that was chosen for us on "that website where you choose your own price." Overall, we were very pleased. The location on the northern end of the Magnificent Mile was perfect. We never used the car from the time we arrived until the time we left the city. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, and the staff courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 4 Days at the Knickerbocker in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews about the hotel before I went to Chicago, and I was a little leery. To my utter surprise, and pleasure, I found the hotel to be absolutely beautiful and the personel extremely friendly and helpful. I was in a wheelchair, and someone was there to help me in and off the elevator, and in/out the door at my every whim. I attended a wedding reception in the Crystal Ballroom, and the beauty of the room took my breath away. The dinner was delicious, and served to perfection. The only thing that should be changed is the shower. Water stood in the floor after we showered, but housekeeping was very helpful, and brought extra towels to mop up the excess water. I would stay at the Knickerbocker again in a heartbeat. I have passed some brochures along to friends already. A very happy occupant. Su

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay There Again Unless I had To”
Reviews.Author: QUYNH73
Reviews.Content: Up until I actually got there, it was a very stressful experience. The month before I was due to arrive, I booked the room over the phone to confirm my reservation. They never gave me a confirmation # and said that my reservation was set to go. However, instinctually, I check the week before leaving to make sure my reservation was intact. NO RESERVATION COULD BE FOUND. So, they could only give me a new reservation 2 of the 3 nights I had originally booked for and I had to find another room at another hotel for more money. They were NOT understanding or caring or sympathetic. The only nice person was our concierge, Leslie. And, the rooms and bathroom are extremely small. Not quite the experience I had anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Content: Very old motel, just like The Drake across the street. Small rooms, but very clean and quiet. The Drake is a little more "grand" but the "Knick" is usually cheaper. Great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am disapponted with this hotel. I will not spend my money with them again. After making reservations for a particular room and calling the day of the check in to cofirm the room, I didn't get what I made reservations for. The 2nd item of displeasure is, I reserved the room with my business credit card and paid for it with my personal debit card upon checking out. Of course the charges went through right away on my debit card but the card that was used to reserve the room are still there and I was treated uncaring at very best by the person in accounting. There has to be a number of hotels in Chicago that understand customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking In Many Areas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon scanning several possiblitlies to serve up the flavor of old Chicago, I found this hotel lacking in room size and especially bathroom size. The bathroom was incredibly small with no tub which becomes a real issue when travelling with a small child. The amenities were low grade, such as towels and toilet paper. Not exactly the top of the line. The minibar was outrageous, especially if you needed a bottled water at night. Overall the housekeeping was there quickly when requesting extra towels, but for the price per night, the instructions on how to conserve each towel seemed a bit "on the cheap". On a positive note, Room Service was always on time and accompanied by friendly staff. I would not stay there again...would look for "old Chicago" somewhere else. We had a great view of The Drake!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: klenc
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire so did not know the name of the hotel until after I had purchased it. I then read the reviews here and was a bit hesitant. The location cannot be beat. For those of you that are familiar with Chicago - this is the old Playboy Club. I loved the lobby bar with live piano music. The drinks were pricy ($9.00) but I figure I got my $$$ worth with the music and atmosphere. Upon checkin we were asked if we wanted 2 doubles or a king bed. The clerk was very accomodating. We took the doubles. THe room was spacious with elegant bedding and draperies. The bathroom was small but functional. When I looked at the fire escape plan on the back of the door - I noticed the rooms directly across the hall were smaller on the drawing. I then realized the room we were in was handicap accessible so that is probably why the size was generous (room 505). I would definitetly stay here again. I would however call the hotel directly before booking online. We found out there was a special that included free parking. The special was $10.00 less than we paid online and that did not include parking.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck....”
Reviews.Author: angusoaks11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a Sunday night in April 2005. I booked online and requested the cleanest nicest room possible in the rate that I had chosen. Well....if that was the cleanest nicest room that they had they are in BIG trouble. The bathroom was small but sufficient, it stunk of mildew. There was no exhaust fan and all of the grout was filthy dirty. The decor was neat. Somewhat Europian Boutique. The problem was that they cute decor was thrown into a pit. This room was at the end of the hall with a window that smashed up against a brick wall. The crown molding was in very poor shape, years of poor maintenance had left it partly scraped and poorly repainted many times. The baseboards were even worse. The wiring in the room consisted of a few power strips tacked to the wall. At one point a tried to swing the bed side wall sconce over to light an area better and it almost fell off of the wall. The hotel was small and charming but very old and in need of some major renovations. I'm sure at $175 (with room, tax and parking) we would have been better off somewhere else. There were many more places to stay that I would have gladly paid the extra $20 or $30 for had I known better. P.S. the "Martini Bar"....what a joke. And there was absolutely no live Jazz either. Don't stay here unless you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great time for $99 per night!”
Reviews.Author: d27pat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our two grandchildren from 3/23 to 3/31. Nothing but good things to say, except that we must agree with the comment that the walls are paper thin. Other than that, clean, friendly, lovely decor, our window overlooked an alleyway, but who cares? The location is ideal, the concierge was helpful every time we asked questions, the front desk was efficient, and the restaurant was a class act with good food. Can't comment on the martini bar, we don't drink, but it looked elegant and classy. Would definitely go back again--so what if the bathroom is small. You're in Chicago for heavens sake, so get out and see the city!! Pat from NYC

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyRDH
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Knickerbocker is a beautiful old hotel in a central location. The rooms are uniquely decorated and comfortable. The staff working in the hotel were very helpful and pleasant. The restaurant in the lobby had great breakfast food and excellent service. My only complaint is that part of the lobby is also a bar. The area is a smoking area and was offensively smokie. The smell extended throughout the lobby into the restaurant, to the elevators and into the public restroom area. Aside from the cigarette smoke in the lobby I would say the rest of the hotel was excellent. Making the lobby smoke free by keeping all public areas non-smoking is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Knickerbocker's Interesting history”
Reviews.Author: gohde16
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Knickerbacker. The history of the hotel was interesting and the ball room with its lit dancefloor was amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed the dining room and the piano bar. The staff were very friendly and we felt welcomed by most. The room itself did not seem outstanding in its decor, though, and the bathroom was extremely small. We probably won't stay at this hotel again, as there are so many hotels in Chicago to experience, but would strongly recommend this hotel for those history buffs wanting to experience a piece of the golden years.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kim75
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Knickerbocker, and I will not return. It came nowhere near being worth the price I paid. Hotel Burnham is twice the hotel at half the price! The bathroom was unbelieveably small and smelled terribly. We had to call the front desk twice before towels that we requested were delivered (which frankly may as well have been paper towels, nothing plush about them at all). We didn't have enough pillows and when we requested an extra it was never delivered. Room service cart was left outside our door all night. All in all, it was a very disappointing stay. The only redeeming quality of this hotel seems to be its location. And for me, it's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “super knicker”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a three day break in late january based on the reviews I read on trip advisor.I really must mention the bellboy,Tom is his name and I have not met a more friendlier member of hotel staff in my life.Nothing was too difficult for him and he seemed to enjoy the fact that we were having a great time.The hotel is very good,and the cocktail bar great craic.We travelled from Ireland for our short break and we found a jewel in the knickerbocker.I cannot recomend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and unique hotel off Michigan Ave!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJayhawk
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel was one of the most beautiful and elegant hotels my husband and I have been to in ages. Even though we live in Chicago, it was a beautiful getaway from our everyday lives. The room we stayed in was IMMACULATE. Everything was absolutely perfect and clean (I could literally see my reflection in the counters in the bathroom). The staff was so friendly. They even had the chef agree to accommodate a very special meal for us through room service. The front desk staff was especially helpful with arranging massage accommodations for us at a spa next door and they even gave us a horse drawn carriage ride for free. The Crystal Ballroom in the hotel is beyond exquisite. To anyone who is looking for a wedding reception location downtown -- this place is a MUST SEE!!! Overall, this place gets an A+ across the board. They really do know how to treat their guests and go above and beyond the call of duty. So if you're looking for a beautiful hotel with a fantastic location, check out this european boutique hotel for a vacation you won't forget!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live in Chicago and stayed at this hotel for my birthday as a special treat. It wasn't very special from a quality point of view, although we still had a great time and made the most of it. First of all, the front desk staff seems uninterested, unprofessional and unhelpful. Second, the Martini Bar is located right in the main lobby and as a result you are greeted with a cloud of smoke as you enter and leave. Our room was definitely not what you would expect from a 4 diamond hotel and was what really earned the rating I gave. It was small, but that is actually pretty typical for hotels in this location (right off of Michigan Ave across from the Drake). We arrived in our room at 10:30 pm following a lovely dinner and found the toilet seat to have *something* on it. As we were exhausted from trekking through the snow, we wiped it off and made due. But it was extreely digusting. The bed linens were nothing special or comfortable. The cd player didn't work. The worst thing was, the walls here are paper thin. We could her every word from the room next door as well as the every- -30 --seconds ringing of a cell phone or blackberry from the room on the other side. We called down to the desk and the woman hung up on me after saying she would ring the room. That was helpful (sarcasm). Luckily they(people with constant ringing phone) came home around midnight or so and we were able to get some sleep. In the morning, my husband took a shower and the tub filled with water and did not drain AT ALL-so, no shower for me. Also, the towels were really really rough. That may sound nit-picky, but I've never had that experience at an upscale hotel before. The bathrooms are extremely small with no frills. Very comparable to a Holiday Inn or other cheaper chain bathroom. The restaurant was ok for breakfast, but the smoking section is right at the entrance, so even though we were seated in non-smoking, we had to walk through the smoking section upon entering and existing. It took the valet 40 minutes to bring our car after they quoted us 15. All in all, it is a great location, but that's about it in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “I will spend my money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are major problems at this hotel. Our room had a broken closet door, an unseated toilet, and a bad smell. When we walked into the room, we noticed a small "sex toy" haning from one of the bedside table lamp. This was obviously left from a previous user of this room. We also found that the room next door had problems with it's fire alarm. Every 10 minutes it beeped. When they finally "reset" it, it started again a few hours later. We were also charged $9.95 per DAY for internet usage. Most hotels offer this service free of charge. One ammenity I liked was the free newspaper every day, but despite asking, we never received one. We were very disappointed and will not return to the Knickerbocker. The people were kind and friendly, but it was not enough to make up for all that was not done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwingsfan25
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights at the Knickerbocker. Went up to Chicago for some last minute Christmas shopping. Hotel is in a great location. North end of Michigan Ave. about half a block away. Staff was very nice and professional. Everyone we came in contact with was very helpful. Granted this is a older hotel and some of the rooms are no bigger than closets. We were booked into a standard room and when we arrived we upgraded to a deluxe room. Good size room, with nice furnishings and a comfortable bed. Bathroom was somewhat small. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room every day. Did not eat at the restaurant Nix, but saw several people getting orders delivered to the bar. Overheard comments saying the food was very good. Drink service at the Martini Bar can be slow. Martinis run $9 and up. Very good drinks and they don't shy away from the liquor. Valet parking was $35 a day with in/out priviliges. Overall a great stay. Would definately stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Knickerbocker!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; friendly/helpful staff; room was small but clean and well-decorated--full of European ambiance!! The food was delicious and the lounge was a wonderful place to relax. Excellent value for rate paid. I was very pleasantly surprised since a few of the reviews on this site were so negative. I would certainly return to the Knickerbocker. It was a treat to be a little part of Chicago's history.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get the right price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire and stayed two weekend nights for $98 per night + taxes. That's a deal for this location. Rooms were more than adequate with partial lake view; large and extremely comfortable bed; room and bathroom were clean. Good bar scene after midnight and the staff was very accomodating. Parking is $35 a night, about average for North Michigan Avenue. There is no parking gargage at the hotel so you must use the valet service which can be slow (15-20 min.) during peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it really is that bad...”
Reviews.Author: TBagz
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at this hotel for a full week and after 3 days I had no choice but to check out. As soon as I got to my room it was a mess and the toilet was plugged up. The service was rude (except for the room service delivery gentleman who was first class) and the rooms are sooo tiny. Nowhere to even put your suitcase down... The TV only has about 12 channels (when they work) and the internet service only works if you place half a dozen calls to the tech service people (get the direct #, the front desk obviousely can not be bothered to help you once they have your credit card #). Overall extremely dissapointed, thought this hotel might be charming but it is just a dump in an otherwise wonderful area.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with our stay at the Knickerbocker Hotel. We got our reservations through Priceline, but they did not come cheap. The room was as small as a closet, and the noise was unbearable. Very few channels on the TV and the "vending machine" in the room was tacky. You could not even get to it because the size of the room made it nearly impossible to open the door! The bell hop at check out was rude to us and to our limo driver. He was nowhere to be found, so we moved our luggage out ourselves and when he finally came back from break he cursed us! We did find the accomodations very clean and well appointed. The concierge service was kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Up to par ..... not to price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed two nights and for what I paid. $169.00 first night and $229.00 for the same room second night I was not too impressed. THe conceirge and bellman, front desk staff were all very helpful. When paying this price I prefer a more modern hotel - while the old charm is charming ( my room had one queen bed and two full bathrooms??) - I would still prefer modern. I did not appreciate being charged for local calls and 800 numbers - no free internet access. They need to look at what the competition is doing - this would be one of the main reasons I would not return. In short I'd like more value at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Need to honor reservations and provide better service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel that in a little corner of the front lobby, with only 2 employees, you check in. It takes forever to get checked in. Also, checking out it took over 30 min. to get the car from valet. This was my second time at the hotel. The first time was worse. I have reserved a room with 2 beds(there were 4 of us) directly with the hotel. When we got to the hotel they said they did not have any rooms with double beds available, people had overstayed the night before so they did not have any rooms available. They put us in a small room with a king bed and squeezed in 2 single beds. We were wall to wall beds! There are plenty of nice hotels near the mile for less price and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews we were a little bit sceptical about chosing the Knickerbocker Hotel. It was though a very pleasant surprise. The staff was polite, dynamic and helpful. The rooms were extremelly clean and comfortable. Yes, rooms are small (though not too small for a big city) but decoration is original and beautiful. The piano in the lobby is a big plus. The first excellent point about this hotel is its charm. The second its perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED my stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had also read poor reviews of this hotel, but could not have BEEN more pleased. I got the park and play package (just $129 a night for unlimited in-out and a large classic room with two bathrooms). One had a stand up shower and was larger, the other was smaller with a tub-shower combo. The room was nice and clean, and I had outstanding service from everyone there. The people in NiX (the restuaurant) were very kind and helpful even though we were just eating the free breakfast. You are a block from the John Hancock building and right behind a Louis Vuitton store. PLENTY of great shopping and bars within walking distance, and the CTA stops are relatively nearby as well. I would not HESITATE to stay here again next time I come to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Ruff around the Edges! No way this is a 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's Aug 17 and earlier this morning I gladly checked out of your establishment. I could not wait until I arrived home to e-mail my un-satisfactory experience at the hotel. Upon arrival I was so so greeted by the front desk ladies. It seemed through there facial expressions that I might have been bothering them. I also made the mistake of booking through priceline. I was giving the keys to my room and when I opened the door, my first impression was of a tiny little box. I'm a big guy and I need space. It had a dusty feel and I thought the ceiling tile was going to fall upon my head. Visually, it was not very nice. I figured I would let that slide because all I was doing there was sleeping. Yet, the more I looked at it the worse it got. I could go on and on about how I will never come back to the Nickerbocker.

Reviews.Title: “The real deal on the Knickerbocker”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a 4 star hotel, this place is left much to be desired. Add an inattentive staff to the lackluster accomodations, and you've got the very medicocre Knickerbocker. Any hotel you stay at on Chicago's Magnificent Mile is in a "good location," but this one is a short building tucked away on one of the back streets toward the end of the "Mile", so views, accessibility, and scenery are not the best. No one on the staff took the extra mile here - service was bare bone. At the front desk, at the conceirge (an aging, befuddling old man, who - while cute - did not know much about the city), at the restaurant, at the front door - nothing was spectacular. The rooms feature lithographed copies of oil paintings in peeling frames, as well as a few other amenities which had seen better days. The TV selection featured only a dozen channels (even every budget hotel these days has a larger selection). The tiny rooms have paper thin walls, which make the plumbing, the conversations, and the movement of all your neighboring guests sound like they are in the room with you. All night. The bathroom had a stand up shower but no bathtub. At the Knickerbocker, the free internet is not free, the complimentary turn down service is not automatic, and the nostalgic charm this historic hotel COULD have, is muted under the management of the current owners. Among Chicago's grand lobbies and beautiful buildings, the Knickerbocker does not even compare. If you pricelined this hotel, oh well, you could do worse while in Chicago. If you are planning on paying full price for this hotel, stay somewhere else and be much happier.

HotelInfo.Name: Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel Chicago
HotelInfo.Address: 163 East Walton Place, at N. Michigan Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611
